title: Marketing Internship
text: marketing internship job - republic - toronto, on | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobsfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province marketing internship republic - toronto, on position: internshipdates: october – december 22, 2017location: liberty village, toronto oncompensation: unpaid. a $500 honourarium will be given upon a successful completion the internship.republicwe free stories of passion and purpose, with passion and purposeour story.we are a place where talent from across marketing disciplines can come together for one purpose: to tell the stories of the brands and businesses that are making a difference - in their industries, in their communities and in our world.we believe.what you stand for is as important as what you sell.our clients.our clients are catalysts, change makers and community builders. we don't work for them, we partner with them. we are invested in them – intellectually, emotionally and sometimes even financially - to help them advance their purpose and grow their business.how we do it.we think like our clients. we create like an agency.internshipin the storytelling process, envision yourself as an apprentice - one who assists our team in developing the backstory to many of our projects and campaigns, all the while laying a strong foundation to a bright and exciting career. you will gain knowledge in all forms of the communication industry and develop a solid understanding of all key elements of our client work by supporting our programs and projects across the agency to ensure timely, cost effective, quality management and delivery.you are described as…courageouscuriousentrepreneurialempatheticcollaborative or team focuseddetailed and organizedresourcefulauthentica day in the life of your internship… organize - support - learnfor our clients:contact reportsmedia materials/coveragememosdigital and social media – coverage monitoring and reportingadministrative support to account leadslogistical support during activationsresearch / analyticsfor republic:track billable hoursdigital and social media - posting and reportingnew business initiativesour internal servertracking of republic, client and industry newsdatabase and media listsresearchhow we will define your success…deliver all work on time and on budgetmy team lead see me as positively contributing to republic and our clients’ successrequirements…post-secondary degree or diploma in marketing or communications (in progress or completed)competent computer software skills in mac and microsoft office programs (word, excel, powerpoint)you are looking for a fun and exciting opportunity to kick start your careerprevious experience in marketing and/or communications is an assetps…the experience you will gain through this internship with far outweigh the pay. you will do more than just paper push and get coffee; you will have the opportunity to work directly on client work with our account teams. because each of our clients’ stories are diverse, you will be a part of campaigns and projects that will touch a variety of disciplines from digital marketing to advertising to media relations (and the list goes on).we are looking for superstars who see the experience gained through this internship as a valuable opportunity to learn and be mentored by some of the industry’s leaders.a $500 honorarium will be given upon a successful completion the internship.job type: full-timejob location:toronto, onrequired experience:communications: 1 year 5 days ago - and delivering great experiences reverberates through every fibre of our company. we are always on the outlook for talented people who want to contribute to our success. talent isn't everything though: a strong personality fit with the existing team is also a top priority. as a startup with big ambitions, every member of our team has the opportunity to help define our company and grow with us. we work hard but respect each other's lives outside of the office and believe in having fun while at work. if orchard sounds like a place you'd like to work, let us know at jobs@getorchard.com. our open positions front-end developer we are looking for a front end developer to help us build a platform that enables a smooth and simple experience for our customers. our building process is mindful of striking a balance between beautiful, elegant design and best practices when driving sales. we take great pride in our work and it is an important part of who we are. making an elegant, yet reliable recommerce solution is not easy, but for us it's a labour of love. if you share our passion for this problem, and want to play a defining role on a small but dedicated team, please apply. our ideal skill set is below, but don't worry if you don't check all of these boxes; a great culture fit is much more important to us than your skill set today. - html 5, css 3 - responsive design and bootstrap - pre-compiled syntaxes like sass and less - javascript, ajax, and jquery - understanding of user-centred design - experience developing for mobile devices apply for this position back-end php developer we are looking for a back-end php developer to help us build a back-end that helps us deliver a smooth and simple experience for our customers. we take great pride in our work and it is an important part of who we are. making an elegant, yet reliable recommerce solution is not easy, particularly on the back end, but for us it's a labour of love. if you share our passion for this problem, and want to play a defining role on a small but dedicated team, please apply. our ideal skill set is below, but don't worry if you don't check all of these boxes; a great culture fit is much more important to us than your skill set today. - php/mysql (experience with oop style mvc) - frameworks: codeigniter and yii 2 - html, css - javascript, ajax, and jquery - git - amazon aws apply for this position customer advocate at the forefront of used iphone sales, orchard is looking for a passionate and skilled customer service representative to help our users work through any questions or concerns they might have before, after, or during their experience with us. in this role, you will be responsible for being the voice of orchard - we will rely on you to make sure that all of our buyers and sellers are supported. this means you should be motivated, friendly, knowledgeable, and able to communicate complex ideas in a way that anyone could understand. you can identify what is a bug and what is user error, and you can guide someone to a solution in either case. as a member of the support team, you will: - interact with customers via our support site (powered by desk.com), email, and phone - review, revise, and add to our documentation and knowledge base - develop an in-depth knowledge of our product, which you will use to recognize and solve problems for our users - uphold a superior level of customer satisfaction and build trust and loyalty within our customer base - troubleshoot issues with both iphone hardware and software - recognize trends in issues and complaints and suggest product and policy changes to address these - support our customers in both english and french. a command of both written and spoken french is a requirement for this position. the candidate of our dreams should: - be confident in solving more than just issues with orders - experience fixing iphones or other devices would make you an asset - exhibit an "all hands on deck" and "roll up your sleeves" work ethic - be able to work quickly and feel comfortable in a fast-paced environment. we move quickly and need you to be able to do the same. - love our customers. we don't exactly expect you to love them right now, but our customers motivate almost all our decisions. making their lives easier is basically what we're here for. apply for this position marketing lead the opportunity orchard is a toronto-based startup dedicated to making high quality phones accessible to more people. we spend every day building new tools and technologies to change the face of online re-commerce— because when people are able to buy and sell used with confidence, the cost of owning a device comes down for everyone. with an expansion into the us market, partnerships with big players in the wireless space, and more 5-star reviews than we can count, orchard is growing. fast. that's why we're looking to add a marketing lead to our team who will be dedicated to managing our online marketing activities. you will be responsible for quarterbacking our marketing campaigns and mapping their impact on our core business metrics. this means analyzing which channels are winning and deserve more investment, which channels need additional effort to become profitable, and which channels we should abandon altogether. additionally, you will be responsible for identifying new areas for experimentation, and subsequently determining whether these channels hold promise. our ideal candidate would be just as comfortable doing a deep dive on web analytics as researching a strategy for a new acquisition channel. in order to fill this role, you’ll need experience with online acquisition and web analytics, but don’t worry if you don’t check the remaining boxes: we believe in intelligence and drive more than experience: in-depth understanding of google analytics, mixpanel and/or segment is essential a passion for experimentation in, and careful measuring of, online acquisition experience executing and tracking the success of online marketing campaigns, ideally with smaller companies a thorough understanding of the content side of seo would be a big plus experience with app attribution and in-app analytics also a big a plus what we offer this in an integral role within orchard, and anyone filling it will have an outsized impact on the business. you’ll work shoulder-to-shoulder with a dedicated and results-oriented founding team at a high-growth startup with enormous ambitions. we set the bar high in terms of performance but are happy to accommodate different work styles and schedules. $70,000 - $100,000 depending on experience competitive options package attractive benefits package high-impact work as a member of a small, cohesive team apply for this position operations manager the opportunity orchard is a toronto-based startup dedicated to making high quality phones accessible to more people. we spend every day building new tools and technologies to change the face of online re-commerce— because when people are able to buy and sell used with confidence, the cost of owning a device comes down for everyone. with an expansion into the us market, partnerships with big players in the wireless space, and more 5-star reviews than we can count, orchard is growing. there is an ever-expanding list of things that need to be done, and not enough people to tend to them all, which is why we are looking for an operations manager to lighten the load. the role will be varied and will certainly evolve through time, but today would include a little bit of everything: marketing, accounting, admin, payments, and logistics planning. this is certainly not a job for everyone: you should be a self-starter who can look at a problem you’ve never seen before and determine what resources you need to solve it. you should thrive on a challenge and hard work, and have a track record of finding ways to make an impact, and be someone who is dogged in your pursuit of a goal or target. please address your cover letter to alex sebastian and cite an instance that you were thrown into a situation and were forced to rely on your logic and/or instincts to work your way out. what we offer this role represents an unparalleled learning experience for anyone who intends to start their own company. the breadth of your responsibilities will be perfect training for being a founder in your own right and you will work very closely with and have unlimited access to orchard’s founding team. we are flexible in terms of how you get your work done, so long as the results are there. we are a results-oriented culture and conduct quarterly performance reviews because we firmly believe in rewarding our top performing employees. other perks of working at orchard: competitive salary, based on experience competitive options package attractive benefits package high-impact work as a member of a small, cohesive team snacks and regular expansion into the us market, partnerships with big players in the wireless space, and more 5-star reviews than we can count, orchard is growing. not only that, but we are looking to expand the range of devices that we support, which is why we are looking for an android developer to help us build an android version of our diagnostic and seller onboarding ios app. the following represents our ideal skillset. importantly we believe in developing people, so don’t hesitate to apply if you do not tick all boxes: strong understanding of the android os and platform able to extract os/hardware information experience building restful apps strong background in implementing ui/ux to spec (our designers expect vigilance!) attention to detail never-say-die attitude when confronted by technical challenge bonus: experience building restful web services, objective c or php what we offer this in a very important role within orchard, as you will be leading our charge into a new platform/ecosystem. you’ll work shoulder-to-shoulder with a dedicated and results-oriented founding team at a high-growth startup with enormous ambitions. we set the bar high in terms of performance title: Gestionnaire stratégie dacquisition de la clientèle
text:
la vie en rose commerce électronique carrières | gestionnaire stratégie d’acquisition de la clientèle | montréal, quebec, canada trouvez une boutique | inscription info-lettre | english soutien-gorge culotte lingerie pyjama & détente maillot accessorie homme cadeaux soldes accueil / liste des postes / gestionnaire stratégie d’acquisition de la clientèle liste des postes mon profil alerte courriel aide gestionnaire stratégie d’acquisition de la clientèle addthis | email favorites linkedin facebook twitter

pour afficher cette page vous avez besoin d'un navigateur avec javascript.

titre du poste :  gestionnaire stratégie d’acquisition de la clientèle ville, province / état, pays :  montréal, quebec, canada catégorie d'emploi :  commerce électronique date d'affichage (jj/mm/aaaa) :  20/09/2017 fondée en 1985, la vie en rose a su se démarquer comme leader canadien dans le domaine de la lingerie et des maillots avec plus de 2600 employés. l’entreprise compte plus de 230 magasins à travers le canada, et notre but ultime est de vous faire sentir belle et confortable dans notre lingerie et nos maillots de bain et de vous offrir un service à la clientèle remarquable. de plus, depuis 2006 nous avons percé le marché international et notre marque est désormais représentée dans 18 pays.à la vie en rose, les employés sont l’actif le plus important de la compagnie. il est important pour nous que les employés se sentent appréciés dans leur travail. c’est pourquoi nous encourageons les promotions à l’interne et offrons les meilleures formations possibles à nos employés afin qu’ils développent tous une belle et longue carrière à la vie en rose. raison d'être de l'emploi le titulaire de ce poste doit élaborer les stratégies d’acquisition de la clientèle omni-canaux et guider les firmes et consultants externes afin que les meilleures pratiques d’acquisition sem et seo soient appliquées. de plus, il doit agir à titre de leader positif en assurant une grande synergie des activités auprès des autres départements. description des tâches - établir et communiquer les orientations, les stratégies, les objectifs et le calendrier de l’acquisition de la clientèle et ce, pour les bannières la vie en rose et bikini village ; -gérer avec les firmes et consultants externes les stratégies d’acquisition de clientèle en ligne via les médias digitaux ;- favoriser l’expansion de notre clientèle et l’engagement envers la marque ;-planifier avec les différents intervenants les stratégies de marketing et de promotions des produits en ligne et en magasin pour qu’il y ait une cohérence des messages et de l’image;-promouvoir un message clair selon le positionnement de la marque voulu en convergence avec le message marketing en magasin, en ligne et autre médias ;-développer avec les consultants et firmes externes les stratégies de sem, seo et facebook ads ;-contribuer à l’augmentation du taux de conversion et des ventes en mettant en place différentes stratégies d’acquisition de la clientèle ;- synchroniser les campagnes et les assortiments de produits en se basant sur l’historique, sur le taux de conversion et les autres données disponibles ;-collaborer, être à l’écoute et réagir aux opportunités d’acquisition de la clientèle soulevés par les autres départements;-développer les stratégies de programme d’affiliation; - fournir aux différents départements des données par rapport aux opportunités de marché ainsi qu’aux tendances d'achat et ce avec la collaboration du département d'engagement de la clientèle ;-négocier les ententes avec les firmes et consultants externes ;-gérer les calendriers ainsi que les budgets de l’acquisition marketing ;-participer à d’autres projets marketing au besoin. exigences  un baccalauréat en concentration marketing, commerce électronique ou équivalent ; un minimum de 5 ans d’expérience pertinente est requis en marketing et commerce électronique ;  bilingue, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit ; connaissance des meilleures pratiques en commerce électronique, sem et seo ; expérience dans le commerce du détail et le commerce électronique (atout); leadership, bonnes aptitudes de communication et persuasion ; souci du détail, sens de l’organisation et des priorités ; capacité à travailler sous pression dans un environnement en constante évolution ; capacité à gérer plusieurs projets simultanément ; capacité à trouver rapidement des solutions à des problématiques ; esprit créatif, intérêt soutenu pour le milieu de la mode et pour la rédaction publicitaire ; connaissances approfondies des outils suivants :o google analytics o google merchanto google adwords & adsenceo google keyword plannero facebook analyticso facebook powereditoro facebook insighto semrush voir l'énoncé de renonciation postulez maintenant service à la clientèle communiquez avec nous faq commandes et achats expédition et taxes cartes-cadeaux salle d'essayage   politique de retour sécurité et confidentialité conditions mon compte inscription info-lettre nos boutiques trouvez une boutique international notre site web notre marque fondation les roses de l'espoir carrières médias © 2012 la vie en rose. tous droits réservés.

date: 
sep 29, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca, m4y 2y5


at rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, rogers is the place where ideas become reality. we embrace change, and find ways to do better. and we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.
 
new graduate leadership development program – digital business unit
 
gain cross-functional experience across our various business units with the rogers new grad leadership development program and kick-start your career with us! throughout the entire program, you’ll have exposure to leadership and development training that will foster your potential. you’ll be paired with an all-star support structure who will work with you to ensure your professional goals and objectives are realized. we’ll also organize social and networking opportunities to help connect you with your peers, colleagues and senior leaders. to learn more about the program and who we look for, visit campus.rogers.com.
 
your business unit:
 
we’re building a brilliant digital future for canadians, and our rogers digital team plays an integral role in that. we’re responsible for the creation, design, content and experiences on all the digital platforms in the media, consumer and enterprise business units that is consumed by canadian customers across the country. that being said, we’re looking for an enthusiastic individual that is excited by the opportunity of joining canada’s largest telecommunications company.
 
your potential roles:
 
we can’t wait to meet you and talk about where you’ll make immediate contributions to our organization! successful candidates may work in one of the following roles:
 

digital analyst
digital coordinator
digital designer
design strategy facilitation

 
your experience:
 

enrollment in a diploma, bachelor’s degree, or post-graduate diploma in business technology management, digital arts, marketing, communications, computer science, computer engineering, ux design, public relations, statistics, mathematics, sciences or equivalent to be completed between june 2017 to june 2018
proficiency in adobe suite, microsoft powerpoint and excel
experience working with web analytics tools (adobe analytics, sitecatalyst, omniture, google analytics etc)
strong analytical and problem solving skills to transform data into actionable insights
understanding of design thinking and design processes
understanding of technical aspects of web and mobile applications
	 


how to apply:
 

submit a cover letter, resume and unofficial transcripts

 
schedule: full time
shift: day
length of contract: not applicable (regular position)
work location: 1 mount pleasant (083), toronto, on 
travel requirements: none
posting category/function: student/new grad & new grad
requisition id: 108952
 
why rogers?
 
as a proud canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. we’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.
 
we recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. we work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:
 

simplify and innovate
take ownership of the what and the how
equip people to succeed
execute with discipline and pride
talk straight, build trust, and over deliver

 
why rogers?  because your tomorrow inspires our today.
 
what makes us different makes us stronger. rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. everyone who applies for a job will be considered.
 
we recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. at rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. we work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. you can also reach out to our team at rogersrecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

title: Associate Producer, Digital - Assigned to CBC q (English Ser...
text:
job description - associate producer, digital - assigned to cbc q (english services) (tor06060)go to the main content section.français current openingswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - associate producer, digital - assigned to cbc q (english services) (tor06060)job description associate producer, digital - assigned to cbc q (english services) - tor06060  job family  programming (tv-radio-web)primary location  torontoposition language requirement  english onlylanguage skill levels (reading / writing / speaking)  - - -status of employment  permanentwork schedule(s)  full-time  description what it’s like working at cbc/radio-canada
 
at cbc/radio-canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects canadians on multiple platforms. do you think you have the ability and drive to keep up with this exciting, ever-changing industry? whether it be in front of the camera, on air, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making connections and telling stories that are important to canadians.are you equally fascinated by digital media and public radio?  do you know what content works
online versus what doesn’t – and why?

our ideal candidate has a heightened sense of seo, social marketing and what makes content shareable
and experience in creating content for a mobile and digital-first audience.
this candidate will demonstrate comfort and professionalism on all major social
networks, and havephotography and video skills.

our ideal candidate will always be looking for ways to grow audience and innovate in the digital audio
space. this digital-first thinker will reach out to social influencers
and establish successful methods for engaging new listeners and readers,
as well as providing value for our existing users.

as associate producer (assigned to cbc q) within cbc music’s digital content group, the successful
candidate will understand cbc music and cbc q’s goals and products, and
know how to leverage online and social content to help accomplish said goals.

reporting to executive producer, digital editorial, and with direction from executive producer, q and
well as one or more producers, the associate producer will be assigned to
support cbc q’s radio program on all digital platforms.
 
key tasks:
expertly packages daily audio segments from cbc q broadcasts, and supports the q podcast.contribute to the social team – creating social video, maintaining posting schedules
and more.edits and posts audio.create additional digital content to support radio content.contributes idea for digital original content.in-studio photography.copy editing.communicates with other digital aps and producers to flag content ideas trending on social.as required, also performs the following tasks:reporting on analytics.works with team to enhance social content.generates ideas for digital content across other cbc music properties.does event coverage for social/digital.writes material for presentation on air.assign, direct and co-ordinate the work of other personnel working on a project for which the producer
or executive producer is responsible.edit, encode, digitize and package audioand video material for a website using appropriate
technologies.participates in story idea generation with the editorial team environment, including potential
features, themed content weeks, youtube video, audio clips chasing guests,
interviews, album releases.
qualifications we are looking for a candidate with the following: 
university degree or equivalent with a minimum of two years' relevant experience in the digital space.experience and proven ability with various technical platforms including social media tools, audio editing, photography, photo and video editing, video encoding, content management systems.knowledge of the digital publishing industry, tools and best practices for producing editorial content.proven ability to critically edit articles and restructure them for flow, clarity, conciseness and online or print readability.working knowledge of basic html. proven ability in editing to conform to standard english grammar, cbc style and proper print spellings and capitalization; knowledge of cbcnews.ca style an asset.experience in determining potential legal issues and journalistic policy violations in print or online copy, and ability to act on them.understanding of canadian print libel law.ability to determine the newsworthiness of a story for digital audiences, social media/user-generated content and anticipate needs across platforms.ability to work effectively in a 24/7 online content creation environment, handle deadline pressure and to work flexible hours as required.a working knowledge of best practices, tools and processes for publishing original online video.passion and knowledge for social media and online video platforms, and how to use them effectively for digital publishing.a creative, innovative sensibility and high editorial standards.ability to clearly articulate content ideas/concepts.the ability to think strategically.ease in managing multiple projects on tight deadlines.ability to work in fast-paced environment with a flexible, positive attitude.a clear understanding of multi-platform uses for engaging audiences beyond traditional broadcast.
candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.cbc/radio-canada is committed to being a leader in reflecting our country’s diversity. that’s because we can only create and tell the stories that connect canadians, by having a workforce that mirrors the ever-changing makeup of our country. that’s why we, as an employer, value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as canada’s public broadcaster. for more information, visit the talent and diversity section of our website. if you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca.if this sounds interesting, please apply online! we thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  job posting date  sep 28, 2017, 10:28:03 amunposting date  oct 13, 2017, 11:59:00 pmproficiency levels of second language:
-  = no level required
a = beginner level
b = intermediate level
c = advanced level  ici.radio-canada.ca|cbc.ca copyright ©  cbc/radio-canada

competition number: req 538 title: digital marketing and analytics officer, international centre division: international centre salary: payband h, $30.45 - $35.35 per hour (pay range effective september 1, 2017, 35 hour per week)  location: 200 king st.e. status: full time support effective date:  immediately at george brown college, we have established a reputation for equipping our students with the skills, industry experience and credentials to pursue the careers of their choice.  as employees, we are committed to creating an enriching learning community for our students, delivering excellence in what we do, holding ourselves accountable for our work and demonstrating diversity and respect for one another.  what responsibilities will you have in this role?  e-mail marketing, marketing automation and crmworks with the manager, international marketing and business analytics to clarify objectives, establish metrics and define strategy for engagement campaigns for prospective students.builds program logic (actions, triggers, rules and end-states) to map onto campaign(s) objectives.designs and creates e-marketing materials and templates for various marketing initiatives ensuring compliance with the latest industry requirements -- canada's anti-spam legislation (casl) and aoda standards.monitors inbound email inquiries and responds or forwards to relevant stakeholders for a response as appropriate.updates and refines auto-response and faqs templates to facilitate timely and accurate responses.measures and reports performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (roi and kpis). web, search and content marketingdevelops and deploys campaign landing pages for online advertising campaigns.conducts seo exercises for the international website to ensure optimization for search engine traffic.executes quality assurance and testing across browsers, operating systems and mobile devices.develops and implements an update and refresh schedule for the international website in english and multiple target-market languages.creates presentations for key audiences of the international centre (e.g. agents, counsellors, visiting delegations, etc.).develops copy for the international website, email campaigns, print materials, etc.; creates infographics for social media, etc. social media marketingdevelops relevant content topics for key audiences of the international centre; create and maintain a content calendar.posts relevant content in accordance with the content calendar; reviews user generated comments and posts in a quick and timely manner. analytics and reportingidentifies data sources for different components of periodic reports/visualizations (e.g. enrolment plans and reports from ro; power bi datasets; oas dashboard reports; ocas data warehouse; statcan etc.). collates data using reporting/analytics tools such as microsoft power bi and microsoft excel pivot tables.conducts information gathering exercises to help inform decision-making for the division (e.g. competitive research across colleges/universities in canada on fees, english admission requirements, etc.). other related duties as assigned. what qualifications do you need for this role? three-year diploma/degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with concentration in digital marketing/e-marketing/web marketing or equivalent is required.minimum three years of marketing experience with 1-2 years of digital marketing experience.knowledge of and experience with digital marketing (search, web and content, social media, mobile, etc.). this includes but is not limited to:design, development and deployment of quality email marketing, marketing automation and crm campaigns.search marketing: seo and sem campaigns.web and content marketing: website/webpage design/development including optimization for mobile; infographic creation; video development.social media marketing: curation of social media properties for target audience engagement; social advertising.tech-savvy: thrives at the intersection of marketing and technology with a keen desire to learn as the digital marketing space evolves.familiarity and comfort with using a variety of marketing and analytics applications i.e.: online analytics platforms (e.g. google analytics, facebook insights); marketing automation and crm systems (e.g. pardot, salesforce); business intelligence tools (e.g. power bi).strong ms office skills with an in-depth knowledge of excel: pivot tables, formulas, etc.knowledge of html and related web technologies are an asset.fluency in english required; knowledge of an additional language an asset.combination of superior written and verbal communication skills and strong numerical abilities.excellent multi-tasking, problem-solving and time management skills, ability to prioritize multiple projects with competing deadlines.self-starter with a demonstrated ability to be responsive to short-term change, quick thinking, flexible, adaptable and resilient.effective ability to interact with others and deal with situations in ways that respect diverse backgrounds, experience and styles.strong work ethic demonstrated in previous roles with a commitment to delivering excellent service to others as this is key in supporting the success of our students and our college.highly creative, innovative, proactive and team orientated.strong organizational, analytical and critical thinking skills; along with experience dealing with complex issues are required.flexibility in adapting to change and in participating in consultative decision-making processes.    hours of work: 9:00 am – 5:00 pminterview process may consist of a practical skills component. to apply:if you are a george brown college employee, go to https://adfs.georgebrown.ca/adfs/ls/idpinitiatedsignon.aspx to apply via our internal site. if you are an external candidate, go to www.georgebrown.ca and click on the “employment at george brown” link or click on the ‘apply’ button on the web to apply. notes:please ensure your resume highlights all relevant education, training and experience that are applicable to the minimum qualifications for this role.the college requires proof of degrees, credentials or equivalencies from accredited regional or federal post-secondary institutions and/or their international equivalents.  credentials may require validation at the time of interviews.first consideration will be provided to internal candidates in accordance with our support staff collective agreement.   closing: open until filled   george brown college is dedicated to employment equity and encourages applications from people of all genders, persons with disabilities, racial/visible minorities and indigenous peoples.  george brown college is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda).  the human resources representative responsible for the recruitment for this position will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.   for information on george brown college, please visit our website at www.georgebrown.ca.

account by clicking on one of the following: sign in account central apply history help center job alerts job watch list recommended jobs resumes working at microsoft benefits and perks businesses and what joining the microsoft team means…we are looking for an experienced enterprise sales enablement manager to join the central marketing organization (cmo). this role is focused on local industry events, ensuring gep connection and customer evidence development. the central marketing organization (cmo) is the center of modern marketing excellence. the cmo brings our modern marketing vision to life, providing leadership and accountability to drive demand generation and create fans through a connected sales and marketing experience. the cmo provides integrated marketing and deep discipline expertise in experiential marketing, social marketing, and analytics, working in partnership with the respective product and segment teams. the cmo supports all segments (commercial & consumer), products, and cross-product solution areas and maximizes the use of global content, focusing marketing investments in alignment with customer buying scenarios, and leveraging global demand centers (gdc) and global engagement programs (geps).   the enterprise sales enablement role is to enable vertical selling through very focused marketing activities.   the enterprise sales enablement manager will develop sales enablement plans to support high touch, selective activities for enterprise managed accounts primary partnering with the experiential marketing lead to execute local vertical events and to ensure global engagement program (gep) connection. in addition, this role requires developing local customer evidence and partnering with the marketing service center (msc) customer advocacy team.   the enterprise sales enablement manager will help to land microsoft’s global marketing initiatives aligned to our global demand center model with local relevancy. along with your integrated marcom peers, you will understand the global engagement programs aligned to the portfolio they support including the global content strategy and centralized demand generation plans to align and connect local marketing efforts. you will primarily curate existing context to efficiently enable vertical selling. working with your integrated marketing leader, you will engage with local sales leaders and sellers and drive visibility to the impact the global demand center, global engagement programs, and local activities have on our customers across sales segment.   the enterprise sales enablement manager must be passionate about enabling vertical sellers with focused marketing that drives impact. you are data-driven and able to extract insights from standard reports to continuously improve and optimize local performance. you are excited about marketing capabilities like marketing automation and unlocking new opportunities when data and technology converge.   the enterprise sales enablement manager provides enterprise customer insights to the corporate business groups via the integrated marketing lead to implement and influence go-to-market strategy for cross-product solutions. you partner closely with the cmo experiential marketing team to execute industry events, deliver customer evidence, and ensure connection to relevant global engagement programs (geps). the enterprise sales enablement manager supports social selling for bdm acquisition and opportunity expansion. as part of the cmo team, the enterprise sales enablement manager embraces the company’s marketing principles, is a microsoft brand steward, and communicates ongoing improvements needed to optimize local marketing investments to drive marketing efficiency, marketing impact, and scale.   the impact you’ll be making…•      partner with segment & sales excellence teams to drive sales process enablement, insight, & execution locally (20%)•      work with the area change lead & help sales excellence leads to accelerate gst landing & support locally (20%)•      leverage & drive standardized reporting to improve local execution (25%)•      land & drive segment planning with the sales excellence leads (15%)•      support & provide insight into opportunity management & sales execution (20%)who we are looking for…experiences      3-5 years related experienceskills & knowledge      history of driving rigor and sales discipline      experience within sales excellence, business planning, sales operations and/or finance       executive exposure & cross-functional stakeholder management      focuses on providing process optimization by understanding the desired business outcome      delivers end-to-end deep data analysis & “light ups” actionable strategic insights      innovates to deliver standards which enable speed, efficiency and scale in the business      deep knowledge on business process, sales operations, and execution      familiar with financials, pipeline, scorecarding, and other internal measurement tools      proven communication and collaboration skills       functional (partner, services, sales, marketing) knowledge preferred educationbachelors degree (b.s./b.a) required and/or experience in relevant fields eg: business, marketing, information technology, operations, finance. masters degree preferred. job # 321329 1070939 title: Member Services and Social Media Coordinator
text:
member services and social media coordinator | ontario society of professional engineers

























enter your email address to begin your application for this job.





 




    sign in  to your account
  



×


      we see that you have previously applied for a job using this system. please enter your password below to continue.
    









forgot your password?



 






share this job:





member services and social media coordinator

company:
        ontario society of professional engineers
      

location:
      toronto, on
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
 
from the streets you drive on, to the water you drink, engineers help make modern life possible. it’s their work that helps ensure we live safe and healthy lives, and that’s why it’s integral that their voices continue to heard by key decision makers across all levels of government.
we’re the ontario society of professional engineers (ospe), and we advocate on behalf of the engineering profession in the province of ontario. whether it involves organizing professional development events, or connecting with the many businesses and government officials that help our cause, we are dedicated to ensuring that engineering professionals have a key voice at ontario’s policymaking table.
we’re a strong, progressive organization and we’re looking for you to join our team.
member services and social media coordinator
as our new member services and social media coordinator, your role will be twofold.
on the membership side, you’ll be responsible for processing new memberships, supporting the renewal process, and helping to increase ospe memberships through phone and email contact with our members. you will become the go-to person for all member support, so that whenever our members need help, they’ll go straight to you, knowing they’ll receive great information in a friendly and personable manner.
the second part of this role will be creating and maintaining our strong social media presence. from implementing online marketing strategies and tracking campaign analytics, to writing snappy facebook posts, you’ll ensure that our online presence is fun, informative, and effective.
ideally, you are:

creative and energetic – you’re always looking for new ideas, and new ways to market our brand. you embrace the latest social media trends, produce great content, and are excited to dive in and make an immediate impact.
driven and engaged – you love to have fun at work, but not at the expense of quality. everything you produce is polished and professional. you work hard at what you do and take great pride in your work, and love seeing the positive results of your efforts.
positive and outgoing – you’re excited to come to work every day, and members and coworkers are drawn to your great personality. you love meeting, engaging, and talking with people daily, and are energized by great personal interactions.

you’re also someone who has exceptional communication skills and attention to detail. you can communicate complex issues easily, navigate multiple competing demands with ease, and do so in a way that makes people feel great for having come to you.
if you’re looking for a varied and vibrant role where you can have a big impact from day one, this could be the place for you.
working with ospe
this is a full-time, permanent position, working monday to friday, 8:30am-4:30pm, with a highly attractive total compensation plan, that includes three weeks of vacation and rsp matching.
we are a small, passionate team operating out of our head office in toronto. we believe in the autonomy of each member of our team and maintain a working environment that empowers our members to be great advocates. working with us will provide you with a challenge as we strive to tap in the vast potential of this market. we hope you will join us as we continue to champion the interests of engineers across ontario. 
qualifications

significant customer service experience
experience working with various social media platforms (facebook/twitter/snapchat/instagram etc.), including creating and curating content, as well as campaign analytics and reporting
excellent computer skills, particularly with microsoft excel
some experience creating customized visuals/graphics to accompany social media posts
experience working with paid digital services like google adwords, google tag manager and facebook business manager
experience creating and monitoring google, instagram and facebook ads
post-secondary degree in marketing, communications, or a related field


experience working with social media tools/content calendars such as hootsuite
knowledge of html/css coding
knowledge of google analytics and other tracking platforms

how to apply
our online application will give you the option to apply to this role as a complete person – not just a resume. the application will assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, and should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. after submitting, you'll receive an email inviting you to log in and view your assessment results.
we value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. if we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “help” button in the application.
we will all review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment, and look forward to hearing from you.

external posting descriptionour analytic team is seeking a consultant who is passionate about using technology, leveraging analytic models and approaches to solve business problems. ideally you will be someone who displays initiative, lateral thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving. your main responsibility would be to position the analytic practice with sas.  support the expansion of the analytic practice in quebec working on analytics and digital strategic advisory mandates and implementation projects
 
in particular you will be involved in :

work in a fast growing, problem solving, innovative, agile and technology enabled environment with like­minded people who are eminent in their respective fields such as analytics strategy, business intelligence, data modeling, agile bi delivery, data management, big data, data visualization, data science and much more
orienting, designing and implementing business intelligence and data warehousing solutions problem solving critical client issues using data to deliver valued results
balancing multiple client projects and other responsibilities
becoming a reference in analytics and information management, particularly in the financial services industry and in the marketing/customer oriented lines of business
participate in building the practice, growing the team and developing eminence communicating effectively to all levels of management

external posting qualifications
1 to 3 years in a business area such as finance, risk/insurance 3 years+ in design analytics and data architectures
highly proficient in sql (or a variant such as t­sql or plsql) programming 3 years+ in implementing sas technology
experienced in other sas solutions including base sas, enterprise miner, visual analytics and other sas technologies would be well regarded
strong understanding of the sas intelligence platform and integration with applications, databases, and service oriented architectures (soap, json, rest)
the capability of quickly, regularly, and independently learning new technologies under the pressure of consistent high­profile project deliverables with review by peers and analytic leaders
strong commitment to professional and client service excellence

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

 reference code: 24202-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptiondeloitte's marketing and sales support group is seeking a marketing manager to support the analytics offerings.  as an integral member of a high performing team, you will be responsible for the planning and execution of a series of marketing related programs, sponsorship and events. you will also have an opportunity to work collaboratively with other internal clients to plan and execute on nationally driven programs.
 
reporting to the director, who leads the marketing efforts for high growth initiatives, this marketing manager is an energetic, ambitious individual with an aptitude for data analytics and who enjoys a fast paced, team oriented environment and strives for success and results.
 
responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

assist in the development and effective implementation of marketing programs and initiatives including:
	
content development for analytics-related promotional materials (internal & client facing)
contact management programs
digital marketing
develop and maintain content for internet and intranet
speaker's programs
internal and external communications
public relations coordination
analyst relations
contact database maintenance
budget management, reporting and invoice processing
conference/event/tradeshow planning and execution
develop multi-channel marketing programs for internally developed thought-leadership to drive interest to internal stakeholders and/or external clients


ensure the tracking and reporting of roi on all major marketing activities/campaigns
ensure compliance with communication policies, procedures and brand standards
assist in the generation or identification/modification of content to support all marketing activities including; thought leadership, whitepaper, newsletter, invitations, survey material, internal and external communications
assist as requested in the creation and implementation of strategic marketing communications plans
work alongside subject matter experts to understand the business strategy and ensure marketing strategy is aligned
recommend integrated marketing communications programs and activities to achieve goals
coordinate with regional marketing professionals to facilitate the sharing of information at all levels and ensure continued coordination of plans and knowledge sharing
manage outside agencies, consultants, research vendors, and creative suppliers liaison with suppliers for promotional materials
research and respond to all internal and external information requests
prepare reports for team meeting and schedule/attend meetings as appropriate
participate in and contribute to other relevant projects
flexibility to work evenings and weekends when necessary
travel may be required

external posting qualifications
minimum of 5-7 years of marketing/communications experience, preferably in a business to business marketing communications environment and/or in the area of analytics. professional services marketing experience an asset
1-2 years of people management experience, preferably with larger cross-functional teams
bachelor's degree or diploma in marketing, communications or equivalent experience
some familiarity with the analytics marketplace
a demonstrated ability to link marketing strategy to lead generation
advanced microsoft office skills (word, excel, powerpoint, and outlook)
exceptional writing and verbal skills
excellent interpersonal skills and client service skills
strong attention to detail, administrative and organizational skills
event coordination experience
experience in negotiating contracts with external suppliers, vendors and associations
ability to prioritize, multi-task and perform in a deadline oriented environment
independent self-starter that possess initiative, creativity, and leadership skills
proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving
self-starter, independent and proactive in identifying opportunities for new and improved services
an enthusiastic professional who thrives in a fast paced, team environment and requires minimal supervision
proven track record in working with project and budget management
willingness to learn and a positive attitude
a solid work ethic, team player and comfortable liaising effectively with partners and staff across all levels
aptitude for technology
bilingual (french and english) an asset

blue ant media is a privately held, international content producer, distributor and channel operator. from our production houses around the world, we create content for multiple genres including factual, factual entertainment, short-form digital series and kids programming. our distribution business, blue ant international, offers a catalogue of 2,300+ hours of content, including the largest 4k natural history offering on the market. blue ant media’s international channel business offers a portfolio of media brands such as love nature (international), zoomoo networks (international), smithsonian channel canada, bbc earth (canada) and hgtv (new zealand). blue ant media is headquartered in toronto, with operations in los angeles, singapore, auckland, dunedin, london, sydney, beijing and taipei.
check us out at www.blueantmedia.ca.
follow us on: twitter / linked in / instragram
our brands are a product of our employees who are passionate experts in all of these areas. they are fanatical about creating outstanding content and experiences; and enthusiastic about delivering it on new and evolving platforms.
we actively seek out people who embody our core valuesâ€”optimism, creativity, entrepreneurism, agility and integrity. we attract creative talents who are optimistic about the evolving future of content and who take pride in seeing opportunity where others see challenges. we encourage employees to think like small business owners by taking ownership on projects and giving them the flexibility to take risks and embrace an evolving media landscape. our team members excel at collaborating with internal and external partners and our culture fosters sharing ideas and treating all people with respect.
are you one of us?
job postings at blue ant media:



social media specialist, love nature


apply for this job! 
apply with indeed




positions
1
close date
13 oct 2017
location
toronto



as a key member of the blue ant marketing team, the social media specialist will own fan engagement for the love nature brand globally, across all social and digital platforms with the aim to build meaningful connections and encourage community fans to take action. this role is based in toronto and will report directly to the digital and social marketing manager.

responsibilities & duties


subject matter expert in nature and wildlife, with a pulse on key current events and issues affecting our natural world; and has the ability to create and maintain meaningful on-going connections with love nature fans globally.
own social fan engagement by listening and responding to fans and working with publicity and products team to ensure customer service is timely and consistent for dedicated brand.
cultivate and nurture relationships with fans, influencers, bloggers and love nature affinity brand partner communities.
create, source and curate a variety of customer-centered written and visual digital content across various formats (e-newsletters, images, gifs, infographics, blogs and videos).
lead organic social media editorial calendar planning, strategy and execution of social posts for love nature with the goal to deepen fan engagement and achieve identified brand kpis.
responsible for the creation and deployment of the love nature e-newsletter program.
source promotional assets and lead the creative briefing for original content needed for social media programs and digital sites.
track organic social media posts, analyze on-going performance, and generate actionable insights and learnings.
work with digital and social marketing manager’s guidance to combine performance results to provide a comprehensive weekly tracking report and actionable recommendations.
flexibility to work occasional evenings and a few hours on weekends for specific show and brand launch initiatives.


experience & qualifications


minimum of 3 years experience in social media with a demonstrated focus on community building and fan engagement in nature and wildlife
bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent experience in related field
proven ability to build engaged organic communities
savvy communication skills - written and visual
demonstrated expertise in planning and executing organic community management for facebook, twitter, instagram, pinterest and snapchat
strong working knowledge of google analytics (certification is a plus), facebook business manager, mailchimp, and up-to-date digital marketing best practices
project management skills with the ability to set and manage priorities, meet deadlines, and work autonomously
excellent interpersonal skills and team building skills; ability to work collaboratively in a cross functional organization and manage multiple stakeholders to deliver exceptional results
a love of all things media

blue ant media celebrates diversity in both its programming and workforce.  we encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds who are eligible to work in canada.
we thank all candidates for their interest in blue ant media and we will reach out to those candidates that are under consideration.  if you are contacted for an interview and require an accommodation during the recruitment process, please advise human resources.
 

  










blue ant media is part of the blue ant media entertainment network

titre du poste :  gestionnaire, stratégie d’engagement de la clientèle ville, province / état, pays :  montréal, quebec, canada catégorie d'emploi :  marketing date d'affichage (jj/mm/aaaa) :  15/09/2017 fondée en 1985, la vie en rose a su se démarquer comme leader canadien dans le domaine de la lingerie et des maillots avec plus de 2600 employés. l’entreprise compte plus de 230 magasins à travers le canada, et notre but ultime est de vous faire sentir belle et confortable dans notre lingerie et nos maillots de bain et de vous offrir un service à la clientèle remarquable. de plus, depuis 2006 nous avons percé le marché international et notre marque est désormais représentée dans 18 pays.à la vie en rose, les employés sont l’actif le plus important de la compagnie. il est important pour nous que les employés se sentent appréciés dans leur travail. c’est pourquoi nous encourageons les promotions à l’interne et offrons les meilleures formations possibles à nos employés afin qu’ils développent tous une belle et longue carrière à la vie en rose. raison d'être de l'emploi le titulaire de ce poste doit élaborer les stratégies d’engagement de la clientèle omni-canaux et guider son équipe afin que les meilleures pratiques d’engagement et de fidélisation soientappliquées dans nos communications à celle-ci. il est responsable de la gestion de l’ensembledes communications envoyées à la clientèle, autant sur le plan promotionnel que celles liées aucycle d’achat, et plus spécifiquement de la banque crm. de plus, il doit agir à titre de leaderpositif en assurant une grande synergie des activités auprès des membres de son équipe, dudépartement marketing et des autres départements. description des tâches - établir et communiquer les orientations, les stratégies, les objectifs et le calendrier de communication rétention, et ce, pour les bannières la vie en rose et bikini village ; - identifier les segments les plus rentables de l’organisation, et ce, pour les différentes bannières ainsi que pour des catégories de produits spécifiques ; - favoriser l’engagement et la fidélisation de la clientèle envers la marque en développant des initiatives à roi élevé (life cycle program) ; - superviser étroitement l’ensemble des communications destinées aux clients afin de s’assurer d’un haut standard de qualité et de la cohérence des messages et de l’image ; - personnaliser les communications afin d’accroître la pertinence du discours de marque et maximiser le roi, en se basant sur l’historique d’achat et le potentiel des différents segments de clientèle identifiés ; - travailler en étroite collaboration avec les cellules marketing afin de créer une synergie de contenu favorisant l’engagement et la rétention ; - communiquer aux différents départements les initiatives crm et les résultats obtenus ; - fournir aux différents départements des données par rapport aux opportunités de marché ainsi qu’aux tendances d'achat et ce, avec la collaboration du département d’acquisition ; - collaborer, être à l’écoute et réagir aux opportunités de fidélisation de la clientèle soulevés par les autres départements ; -recruter, évaluer, guider et motiver son équipe ; -gérer les calendriers ainsi que le budget d’engagement marketing ; -participer à d’autres projets marketing au besoin. exigences  un baccalauréat en concentration marketing, commerce électronique ou équivalent avec un intérêt marqué pour les statistiques ; un minimum de 5 ans d’expérience pertinente est requis en marketing direct, crm et fidélisation ; expérience en gestion de personnel ; parfaitement bilingue, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit ; connaissance des meilleures pratiques en crm ; habileté en gestion de projets simultané, avec des livrables à ct, mt et lt ; souci du détail poussé, sens de l’organisation et des priorités ; capacité d’analyse statistique poussée, aisance à manipuler des données ; expérience dans le commerce du détail et le commerce électronique ; leadership, bonnes aptitudes de communication et persuasion ; capacité à travailler sous pression dans un environnement en constante évolution ; capacité à trouver rapidement des solutions à des problématiques ; esprit créatif, intérêt soutenu pour le milieu de la mode et pour la rédaction publicitaire ; connaissances approfondies des outils suivants :o microsoft dynamicso google analyticso dotmailer ou autre logiciel similaire voir l'énoncé de renonciation postulez maintenant service à la clientèle communiquez avec nous faq commandes et achats expédition et taxes cartes-cadeaux salle d'essayage   politique de retour sécurité et confidentialité conditions mon compte inscription info-lettre nos boutiques trouvez une boutique international notre site web notre marque fondation les roses de l'espoir carrières médias © 2012 la vie en rose. tous droits réservés.

striking a balance between beautiful, elegant design and best practices when driving sales. we take great pride in our work and it is an important part of who we are. making an elegant, yet reliable recommerce solution is not easy, but for us it's a labour of love. if you share our passion for this problem, and want to play a defining role on a small but dedicated team, please apply. our ideal skill set is below, but don't worry if you don't check all of these boxes; a great culture fit is much more important to us than your skill set today. - html 5, css 3 - responsive design and bootstrap buyers and sellers are supported. this means you should be motivated, friendly, knowledgeable, and able to communicate complex ideas in a way that anyone could understand. you can identify what is a bug and what is user error, and you can guide someone to a solution in either case. as a member of the support team, you will: - interact with customers via our support site (powered by desk.com), email, and phone - review, revise, and add to our documentation and knowledge base - develop an in-depth knowledge of our product, which you will use to recognize and solve problems for our users - uphold a superior level of customer satisfaction and build trust and loyalty within our customer base - troubleshoot issues with both iphone hardware and software - recognize trends in issues and complaints and suggest product and policy changes to address these - support our customers in both english and french. a command of both written and spoken french is a requirement for this position. the candidate of our dreams should: - be confident in solving more than just issues with orders - experience fixing iphones or other devices would make you an asset - exhibit an "all hands on deck" and "roll up your sleeves" work ethic - be able to work quickly and feel comfortable in a fast-paced environment. we move quickly and need you to be able to do the same. - love our customers. we don't exactly expect you to love them right now, but our customers motivate almost all our decisions. making their lives easier is basically what we're here for. apply for this position marketing lead the opportunity orchard is a toronto-based startup dedicated to making high quality phones accessible to more people. we spend every day building new tools and technologies to change the face of online re-commerce— because when people are able to buy and sell used with confidence, the cost of owning a device comes down for everyone. with an expansion into the us market, partnerships with big players in the wireless space, and more 5-star reviews than we can count, orchard is growing. fast. that's why we're looking to add a marketing lead to our team who will be dedicated to managing our online marketing activities. you will be responsible for quarterbacking our marketing campaigns and mapping their impact on our core business metrics. this means analyzing which channels are winning and deserve more investment, which channels need additional effort to become profitable, and which channels we should abandon altogether. additionally, you will be responsible for identifying new areas for experimentation, and subsequently determining whether these channels hold promise. our ideal candidate would be just as comfortable doing a deep dive on web analytics as researching a strategy for a new acquisition channel. in order to fill this role, you’ll need experience with online acquisition and web analytics, but don’t worry if you don’t check the remaining boxes: we believe in intelligence and drive more than experience: in-depth understanding of google analytics, mixpanel and/or segment is essential a passion for experimentation in, and careful measuring of, online acquisition experience executing and tracking the success of online marketing campaigns, ideally with smaller companies a thorough understanding of the content side of seo would be a big plus experience with app attribution and in-app analytics also a big a plus what we offer this in an integral role within orchard, and anyone filling it will have an outsized impact on the business. you’ll work shoulder-to-shoulder with a dedicated and results-oriented founding team at a high-growth startup with enormous ambitions. we set the bar high in terms of performance but are happy to accommodate different work styles and schedules. $70,000 - $100,000 depending on experience competitive options package attractive benefits package high-impact work as a member of a small, cohesive team apply for this position operations manager the opportunity orchard is a toronto-based startup dedicated to making high quality phones accessible to more people. we spend every day building new tools and technologies to change the face of online re-commerce— because when people are able to buy and sell used with confidence, the cost of owning a device comes down for everyone. with an expansion into the us market, partnerships with big players in the wireless space, and more 5-star reviews than we can count, orchard is growing. there is an ever-expanding list of things that need to be done, and not enough people to tend to them all, which is why we are looking for an operations manager to lighten the load. the role will be varied and will certainly evolve through time, but today would include a little bit of everything: marketing, accounting, admin, payments, and logistics planning. this is certainly not a job for everyone: you should be a self-starter who can look at a problem you’ve never seen before and determine what resources you need to solve it. you should thrive on a challenge and hard work, and have a track record of finding ways to make an impact, and be someone who is dogged in your pursuit of a goal or target. please address your cover letter to alex sebastian and cite an instance that you were thrown into a situation and were forced to rely on your logic and/or instincts to work your way out. what we offer this role represents an unparalleled learning experience for anyone who intends to start their own company. the breadth of your responsibilities will be perfect training for being a founder in your own right and you will work very closely with and have unlimited access to orchard’s founding team. we are flexible in terms of how you get your work done, so long as the results are there. we are a results-oriented culture and conduct quarterly performance reviews because we firmly believe in rewarding our top performing employees. other titre du poste :  gestionnaire stratégie d’acquisition de la clientèle ville, province / état, pays :  montréal, quebec, canada catégorie d'emploi :  commerce électronique date d'affichage (jj/mm/aaaa) :  20/09/2017 fondée en 1985, la vie en rose a su se démarquer comme leader canadien dans le domaine de la lingerie et des maillots avec plus de 2600 employés. l’entreprise compte plus de 230 magasins à travers le canada, et notre but ultime est de vous faire sentir belle et confortable dans notre lingerie et nos maillots de bain et de vous offrir un service à la clientèle remarquable. de plus, depuis 2006 nous avons percé le marché international et notre marque est désormais représentée dans 18 pays.à la vie en rose, les employés sont l’actif le plus important de la compagnie. il est important pour nous que les employés se sentent appréciés dans leur travail. c’est pourquoi nous encourageons les promotions à l’interne et offrons les meilleures formations possibles à nos employés afin qu’ils développent tous une belle et longue carrière à la vie en rose. raison d'être de l'emploi le titulaire de ce poste doit élaborer les stratégies d’acquisition de la clientèle omni-canaux et guider les firmes et consultants externes afin que les meilleures pratiques d’acquisition sem et seo soient appliquées. de plus, il doit agir à titre de leader positif en assurant une grande synergie des activités auprès des autres départements. description des tâches - établir et communiquer les orientations, les stratégies, les objectifs et le calendrier de l’acquisition de la clientèle et ce, pour les bannières la vie en rose et bikini village ; -gérer avec les firmes et consultants externes les stratégies d’acquisition de clientèle en ligne via les médias digitaux ;- favoriser l’expansion de notre clientèle et l’engagement envers la marque ;-planifier avec les différents intervenants les stratégies de marketing et de promotions des produits en ligne et en magasin pour qu’il y ait une cohérence des messages et de l’image;-promouvoir un message clair selon le positionnement de la marque voulu en convergence avec le message marketing en magasin, en ligne et autre médias ;-développer avec les consultants et firmes externes les stratégies de sem, seo et facebook ads ;-contribuer à l’augmentation du taux de conversion et des ventes en mettant en place différentes stratégies d’acquisition de la clientèle ;- synchroniser les campagnes et les assortiments de produits en se basant sur l’historique, sur le taux de conversion et les autres données disponibles ;-collaborer, être à l’écoute et réagir aux opportunités d’acquisition de la clientèle soulevés par les autres départements;-développer les stratégies de programme d’affiliation; - fournir aux différents départements des données par rapport aux opportunités de marché ainsi qu’aux tendances d'achat et ce avec la collaboration du département d'engagement de la clientèle ;-négocier les ententes avec les firmes et consultants externes ;-gérer les calendriers ainsi que les budgets de l’acquisition marketing ;-participer à d’autres projets marketing au besoin. exigences  un baccalauréat en concentration marketing, commerce électronique ou équivalent ; un minimum de 5 ans d’expérience pertinente est requis en marketing et commerce électronique ;  bilingue, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit ; connaissance des meilleures pratiques en commerce électronique, sem et seo ; expérience dans le commerce du détail et le commerce électronique (atout); leadership, bonnes aptitudes de communication et persuasion ; souci du détail, sens de l’organisation et des priorités ; capacité à travailler sous pression dans un environnement en constante évolution ; capacité à gérer plusieurs projets simultanément ; capacité à trouver rapidement des solutions à des problématiques ; esprit créatif, intérêt soutenu pour le milieu de la mode et pour la rédaction publicitaire ; connaissances approfondies des outils suivants :o google analytics o google merchanto google adwords & adsenceo google keyword plannero facebook analyticso facebook powereditoro facebook insighto semrush voir l'énoncé de renonciation postulez maintenant service à la clientèle communiquez avec nous faq commandes et achats expédition et taxes cartes-cadeaux salle d'essayage   politique de retour sécurité et confidentialité conditions mon compte inscription info-lettre nos boutiques trouvez une boutique international notre site web notre marque fondation les roses de l'espoir carrières médias © 2012 la vie en rose. tous droits réservés.
