date: 
sep 29, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca, m4y 2y5


at rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, rogers is the place where ideas become reality. we embrace change, and find ways to do better. and we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.
 
new graduate leadership development program – digital business unit
 
gain cross-functional experience across our various business units with the rogers new grad leadership development program and kick-start your career with us! throughout the entire program, you’ll have exposure to leadership and development training that will foster your potential. you’ll be paired with an all-star support structure who will work with you to ensure your professional goals and objectives are realized. we’ll also organize social and networking opportunities to help connect you with your peers, colleagues and senior leaders. to learn more about the program and who we look for, visit campus.rogers.com.
 
your business unit:
 
we’re building a brilliant digital future for canadians, and our rogers digital team plays an integral role in that. we’re responsible for the creation, design, content and experiences on all the digital platforms in the media, consumer and enterprise business units that is consumed by canadian customers across the country. that being said, we’re looking for an enthusiastic individual that is excited by the opportunity of joining canada’s largest telecommunications company.
 
your potential roles:
 
we can’t wait to meet you and talk about where you’ll make immediate contributions to our organization! successful candidates may work in one of the following roles:
 

digital analyst
digital coordinator
digital designer
design strategy facilitation

 
your experience:
 

enrollment in a diploma, bachelor’s degree, or post-graduate diploma in business technology management, digital arts, marketing, communications, computer science, computer engineering, ux design, public relations, statistics, mathematics, sciences or equivalent to be completed between june 2017 to june 2018
proficiency in adobe suite, microsoft powerpoint and excel
experience working with web analytics tools (adobe analytics, sitecatalyst, omniture, google analytics etc)
strong analytical and problem solving skills to transform data into actionable insights
understanding of design thinking and design processes
understanding of technical aspects of web and mobile applications
	 


how to apply:
 

submit a cover letter, resume and unofficial transcripts

 
schedule: full time
shift: day
length of contract: not applicable (regular position)
work location: 1 mount pleasant (083), toronto, on 
travel requirements: none
posting category/function: student/new grad & new grad
requisition id: 108952
 
why rogers?
 
as a proud canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. we’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.
 
we recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. we work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:
 

simplify and innovate
take ownership of the what and the how
equip people to succeed
execute with discipline and pride
talk straight, build trust, and over deliver

 
why rogers?  because your tomorrow inspires our today.
 
what makes us different makes us stronger. rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. everyone who applies for a job will be considered.
 
we recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. at rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. we work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. you can also reach out to our team at rogersrecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.
 
posting notes:  student & new grads || canada (ca) || on || toronto || none ||

job description - associate producer, digital - assigned to cbc q (english services) (tor06060)go to the main content section.français current openingswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - associate producer, digital - assigned to cbc q (english services) (tor06060)job description associate producer, digital - assigned to cbc q (english services) - tor06060  job family  programming (tv-radio-web)primary location  torontoposition language requirement  english onlylanguage skill levels (reading / writing / speaking)  - - -status of employment  permanentwork schedule(s)  full-time  description what it’s like working at cbc/radio-canada
 
at cbc/radio-canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects canadians on multiple platforms. do you think you have the ability and drive to keep up with this exciting, ever-changing industry? whether it be in front of the camera, on air, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making connections and telling stories that are important to canadians.are you equally fascinated by digital media and public radio?  do you know what content works
online versus what doesn’t – and why?

our ideal candidate has a heightened sense of seo, social marketing and what makes content shareable
and experience in creating content for a mobile and digital-first audience.
this candidate will demonstrate comfort and professionalism on all major social
networks, and havephotography and video skills.

our ideal candidate will always be looking for ways to grow audience and innovate in the digital audio
space. this digital-first thinker will reach out to social influencers
and establish successful methods for engaging new listeners and readers,
as well as providing value for our existing users.

as associate producer (assigned to cbc q) within cbc music’s digital content group, the successful
candidate will understand cbc music and cbc q’s goals and products, and
know how to leverage online and social content to help accomplish said goals.

reporting to executive producer, digital editorial, and with direction from executive producer, q and
well as one or more producers, the associate producer will be assigned to
support cbc q’s radio program on all digital platforms.
 
key tasks:
expertly packages daily audio segments from cbc q broadcasts, and supports the q podcast.contribute to the social team – creating social video, maintaining posting schedules
and more.edits and posts audio.create additional digital content to support radio content.contributes idea for digital original content.in-studio photography.copy editing.communicates with other digital aps and producers to flag content ideas trending on social.as required, also performs the following tasks:reporting on analytics.works with team to enhance social content.generates ideas for digital content across other cbc music properties.does event coverage for social/digital.writes material for presentation on air.assign, direct and co-ordinate the work of other personnel working on a project for which the producer
or executive producer is responsible.edit, encode, digitize and package audioand video material for a website using appropriate
technologies.participates in story idea generation with the editorial team environment, including potential
features, themed content weeks, youtube video, audio clips chasing guests,
interviews, album releases.
qualifications we are looking for a candidate with the following: 
university degree or equivalent with a minimum of two years' relevant experience in the digital space.experience and proven ability with various technical platforms including social media tools, audio editing, photography, photo and video editing, video encoding, content management systems.knowledge of the digital publishing industry, tools and best practices for producing editorial content.proven ability to critically edit articles and restructure them for flow, clarity, conciseness and online or print readability.working knowledge of basic html. proven ability in editing to conform to standard english grammar, cbc style and proper print spellings and capitalization; knowledge of cbcnews.ca style an asset.experience in determining potential legal issues and journalistic policy violations in print or online copy, and ability to act on them.understanding of canadian print libel law.ability to determine the newsworthiness of a story for digital audiences, social media/user-generated content and anticipate needs across platforms.ability to work effectively in a 24/7 online content creation environment, handle deadline pressure and to work flexible hours as required.a working knowledge of best practices, tools and processes for publishing original online video.passion and knowledge for social media and online video platforms, and how to use them effectively for digital publishing.a creative, innovative sensibility and high editorial standards.ability to clearly articulate content ideas/concepts.the ability to think strategically.ease in managing multiple projects on tight deadlines.ability to work in fast-paced environment with a flexible, positive attitude.a clear understanding of multi-platform uses for engaging audiences beyond traditional broadcast.
candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.cbc/radio-canada is committed to being a leader in reflecting our country’s diversity. that’s because we can only create and tell the stories that connect canadians, by having a workforce that mirrors the ever-changing makeup of our country. that’s why we, as an employer, value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as canada’s public broadcaster. for more information, visit the talent and diversity section of our website. if you have accommodation needs at this stage of the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible by sending an e-mail to recruitment@cbc.ca.if this sounds interesting, please apply online! we thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  job posting date  sep 28, 2017, 10:28:03 amunposting date  oct 13, 2017, 11:59:00 pmproficiency levels of second language:
-  = no level required
a = beginner level
b = intermediate level
c = advanced level  ici.radio-canada.ca|cbc.ca copyright ©  cbc/radio-canada

september 1, 2017, 35 hour per week)  location: 200 king st.e. status: full time support effective date:  immediately at george brown college, we have established a reputation for equipping our students with the skills, industry experience and credentials to pursue the careers of their choice.  as employees, we are committed to creating an enriching learning community for our students, delivering excellence in what we do, holding ourselves accountable for our work and demonstrating diversity and respect for one another.  what responsibilities will you have in this role?  e-mail marketing, marketing automation and crmworks with the manager, international marketing and business analytics to clarify objectives, establish metrics and define strategy for engagement campaigns for prospective students.builds program logic (actions, triggers, rules and end-states) to map onto campaign(s) objectives.designs and creates e-marketing materials and templates for various marketing initiatives ensuring compliance with the latest industry requirements -- canada's anti-spam legislation (casl) and aoda standards.monitors inbound email inquiries and responds or forwards to relevant stakeholders for a response as appropriate.updates and refines auto-response and faqs templates to facilitate timely and accurate responses.measures and reports performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (roi and kpis). web, search and content marketingdevelops and deploys campaign landing pages for online advertising campaigns.conducts seo exercises for the international website to ensure optimization for search engine traffic.executes quality assurance and testing across browsers, operating systems and mobile devices.develops and implements an update and refresh schedule for the international website in english and multiple target-market languages.creates presentations for key audiences of the international centre (e.g. agents, counsellors, visiting delegations, etc.).develops copy for the international website, email campaigns, print materials, etc.; creates infographics for social media, etc. social media marketingdevelops relevant content topics for key audiences of the international centre; create and maintain a content calendar.posts relevant content in accordance with the content calendar; reviews user generated comments and posts in a quick and timely manner. analytics and reportingidentifies data sources for different components of periodic reports/visualizations (e.g. enrolment plans and reports from ro; power bi datasets; oas dashboard reports; ocas data warehouse; statcan etc.). collates data using reporting/analytics tools such as microsoft power bi and microsoft excel pivot tables.conducts information gathering exercises to help inform decision-making for the division (e.g. competitive research across colleges/universities in canada on fees, english admission requirements, etc.). other related duties as assigned. what qualifications do you need for this role? three-year diploma/degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with concentration in digital marketing/e-marketing/web marketing or equivalent is required.minimum three years of marketing experience with 1-2 years of digital marketing experience.knowledge of and experience with digital marketing (search, web and content, social media, mobile, etc.). this includes but is not limited to:design, development and deployment of quality email marketing, marketing automation and crm campaigns.search marketing: seo and sem campaigns.web and content marketing: website/webpage design/development including optimization for mobile; infographic creation; video development.social media marketing: curation of social media properties for target audience engagement; social advertising.tech-savvy: thrives at the intersection of marketing and technology with a keen desire to learn as the digital marketing space evolves.familiarity and comfort with using a variety of marketing and analytics applications i.e.: online analytics platforms (e.g. google analytics, facebook insights); marketing automation and crm systems (e.g. pardot, salesforce); business intelligence tools (e.g. power bi).strong ms office skills with an in-depth knowledge of excel: pivot tables, formulas, etc.knowledge of html and related web technologies are an asset.fluency in english required; knowledge of an additional language an asset.combination of superior written and verbal communication skills and strong numerical abilities.excellent multi-tasking, problem-solving and time management skills, ability to prioritize multiple projects with competing deadlines.self-starter with a demonstrated ability to be responsive to short-term change, quick thinking, flexible, adaptable and resilient.effective ability to interact with others and deal with situations in ways that respect diverse backgrounds, experience and styles.strong work ethic demonstrated in previous roles with a commitment to delivering excellent service to others as this is key in supporting the success of our students and our what joining the microsoft team means…we are looking for an experienced enterprise sales enablement manager to join the central marketing organization (cmo). this role is focused on local industry events, ensuring gep connection and customer evidence development. the central marketing organization (cmo) is the center of modern marketing excellence. the cmo brings our modern marketing vision to life, providing leadership and accountability to drive demand generation and create fans through a connected sales and marketing experience. the cmo provides integrated marketing and deep discipline expertise in experiential marketing, social marketing, and analytics, working in partnership with the respective product and segment teams. the cmo supports all segments (commercial & consumer), products, and cross-product solution areas and maximizes the use of global content, focusing marketing investments in alignment with customer buying scenarios, and leveraging global demand centers (gdc) and global engagement programs (geps).   the enterprise sales enablement role is to enable vertical selling through very focused marketing activities.   the enterprise sales enablement manager will develop sales enablement plans to support high touch, selective activities for enterprise managed accounts primary partnering with the experiential marketing lead to execute local vertical events and to ensure global engagement program (gep) connection. in addition, this role requires developing local customer evidence and partnering with the marketing service center (msc) customer advocacy team.   the enterprise sales enablement manager will help to land microsoft’s global marketing initiatives aligned to our global demand center model with local relevancy. along with your integrated marcom peers, you will understand the global engagement programs aligned to the portfolio they support including the global content strategy and centralized demand generation plans to align and connect local marketing efforts. you will primarily curate existing context to efficiently enable vertical selling. working with your integrated marketing leader, you will engage with local sales leaders and sellers and drive visibility to the impact the global demand center, global engagement programs, and local activities have on our customers across sales segment.   the enterprise sales enablement manager must be passionate about enabling vertical sellers with focused marketing that drives impact. you are data-driven and able to extract insights from standard reports to continuously improve and optimize local performance. you are excited about marketing capabilities like marketing automation and unlocking new opportunities when data and technology converge.   the enterprise sales enablement manager provides enterprise customer insights to the corporate business groups via the integrated marketing lead to implement and influence go-to-market strategy for cross-product solutions. you partner closely with the cmo experiential marketing team to execute industry events, deliver customer evidence, and ensure connection to relevant global engagement programs (geps). the enterprise sales enablement manager supports social selling for bdm acquisition and opportunity expansion. as part of the cmo team, the enterprise sales enablement manager embraces the company’s marketing principles, is a microsoft brand steward, and communicates ongoing improvements needed to optimize local marketing investments to drive marketing efficiency, marketing impact, and scale.   the impact you’ll be making…•      partner with segment & sales excellence teams to drive sales process enablement, insight, & execution locally (20%)•      work with the area change lead & help sales excellence leads to accelerate gst landing & support locally (20%)•      leverage & drive standardized reporting to improve local execution (25%)•      land & drive segment planning with the sales excellence leads (15%)•      support & provide insight into opportunity management & sales execution (20%)who we are looking for…experiences      3-5 years related experienceskills & knowledge      history of driving rigor and sales discipline      experience within sales excellence, business planning, sales operations and/or finance       executive exposure & cross-functional stakeholder management      focuses on providing process optimization by understanding the desired business outcome      delivers end-to-end deep data analysis & “light ups” actionable strategic insights      innovates to deliver standards which enable speed, efficiency and scale in the business      deep knowledge on business process, sales operations, and execution      familiar with financials, pipeline, scorecarding, and other internal measurement tools      proven communication and collaboration skills       functional (partner, services, sales, marketing) knowledge preferred educationbachelors degree (b.s./b.a) required and/or experience in relevant fields eg: business, marketing, information technology, operations, finance. masters degree preferred. job # 321329 1070939 title: Member Services and Social Media Coordinator
text:
member services and social media coordinator | ontario society of professional engineers

share this job:





member services and social media coordinator

company:
        ontario society of professional engineers
      

location:
      toronto, on
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
 
from the streets you drive on, to the water you drink, engineers help make modern life possible. it’s their work that helps ensure we live safe and healthy lives, and that’s why it’s integral that their voices continue to heard by key decision makers across all levels of government.
we’re the ontario society of professional engineers (ospe), and we advocate on behalf of the engineering profession in the province of ontario. whether it involves organizing professional development events, or connecting with the many businesses and government officials that help our cause, we are dedicated to ensuring that engineering professionals have a key voice at ontario’s policymaking table.
we’re a strong, progressive organization and we’re looking for you to join our team.
member services and social media coordinator
as our new member services and social media coordinator, your role will be twofold.
on the membership side, you’ll be responsible for processing new memberships, supporting the renewal process, and helping to increase ospe memberships through phone and email contact with our members. you will become the go-to person for all member support, so that whenever our members need help, they’ll go straight to you, knowing they’ll receive great information in a friendly and personable manner.
the second part of this role will be creating and maintaining our strong social media presence. from implementing online marketing strategies and tracking campaign analytics, to writing snappy facebook posts, you’ll ensure that our online presence is fun, informative, and effective.
ideally, you are:

creative and energetic – you’re always looking for new ideas, and new ways to market our brand. you embrace the latest social media trends, produce great content, and are excited to dive in and make an immediate impact.
driven and engaged – you love to have fun at work, but not at the expense of quality. everything you produce is polished and professional. you work hard at what you do and take great pride in your work, and love seeing the positive results of your efforts.
positive and outgoing – you’re excited to come to work every day, and members and coworkers are drawn to your great personality. you love meeting, engaging, and talking with people daily, and are energized by great personal interactions.

you’re also someone who has exceptional communication skills and attention to detail. you can communicate complex issues easily, navigate multiple competing demands with ease, and do so in a way that makes people feel great for having come to you.
if you’re looking for a varied and vibrant role where you can have a big impact from day one, this could be the place for you.
working with ospe
this is a full-time, permanent position, working monday to friday, 8:30am-4:30pm, with a highly attractive total compensation plan, that includes three weeks of vacation and rsp matching.
we are a small, passionate team operating out of our head office in toronto. we believe in the autonomy of each member of our team and maintain a working environment that empowers our members to be great advocates. working with us will provide you with a challenge as we strive to tap in the vast potential of this market. we hope you will join us as we continue to champion the interests of engineers across ontario. 
qualifications

significant customer service experience
experience working with various social media platforms (facebook/twitter/snapchat/instagram etc.), including creating and curating content, as well as campaign analytics and reporting
excellent computer skills, particularly with microsoft excel
some experience creating customized visuals/graphics to accompany social media posts
experience working with paid digital services like google adwords, google tag manager and facebook business manager
experience creating and monitoring google, instagram and facebook ads
post-secondary degree in marketing, communications, or a related field


experience working with social media tools/content calendars such as hootsuite
knowledge of html/css coding
knowledge of google analytics and other tracking platforms

how to apply
our online application will give you the option to apply to this role as a complete person – not just a resume. the application will assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, and should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. after submitting, you'll receive an email inviting you to log in and view your assessment results.
we value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. if we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “help” button in the application.
we will all review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment, and look forward to hearing from you.

external posting descriptionour analytic team is seeking a consultant who is passionate about using technology, leveraging analytic models and approaches to solve business problems. ideally you will be someone who displays initiative, lateral thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving. your main responsibility would be to position the analytic practice with sas.  support the expansion of the analytic practice in quebec working on analytics and digital strategic advisory mandates and implementation projects
 
in particular you will be involved in :

work in a fast growing, problem solving, innovative, agile and technology enabled environment with like­minded people who are eminent in their respective fields such as analytics strategy, business intelligence, data modeling, agile bi delivery, data management, big data, data visualization, data science and much more
orienting, designing and implementing business intelligence and data warehousing solutions problem solving critical client issues using data to deliver valued results
balancing multiple client projects and other responsibilities
becoming a reference in analytics and information management, particularly in the financial services industry and in the marketing/customer oriented lines of business
participate in building the practice, growing the team and developing eminence communicating effectively to all levels of management

external posting qualifications
1 to 3 years in a business area such as finance, risk/insurance 3 years+ in design analytics and data architectures
highly proficient in sql (or a variant such as t­sql or plsql) programming 3 years+ in implementing sas technology
experienced in other sas solutions including base sas, enterprise miner, visual analytics and other sas technologies would be well regarded
strong understanding of the sas intelligence platform and integration with applications, databases, and service oriented architectures (soap, json, rest)
the capability of quickly, regularly, and independently learning new technologies under the pressure of consistent high­profile project deliverables with review by peers and analytic leaders
strong commitment to professional and client service excellence

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

external posting descriptiondeloitte's marketing and sales support group is seeking a marketing manager to support the analytics offerings.  as an integral member of a high performing team, you will be responsible for the planning and execution of a series of marketing related programs, sponsorship and events. you will also have an opportunity to work collaboratively with other internal clients to plan and execute on nationally driven programs.
 
reporting to the director, who leads the marketing efforts for high growth initiatives, this marketing manager is an energetic, ambitious individual with an aptitude for data analytics and who enjoys a fast paced, team oriented environment and strives for success and results.
 
responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

assist in the development and effective implementation of marketing programs and initiatives including:
	
content development for analytics-related promotional materials (internal & client facing)
contact management programs
digital marketing
develop and maintain content for internet and intranet
speaker's programs
internal and external communications
public relations coordination
analyst relations
contact database maintenance
budget management, reporting and invoice processing
conference/event/tradeshow planning and execution
develop multi-channel marketing programs for internally developed thought-leadership to drive interest to internal stakeholders and/or external clients


ensure the tracking and reporting of roi on all major marketing activities/campaigns
ensure compliance with communication policies, procedures and brand standards
assist in the generation or identification/modification of content to support all marketing activities including; thought leadership, whitepaper, newsletter, invitations, survey material, internal and external communications
assist as requested in the creation and implementation of strategic marketing communications plans
work alongside subject matter experts to understand the business strategy and ensure marketing strategy is aligned
recommend integrated marketing communications programs and activities to achieve goals
coordinate with regional marketing professionals to facilitate the sharing of information at all levels and ensure continued coordination of plans and knowledge sharing
manage outside agencies, consultants, research vendors, and creative suppliers liaison with suppliers for promotional materials
research and respond to all internal and external information requests
prepare reports for team meeting and schedule/attend meetings as appropriate
participate in and contribute to other relevant projects
flexibility to work evenings and weekends when necessary
travel may be required

external posting qualifications
minimum of 5-7 years of marketing/communications experience, preferably in a business to business marketing communications environment and/or in the area of analytics. professional services marketing experience an asset
1-2 years of people management experience, preferably with larger cross-functional teams
bachelor's degree or diploma in marketing, communications or equivalent experience
some familiarity with the analytics marketplace
a demonstrated ability to link marketing strategy to lead generation
advanced microsoft office skills (word, excel, powerpoint, and outlook)
exceptional writing and verbal skills
excellent interpersonal skills and client service skills
strong attention to detail, administrative and organizational skills
event coordination experience
experience in negotiating contracts with external suppliers, vendors and associations
ability to prioritize, multi-task and perform in a deadline oriented environment
independent self-starter that possess initiative, creativity, and leadership skills
proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving
self-starter, independent and proactive in identifying opportunities for new and improved services
an enthusiastic professional who thrives in a fast paced, team environment and requires minimal supervision
proven track record in working with project and budget management
willingness to learn and a positive attitude
a solid work ethic, team player and comfortable liaising effectively with partners and staff across all levels
aptitude for technology
bilingual (french and english) an asset

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

career opportunities






blue ant media is a privately held, international content producer, distributor and channel operator. from our production houses around the world, we create content for multiple genres including factual, factual entertainment, short-form digital series and kids programming. our distribution business, blue ant international, offers a catalogue of 2,300+ hours of content, including the largest 4k natural history offering on the market. blue ant media’s international channel business offers a portfolio of media brands such as love nature (international), zoomoo networks (international), smithsonian channel canada, bbc earth (canada) and hgtv (new zealand). blue ant media is headquartered in toronto, with operations in los angeles, singapore, auckland, dunedin, london, sydney, beijing and taipei.
check us out at www.blueantmedia.ca.
follow us on: twitter / linked in / instragram
our brands are a product of our employees who are passionate experts in all of these areas. they are fanatical about creating outstanding content and experiences; and enthusiastic about delivering it on new and evolving platforms.
we actively seek out people who embody our core valuesâ€”optimism, creativity, entrepreneurism, agility and integrity. we attract creative talents who are optimistic about the evolving future of content and who take pride in seeing opportunity where others see challenges. we encourage employees to think like small business owners by taking ownership on projects and giving them the flexibility to take risks and embrace an evolving media landscape. our team members excel at collaborating with internal and external partners and our culture fosters sharing ideas and treating all people with respect.
are you one of us?
job postings at blue ant media:



social media specialist, love nature


apply for this job! 
apply with indeed




positions
1
close date
13 oct 2017
location
toronto



as a key member of the blue ant marketing team, the social media specialist will own fan engagement for the love nature brand globally, across all social and digital platforms with the aim to build meaningful connections and encourage community fans to take action. this role is based in toronto and will report directly to the digital and social marketing manager.

responsibilities & duties


subject matter expert in nature and wildlife, with a pulse on key current events and issues affecting our natural world; and has the ability to create and maintain meaningful on-going connections with love nature fans globally.
own social fan engagement by listening and responding to fans and working with publicity and products team to ensure customer service is timely and consistent for dedicated brand.
cultivate and nurture relationships with fans, influencers, bloggers and love nature affinity brand partner communities.
create, source and curate a variety of customer-centered written and visual digital content across various formats (e-newsletters, images, gifs, infographics, blogs and videos).
lead organic social media editorial calendar planning, strategy and execution of social posts for love nature with the goal to deepen fan engagement and achieve identified brand kpis.
responsible for the creation and deployment of the love nature e-newsletter program.
source promotional assets and lead the creative briefing for original content needed for social media programs and digital sites.
track organic social media posts, analyze on-going performance, and generate actionable insights and learnings.
work with digital and social marketing manager’s guidance to combine performance results to provide a comprehensive weekly tracking report and actionable recommendations.
flexibility to work occasional evenings and a few hours on weekends for specific show and brand launch initiatives.


experience & qualifications


minimum of 3 years experience in social media with a demonstrated focus on community building and fan engagement in nature and wildlife
bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent experience in related field
proven ability to build engaged organic communities
savvy communication skills - written and visual
demonstrated expertise in planning and executing organic community management for facebook, twitter, instagram, pinterest and snapchat
strong working knowledge of google analytics (certification is a plus), facebook business manager, mailchimp, and up-to-date digital marketing best practices
project management skills with the ability to set and manage priorities, meet deadlines, and work autonomously
excellent interpersonal skills and team building skills; ability to work collaboratively in a cross functional organization and manage multiple stakeholders to deliver exceptional results
a love of all things media

blue ant media celebrates diversity in both its programming and workforce.  we encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds who are eligible to work in canada.
we thank all candidates for their interest in blue ant media and we will reach out to those candidates that are under consideration.  if you are contacted for an interview and require an accommodation during the recruitment process, please advise human resources.
 

  










blue ant media is part of the blue ant media entertainment network

title: Gestionnaire, stratégie dengagement de la clientèle
text:

titre du poste :  gestionnaire, stratégie d’engagement de la clientèle ville, province / état, pays :  montréal, quebec, canada catégorie d'emploi :  marketing date d'affichage (jj/mm/aaaa) :  15/09/2017 fondée en 1985, la vie en rose a su se démarquer comme leader canadien dans le domaine de la lingerie et des maillots avec plus de 2600 employés. l’entreprise compte plus de 230 magasins à travers le canada, et notre but ultime est de vous faire sentir belle et confortable dans notre lingerie et nos maillots de bain et de vous offrir un service à la clientèle remarquable. de plus, depuis 2006 nous avons percé le marché international et notre marque est désormais représentée dans 18 pays.à la vie en rose, les employés sont l’actif le plus important de la compagnie. il est important pour nous que les employés se sentent appréciés dans leur travail. c’est pourquoi nous encourageons les promotions à l’interne et offrons les meilleures formations possibles à nos employés afin qu’ils développent tous une belle et longue carrière à la vie en rose. raison d'être de l'emploi le titulaire de ce poste doit élaborer les stratégies d’engagement de la clientèle omni-canaux et guider son équipe afin que les meilleures pratiques d’engagement et de fidélisation soientappliquées dans nos communications à celle-ci. il est responsable de la gestion de l’ensembledes communications envoyées à la clientèle, autant sur le plan promotionnel que celles liées aucycle d’achat, et plus spécifiquement de la banque crm. de plus, il doit agir à titre de leaderpositif en assurant une grande synergie des activités auprès des membres de son équipe, dudépartement marketing et des autres départements. description des tâches - établir et communiquer les orientations, les stratégies, les objectifs et le calendrier de communication rétention, et ce, pour les bannières la vie en rose et bikini village ; - identifier les segments les plus rentables de l’organisation, et ce, pour les différentes bannières ainsi que pour des catégories de produits spécifiques ; - favoriser l’engagement et la fidélisation de la clientèle envers la marque en développant des initiatives à roi élevé (life cycle program) ; - superviser étroitement l’ensemble des communications destinées aux clients afin de s’assurer d’un haut standard de qualité et de la cohérence des messages et de l’image ; - personnaliser les communications afin d’accroître la pertinence du discours de marque et maximiser le roi, en se basant sur l’historique d’achat et le potentiel des différents segments de clientèle identifiés ; - travailler en étroite collaboration avec les cellules marketing afin de créer une synergie de contenu favorisant l’engagement et la rétention ; - communiquer aux différents départements les initiatives crm et les résultats obtenus ; - fournir aux différents départements des données par rapport aux opportunités de marché ainsi qu’aux tendances d'achat et ce, avec la collaboration du département d’acquisition ; - collaborer, être à l’écoute et réagir aux opportunités de fidélisation de la clientèle soulevés par les autres départements ; -recruter, évaluer, guider et motiver son équipe ; -gérer les calendriers ainsi que le budget d’engagement marketing ; -participer à d’autres projets marketing au besoin. exigences  un baccalauréat en concentration marketing, commerce électronique ou équivalent avec un intérêt marqué pour les statistiques ; un minimum de 5 ans d’expérience pertinente est requis en marketing direct, crm et fidélisation ; expérience en gestion de personnel ; parfaitement bilingue, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit ; connaissance des meilleures pratiques en crm ; habileté en gestion de projets simultané, avec des livrables à ct, mt et lt ; souci du détail poussé, sens de l’organisation et des priorités ; capacité d’analyse statistique poussée, aisance à manipuler des données ; expérience dans le commerce du détail et le commerce électronique ; leadership, bonnes aptitudes de communication et persuasion ; capacité à travailler sous pression dans un environnement en constante évolution ; capacité à trouver rapidement des solutions à des problématiques ; esprit créatif, intérêt soutenu pour le milieu de la mode et pour la rédaction publicitaire ; connaissances approfondies des outils suivants :o microsoft dynamicso google analyticso dotmailer ou autre logiciel similaire voir l'énoncé de renonciation postulez maintenant service à la clientèle communiquez avec nous faq commandes et achats expédition et taxes cartes-cadeaux salle d'essayage   politique de retour sécurité et confidentialité conditions mon compte inscription info-lettre nos boutiques trouvez une boutique international notre site web notre marque fondation les roses de l'espoir carrières médias © 2012 la vie en rose. tous droits réservés.

about sid lee
sid lee is a leading creative agency with 600 professionals working globally out of offices in montreal, toronto, new york, paris, and la. our multidisciplinary teams leverage the power of radical collaboration to build brands for the modern age, activating communication platforms to engage with today’s consumers across all possible touchpoints. rooted in strategic thinking, our work ranges from advertising to branded content, digital solutions, design & branding, architecture & retail design, social media, experiential platforms & activations, and analytics.
 
by breaking boundaries to create what matters, our company has earned a global reputation as a top-tier brand builder for some of the most progressive clients in the industry. sid lee is also at the origin of c2 montréal, one of the largest innovation events in the world, and is part of kyu, a new collective of creative companies established by hakuhodo dy holdings, the second-largest agency network in asia.
 
unfortunately (or fortunately), talent isn’t the only thing we’re looking for. we also like to surround ourselves with the bold, caring, progressive, and persevering types. you know, the curious ones who take on impossible challenges and see their ideas through to fruition, and the entrepreneurs-at-heart who aren’t afraid of failure. they’re the artisans who make our collective kinder, stronger, and more purposeful.
 
role the account executive works closely with the account supervisor. he/she is responsible for diligently managing projects, timelines, resources and budgets. furthermore, this individual will begin to recognize and articulate creative strategy, from briefing to final delivery. the account executive’s duties extend beyond project management; they are also an important player in terms of creating a fertile environment where ideas can come to life.   create space for the new - demonstrate business category expertise - structure analyses simply and clearly - stay well-informed of marketing and media trends  idea development - recognize good ideas - learn what makes a good, inspiring brief - recognize and articulate the strategic intent of creative - develop basic strategic recommendations - coordinate with strategy in developing work - provide constructive feedback to creatives  communication skills - persuasive - deliver prepared presentations with confidence - confidently discus issues in response to questions  - prepare solid povs on issues related to projects - clearly identify and summarize next steps  get things done - be a team player - master process and production - own budgets and estimates - proactively anticipate and solve problems - rally cross functional teams by keeping them informed and delegating tasks  business results - execute projects - understand how project and budget management impact account/agency profitability - manage projects within timeline and budget  build trusted business relationships - be the executional liaison - manage day-to-day clients - brand manager level+ - earn client's trust and confidence through responsiveness, reliability and know how  internal relationships and people development - you are the "doer" of the account team - establish strong partnerships with internal team to get things done - able to articulate agency culture to new team members   professional skills - analytical spirit and result oriented - delegation skills - thrives is a fast-paced and dynamic work environment - 360° vision of marketing communications - excellent understanding of business and marketing challenges, and knowing how to prioritize and communicate them - excellent understanding of kpis and roi - ability to intervene at strategic moments - excellent relational judgement, both internally and externally - ability to establish and maintain a relationship of trust with clients and act as an expert for all their account service needs  
 
requirements - bachelor’s degree in a related field - experience with (enter mediums they need to be fluent in) - knowledge of (enter specific industries they need prior exposure to) - fluent in english, both spoken and written

job description - brand marketing specialist (c04mg0)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - brand marketing specialist (c04mg0)  brand marketing specialist - c04mg0 piloti means “drivers” in italian. it’s what they
call the fearless racers who have faced europe’s toughest roads and tracks, and
it’s the perfect name for a shoe designed to help them conquer fierce
conditions, drive better, corner tighter, and get to the finish line first.
under canadian tire’s ownership
since 2014, piloti is back and ready to take on the racing world once again.  piloti offers a unique entrepreneurial work
environment within the canadian tire family of companies.  we are a nimble, growing start-up, where all
team members are integral to the success of the brand and play an active role
in driving all facets of the business – from product development, design and
manufacturing to logistics, marketing, pr and finance.  
 
beyond a passion for motorsports
and automotive design, we value creative thinking, active problem solving and a
roll-up your sleeves attitude. 
 
position summary 
 
this role is accountable for
supporting the piloti team in all aspects of the day to day business, with the
goal of re-establishing piloti as a highly respected, credible driving shoe
brand. 
 
responsibilities: 
 
marketing:
·        
accountable for
managing the coordination of piloti social media sites (facebook, 
twitter, instagram); monitoring online brand content (blog postings, 
features etc.).  liaising with our pr team and social media
team.
·        
monitoring
competitive and industry activity and events to help inform go-to-market
strategy as well as tactical marketing/pr opportunities
·        
coordinating
web-site and e-commerce day to day updates and agency partner/contractor
requirements; maintain and streamline online process; manage any website
upgrades/user acceptance testing
·        
accountable to
pull data, analyse and make recommendations to support business reviews,
marketing plans and resource allocation
·        
working cross
functionally with internal and external teams to measure digital marketing and
analytics performance, planning and measurement.  
 
administration &
logistics:
·        
accountable for
presenting a strong customer-service orientation to customers by replying to
and tracking customer inquiries and maintaining customer database
·        
accountable for coordinating samples, products, as
well as servicing media and cross functional requests related to marketing and
product development accountable for working with finance team to ensure all
invoices are paid in a timely manner. manage expense tracking.  ensure that pos and invoices are issued in a
timely and accurate manner, and accounts receivable are tracked. follow-up with
customers on balances owing. 
·        
accountable for
various administrative tasks --shipping, spreadsheet maintenance, managing
vendor set-up and contracts/documents, inventory management/tracking, and other
tasks as required
 
event management: 
·        
event coordination to support marketing plans and initiatives
– assist with planning and execution; sourcing, agency requirements, special
requests, marketing materials, on-site support etc.
·        
handling post-mortem of events. evaluating success based on sales, brand
awareness and digital metrics.  
  
qualifications
·        
a passion for
motorsports and design
·        
post-secondary
education in marketing or related field 
·        
internship
experience in consumer brands preferred 
·        
ability to
independently solve problems on the fly, and work in an unstructured
environment
·        
strong
communication skills
·        
ability to switch
gears quickly and efficiently and manage varied tasks
 
this position is subject to the
successful completion of the following pre-employment conditions: 
 
·        
reference
checks 
·        
criminal background

job description: 
                        
job requisition id: 805
business function: digital
working hours:
number of vacancies 2.0
job closing date 06/10/2017:
 
discover your future
broad horizons
there’s much more to a fun and exciting work life at canada post than a good job with a great company. we’ll help you achieve your full potential. you’ll find opportunities to develop and expand your career, chances to try out new jobs in different areas of the company, or even a complete change of career path.
job description canada post is committed to providing innovative physical and electronic delivery solutions that create value for our customers, employees and all canadians. the assistant product manager participates in managing products, solutions, and services to ensure that each generates maximum financial contribution while satisfying market needs and the corporation's service mandate.job responsibilities below are the main job requirements and responsibilities for the assistant product manager.
• participates in the planning, development, and monitoring of the corporation's product, solutions modifications, new product/solutions development, and pricing strategies to achieve corporate targets for revenue, volume, market share, cost containment and reduction, customer mail preparation, and net financial contribution for products, solutions and services. recommends required corrective actions to be initiated by the responsible corporate functions as required.
• participates in the development of market share, revenue and volume, cost containment and reduction, customer mail preparation and net financial contribution targets for products and services for the setting of corporate goals and the development of the corporate operating plan.
• identifies current and future market opportunities and threats and prepares assessments of forecasted impacts on the corporation's market, service and financial goals for products, solutions, and services.
• evaluate the market, service and financial performance of products, solutions and services against corporate goals and prepares assessments of variances form corporate goals.
• assesses proposed initiatives and plans of all corporate functions and the divisions to determine their acceptability and impact regarding the corporation's product/solutions strategies, plans and objectives.
• prepares detailed multi-functional corporate product/solutions operating plans and operating budgets which translate approved strategies and objectives for products, solutions, and services into the specific functional activities necessary to develop and implement the operating and financial systems, procedures and infrastructures to implement all aspects of the plan.
• assists, and monitors, with the implementation of the multi-functional plans to ensure that new products, solutions, and services are carefully launched and revenue targets achieved.
• develops and recommends sales contract pricing proposals for products, solutions, and services and supports sales and customer service staff in the concluding of approved agreements with customers.
• meets with major customers and national customer associations to gain customer feedback regarding the need for product/solution improvements and/or the impact of possible changes to product/solutions and pricing.
qualifications education
• completed post-secondary, preferably in a related field such as marketing, business administration, commerce, business analytics.
 
experience
• 2 to 3 years of relevant functional experience.
 
other candidate requirements
• proficient computer skills and competent with microsoft office programs.
• strong communication, analytical, and customer service skills.
• one or more years of experience in a unionized environment an asset.
• knowledge of postal convention, regulations and agreements an asset.
• excellent understanding of marketing and customer data, targeting and campaign measurement.
other information  
 
to take on the permanent assistant product manager role in the scrum team to lead the roadmap to delivery of multiple digital solutions for other lines of business, including parcels, smb, e-change of address, delivery preferences, etc. so digital assets are a source of sustainable and competitive advantage to the corporation in the marketplace.  the right candidate will have strong attention to detail, be customer-focused, have strong written and verbal communication skills and will have experience with qualtrics or other voc platforms.
there is also another temporary term assistant product manager position that will be hired for a period of 6 months that is responsible for supporting the scrum teams and product manager in creation of and management of product management artifacts and documentation as well as creation of executive briefs.  this person will plan activities to enable business growth and profitability by making our digital assets a source of sustainable and competitive advantage in the market.  this position will focus on channel management - customer irritants, (far, fpc), native, mobile and 2018 projects.

employment equity
canada post is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.
 
conflict of interest
the conflict of interest policy prohibits employees from hiring, supervising or reporting to, directly or indirectly via the reporting hierarchy, their immediate family or close personal relations. should you feel that you may be in an actual or potential conflict of interest in regard to this job opportunity, you must communicate with the designated human resources representative.
 
accommodation
if you are contacted by canada post regarding a job opportunity or testing, please advise if you require accommodation.
 
important message
your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as canada post cannot make assumptions about your education and experience. we thank all those who apply. only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
 
our leadership behaviours 
decision making – a champion of the organization who takes calculated risks and makes prudent, common sense decisions about current issues, future opportunities and resource requirements in a timely, well thought out manner that aligns with the corporation's best interests.
accountability – an individual who strives for performance excellence and who holds him/herself and direct reports accountable for decisions and actions and for learning from mistakes when intended results are not achieved.
business orientation – a proactive individual who understands the competitive nature of the business, and is committed to sustaining the business through excellent customer service and new business opportunities.
execution – a focused and self-motivated individual who acts with a sense of urgency and delivers on time and within budget, by dealing effectively with challenges and ambiguous situations.
leading people – a compelling communicator and leader who engages, motivates and inspires others to achieve results and who encourages personal growth and finding better ways of doing things. 

 
our values
canada post’s corporate values reflect the principles, beliefs and aspirations that guide our behaviour and shape our culture.
transformation – we will innovate and transform to win in the marketplace.
customer – we serve canadians with pride and passion.
integrity – we act responsibly and with integrity.
respect – we treat each other with fairness and respect.
safety – we are committed to a safe and healthy environment for all our stakeholders.

text:

cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution
that’s been providing a full range of financial products and services to 11
million clients for 150 years. at cibc digital we provide personalized, simple,
yet flexible digital experiences for our clients, and accelerate revenue growth
for our bank. our client-centered approach builds relationships and improves
sales and service through our targeted offers, atm, web and mobile channels. working in an agile based startup environment, our team is
comprised of talent from across all verticals – banking, consulting,
technology, among others. we brainstorm and incubate ideas at our live labs at mars discovery district where we
challenge ourselves to see the world through the eyes of the client, then build
and test our way to success. and we have fun while we’re doing it! join our growing team of digital groundbreakers with the bank of
the future. you’ll fit right in if you… …think like an entrepreneur…can see through the client’s eyes…love to challenge the status quo…have a passion for all things digital…understand that collaboration is necessary for success to learn more about cibc’s lines of business check out our website. to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please
visit cibc.com.  
job overview 

cibc’s digital insights boasts a unique experience within the
bank. positioned within cibc’s digital team, and with a startup-like
environment, the insights team is helping to lead the way in digital banking,
not just within our walls but canadian banking as well. for examples of current
digital banking solutions, please visit our website. reporting into the director of digital insights, the senior
manager is a high-impact role on a growing team. the senior manager is
accountable for overseeing a variety of projects and working closely with our
development teams, and for fostering an environment of collaboration,
problem-solving, knowledge-sharing and insight generation.  this
individual is responsible for delivering actionable insights that support
business strategy and objectives and that drive continuous enhancements to
transform the client experience of cibc’s digital properties. the ideal candidate will have a strong background in digital
analytics with a passion for understanding the broader context and uncovering
the story - the ‘why’ - behind the data. 

what you’ll be doing  1.  strategycontribute to the digital
insights roadmap and strategysupport and deliver key
strategic activities and milestones2.  relationship management continuously advocate for business
insights and customer experience metrics in all aspects of reporting
measurement.  help build trust, rapport, and credibility for digital
analytics across the organizationcollaborate with multiple teams to
correlate and share reporting, data, and insights, including:digital sales - to drive optimization
of online sales and marketingdigital strategy & innovation -
to help drive the strategic roadmapdesign & development - to help
implement changes to digital assets (online and mobile)many other business partners3.  analytics & insightsdevelop an effective reporting and
analysis framework aligned to overall business kpi’s, objectives, and goals
conducive to the optimization of all digital programs and projectswork with internal & external
partners to build a complete customer view in order to profile, segment and
optimize the user experience across digital platformsconsult with business partners to
understand business goals and the intended client journey. work collaboratively
to define and agree on kpis and target success metrics, as well as the desired
reporting format and frequency.work with the development team to
implement analytics tagging based on our standard data layer.  analyze and consolidate information from
multiple data sources (web analytics and offline data) using various reporting
toolsproduce recurring reports,
dashboards, and ad hoc reports for a wide variety of stakeholdershighlight and visualize findings and
insights in a clear and compelling manner, making it easy for stakeholders to
understand4.  benchmarkingdevelop and maintain
benchmark and trending analyses that support the business goals and customer
experience through the digital channelproactively report on
relevant multi-channel insights to provide context for performance relative to
other lines of business, and to industry-specific benchmarks

 what we’re looking for
university degree in business, math,
marketing, finance, information management, statistics or related field
(masters is an asset). solid understanding of research,
analytical and statistical methodologies and metrics and their application to
business measurement.must have 5+ years’ experience in
digital analytics, with proven track record of deriving business- and
client-related insightsmust have 5+ years of experience
using the adobe cloud platform – particularly adobe analytics (formerly
sitecatalyst), ad hoc (formerly discover), target (formerly test & target).understanding of the financial
services industryworking knowledge of online marketing
channelsunderstanding of web development best
practices, including knowledge of website design, html, javascript, and

(tableau, etc.)sql database and olap reporting tools

ability to translate data analysis into actionable business insights.excellent communication and

to multi-task and prioritize competing requests in a fast-paced environmentstrong interpersonal and

title: Growth Hacker
text:
growth hacker - powered by search - job board view our website view all jobs want to be part of one of the smartest digital marketing teams in canada?thanks for visiting our job board. please review our open positions and apply to the positions that match your qualifications. at powered at search we are fanatics about working with a-team members only! if you love getting clients success and being proud of your work, then you will absolutely fall in love with the pbs culture.we've been ranked in profit hot 50 and branham300 among canada's fastest growing companies, and have been featured in the globe and mail, national post, and toronto star. with a team that’s constantly growing, we are looking for the a-team players to join us in our vision to make brands achieve success on the web. growth hacker toronto, ontario, canada full time sales & marketing experienced hi there! thanks for your interest in powered by search. we are currently looking for a first-class growth hacker, is that you? before you say yes, ask yourself: are you bored of being the smartest marketer in your current role? do you know who ryan deiss, frank kern and russell brunson are? are you strategic, analytical, and communicate your ideas with ease? can you interpret data critically and craft a story around it? are you passionate about marketing and storytelling? are you organized and task-driven, and can’t quite get through the day without checking off your tasks on your to-do list? but most of all, are you able to separate what needs to be done from what can be done, focusing on the 20% of activities that generate 80% of the results? you’ll know you are right for this amazing opportunity if you have: at least 3 years experience in a digital marketing role. demonstrated ability to drive maximum digital marketing performance through seo, paid media, and marketing automation. expertise with planning and hosting events (meetups, trade shows, conferences, webinars) to increase brand awareness and generate new leads. expertise with hubspot or similar marketing automation platforms such as salesforce or marketo. experience with wordpress or similar content management systems. strong understanding of conversion rate optimization methodologies and platforms (hotjar, optimizely) expertise with sales & ad copywriting and familiarity with landing page best practices. expertise with email copywriting and email automation. experience with google analytics. familiarity with seo and paid media strategies, tools, and techniques. some competencies you’ll need to have: digital marketing fundamentals: you are certified in google adwords, google analytics, facebook blueprint, and hubspot. critical thinking: you are able to synthesize and execute on 80/20 strategies in your role. you think holistically and understand how your actions impact other areas of the organization. project management: large and complex projects are kept organized, within scope, and on-time. you are able to proactively resolve project risks and expertly handle objections. reporting & analytics: you are able to analyze and manipulate large sets of data to create easy-to-understand reports. your have advanced excel skills and are able to simplify data with pivot tables, macros, vlookup, and apis. you have intermediate knowledge of adobe analytics and google tag manager. communication: you are able to communicate complex data in a simple manner and craft a story around it to lead to business insights. you have strong presentation skills and are comfortable speaking in front of small audiences. results you’ll be expected to drive: drive 500 lead magnet downloads at a conversion rate of >2% on a monthly basis to grow the company from $6 million to $28 million in 3 years. now that you know a little bit more about the role, here is why working with us is a competitive opportunity: people join powered by search because they want to belong to a team that is winning and growing. we are the fastest growing digital marketing agency in canada, and serve some of the biggest brands worldwide. we also plan to triple in growth over the next 3 years. we’re home to the brightest and smartest marketers in toronto. if you get hired at powered by search it’s because you are amazing at what you do. powered by search employees are digital marketing thought-leaders. we run regular meetups, conferences, webinars, and publish value-packed content.   people join powered by search because they want to work in our amazing space.  powered by search’s office is a stunning open concept brick and beam space that is conveniently located across from the eaton centre on yonge st. making it super easy to get to. when you walk into powered by search’s office, you’ll feel the buzz from our fun and energetic space. if you thrive in a “work hard, play hard” environment, then you’ll love working at powered by search. perks & benefits we’re not trying to brag, but there are few places that offer as many perks and benefits as powered by search does.   to highlight a few: we offer the most competitive salaries comprehensive health, dental, and eye care flexible hours (with work from home days and summer hours) 5 weeks paid vacation (for everyone!) spot bonuses every quarter casual dress code paid social outings & events paid training (school, events, conferences) if the above got you excited (and we mean, like, really really excited) then we definitely want to hear from you! read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply wednesday, 13 september 2017 closing date: wednesday, 1 november 2017 (in 28 days) toronto wildlife centre region: toronto metro area type: full time location: toronto salary: (not entered) communications assistant status:  full-time location(s):  currently located at downsview park with plans to move to the rouge park area in 2019 reports to:  executive director compensation: tbd, commensurate with experience   about toronto wildlife centre   toronto wildlife centre (twc), a registered charity, is the only wildlife centre in the greater toronto area and the busiest in canada. approximately 5,000 wild animals are admitted to the centre each year representing over 270 different species of wildlife.  dedicated to the rehabilitation of sick, injured and orphaned wildlife, and to educating the public on wildlife-related issues, twc was the first wildlife centre in canada with a full veterinary hospital and the only one with a dedicated wildlife rescue program, and is open 365 days a year.  position summary in this unique and exciting role, you will combine your creative communication and social media skills with your passion for promoting peaceful co-existence for people and wildlife. you will join a fantastic team of staff and volunteers committed to educating the public on wildlife issues and providing medical and rehabilitative care to sick, injured and orphaned wildlife, with the goal of releasing healthy animals back into the wild. as a key member of the team, the communications assistant will assist with strategy for all communications, website, and public relations messages to consistently articulate toronto wildlife centre’s mission. your goal is to advance our position and profile with relevant constituents, as well as drive broader awareness and donor support. scope includes assisting with content creation for our varied and integrated communications channels and ensuring adherence to our style and branding guidelines. key responsibilities assist with developing and implementing an integrated strategic communications plan to broaden awareness of programs and mission, and increase the visibility of our programs across key stakeholder audiences identify fundraising challenges and emerging issues collaborate with staff to recognize communications opportunities and solutions, and execute appropriate strategies to support them compile marketing and user statistics to inform ongoing strategy assist with the development of print and web communications including social media postings, website and blog content, newsletters, brochures and donor correspondence, while maintaining brand standards and enforcing style guidelines assist with posting “to-the-moment” content on our website and social media channels and monitor our presence on social media channels assist with updating our website and review and approve content from other members of staff assist with managing volunteer photographers, videographers and graphic designers work collaboratively with communications staff and volunteers assist with developing messaging for annual fundraising assist with other communication and
