search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior performance analyst - digital marketing & insights (mar04315-17)job description senior performance analyst - digital marketing & insights - mar04315-17description position overview:   as the senior performance analyst on the digital marketing & insights team, you will play a key role in driving insights to maximize investment opportunities and strategy for telus digital marketing activities.   candidates for the role will be curious to understand the ‘why’ behind the data and are excited about the opportunity data provides in creating best in class digital marketing programs for telus. you will work with both internal and external partners to find insights in order to optimize our digital marketing spend.   candidates will lead the strategy to evolve telus’s digital marketing measurement and attribution to a best in class model.   our team is known within telus as a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment that is an agent of change and a great place to learn and grow. we have a culture of collaboration, recognition, and high-performance. simply put, if you're bright, ambitious and looking for a challenge, this is the place to be.   responsibilities:  lead analytics projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis work with agency and partner teams to define kpi’s and develop tracking/tagging strategies to allow for the kpi’s success to be measured manage regular reporting, scorecards, and dashboards (weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc requests) leverage data to tell the story of how digital marketing is achieving outcomes design, build and maintain financial models to connect initiatives/activity with kpi’s & outcomes for the channel or campaign champion, coach and mentor team members on best practices in program analytics proactively identify opportunities to constantly improve our digital campaign measurement evolve telus digital measurement from “last click” to a weighted multi-touch attribution model qualifications required knowledge:  passionate about how data can be used to solve business problems strong presentation skills with the ability to tell stories with data, and ability to influence and persuade executive stakeholders and working team members a flexible approach and the ability to accept and champion change highly organized with a demonstrated ability to monitor and manage high volume workloads creative and innovative thinker a bias for action  required skills & abilities:  advanced microsoft office package (especially ms excel) adobe analytics (report builder, segments, adhocs) google analytics facebook report builder doubleclick campaign manager sql experience with adobe audience manager is a plus  required professional designation/certification:  post-secondary degree in marketing or business mba (or equivalent experience) would be an asset  required experience:  5+ years digital analytics experience preferable to have digital experience in a telco along with analytics tools: domo, tableau, qualtrics, sql, adobe, google analytics, adwords  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

text:
job description - market research analyst (1707656)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inneed help? email us: staffing@fmr.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - market research analyst (1707656)job description market research analyst - 1707656description fidelity investments canada's corporate affairs group plays a key role in communicating fidelity's brand, value proposition and position on key issues affecting the company, our clients and stakeholders to the canadian marketplace.  
   
the opportunity 
reporting to the director, research, you will be responsible for the interpretation, analysis, and communication of insight market and/or competitor research in support of thought leadership, new business development and strategic business planning for fidelity investments canada and fidelity canada institutional.
 
what you will do   

assist with fic’s primary research program including: questionnaire design, sampling, data collection, and analysis. involved in synthesizing quantitative and qualitative data and preparing research reports and/or dashboards to be distributed to key internal stakeholders.
support retail and institutional on demand analysis and competitive positioning to identify key financial industry trends and uncover new business opportunities for fidelity investments canada and fidelity canada institutional.
oversee and monitor various projects for the corporate affairs group including scheduling, managing internal and external stakeholders, identifying risks, and reporting.qualifications  what we’re looking for


4 year post-secondary degree

1-3 years of relevant database analytics or market research experience, preferably in financial industry
the expertise you bring

strong interpersonal, numerate, analytical, writing, creative and organizational skills
ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects is essential
must be proficient with microsoft office (word, excel and powerpoint)
understanding of financial industry knowledge is advantageous
csc designation is preferred. mria designation is an asset
knowledge of spss/sas is an asset 
 
why work at fidelity?

about sid lee
sid lee is a leading creative agency with 600 professionals working globally out of offices in montreal, toronto, new york, paris, and la. our multidisciplinary teams leverage the power of radical collaboration to build brands for the modern age, activating communication platforms to engage with today’s consumers across all possible touchpoints. rooted in strategic thinking, our work ranges from advertising to branded content, digital solutions, design & branding, architecture & retail design, social media, experiential platforms & activations, and analytics.
 
by breaking boundaries to create what matters, our company has earned a global reputation as a top-tier brand builder for some of the most progressive clients in the industry. sid lee is also at the origin of c2 montréal, one of the largest innovation events in the world, and is part of kyu, a new collective of creative companies established by hakuhodo dy holdings, the second-largest agency network in asia.
 
unfortunately (or fortunately), talent isn’t the only thing we’re looking for. we also like to surround ourselves with the bold, caring, progressive, and persevering types. you know, the curious ones who take on impossible challenges and see their ideas through to fruition, and the entrepreneurs-at-heart who aren’t afraid of failure. they’re the artisans who make our collective kinder, stronger, and more purposeful.
 
role the account executive works closely with the account supervisor. he/she is responsible for diligently managing projects, timelines, resources and budgets. furthermore, this individual will begin to recognize and articulate creative strategy, from briefing to final delivery. the account executive’s duties extend beyond project management; they are also an important player in terms of creating a fertile environment where ideas can come to life.   create space for the new - demonstrate business category expertise - structure analyses simply and clearly - stay well-informed of marketing and media trends  idea development - recognize good ideas - learn what makes a good, inspiring brief - recognize and articulate the strategic intent of creative - develop basic strategic recommendations - coordinate with strategy in developing work - provide constructive feedback to creatives  communication skills - persuasive - deliver prepared presentations with confidence - confidently discus issues in response to questions  - prepare solid povs on issues related to projects - clearly identify and summarize next steps  get things done - be a team player - master process and production - own budgets and estimates - proactively anticipate and solve problems - rally cross functional teams by keeping them informed and delegating tasks  business results - execute projects - understand how project and budget management impact account/agency profitability - manage projects within timeline and budget  build trusted business relationships - be the executional liaison - manage day-to-day clients - brand manager level+ - earn client's trust and confidence through responsiveness, reliability and know how  internal relationships and people development - you are the "doer" of the account team - establish strong partnerships with internal team to get things done - able to articulate agency culture to new team members   professional skills - analytical spirit and result oriented - delegation skills - thrives is a fast-paced and dynamic work environment - 360° vision of marketing communications - excellent understanding of business and marketing challenges, and knowing how to prioritize and communicate them - excellent understanding of kpis and roi - ability to intervene at strategic moments - excellent relational judgement, both internally and externally - ability to establish and maintain a relationship of trust with clients and act as an expert for all their account service needs  
 
requirements - bachelor’s degree in a related field - experience with (enter mediums they need to be fluent in) - knowledge of (enter specific industries they need prior exposure to) - fluent in english, both spoken and written

job description: 
                        
job requisition id: 805
business function: digital
working hours:
number of vacancies 2.0
job closing date 06/10/2017:
 
discover your future
broad horizons
there’s much more to a fun and exciting work life at canada post than a good job with a great company. we’ll help you achieve your full potential. you’ll find opportunities to develop and expand your career, chances to try out new jobs in different areas of the company, or even a complete change of career path.
job description canada post is committed to providing innovative physical and electronic delivery solutions that create value for our customers, employees and all canadians. the assistant product manager participates in managing products, solutions, and services to ensure that each generates maximum financial contribution while satisfying market needs and the corporation's service mandate.job responsibilities below are the main job requirements and responsibilities for the assistant product manager.
• participates in the planning, development, and monitoring of the corporation's product, solutions modifications, new product/solutions development, and pricing strategies to achieve corporate targets for revenue, volume, market share, cost containment and reduction, customer mail preparation, and net financial contribution for products, solutions and services. recommends required corrective actions to be initiated by the responsible corporate functions as required.
• participates in the development of market share, revenue and volume, cost containment and reduction, customer mail preparation and net financial contribution targets for products and services for the setting of corporate goals and the development of the corporate operating plan.
• identifies current and future market opportunities and threats and prepares assessments of forecasted impacts on the corporation's market, service and financial goals for products, solutions, and services.
• evaluate the market, service and financial performance of products, solutions and services against corporate goals and prepares assessments of variances form corporate goals.
• assesses proposed initiatives and plans of all corporate functions and the divisions to determine their acceptability and impact regarding the corporation's product/solutions strategies, plans and objectives.
• prepares detailed multi-functional corporate product/solutions operating plans and operating budgets which translate approved strategies and objectives for products, solutions, and services into the specific functional activities necessary to develop and implement the operating and financial systems, procedures and infrastructures to implement all aspects of the plan.
• assists, and monitors, with the implementation of the multi-functional plans to ensure that new products, solutions, and services are carefully launched and revenue targets achieved.
• develops and recommends sales contract pricing proposals for products, solutions, and services and supports sales and customer service staff in the concluding of approved agreements with customers.
• meets with major customers and national customer associations to gain customer feedback regarding the need for product/solution improvements and/or the impact of possible changes to product/solutions and pricing.
qualifications education
• completed post-secondary, preferably in a related field such as marketing, business administration, commerce, business analytics.
 
experience
• 2 to 3 years of relevant functional experience.
 
other candidate requirements
• proficient computer skills and competent with microsoft office programs.
• strong communication, analytical, and customer service skills.
• one or more years of experience in a unionized environment an asset.
• knowledge of postal convention, regulations and agreements an asset.
• excellent understanding of marketing and customer data, targeting and campaign measurement.
other information  
 
to take on the permanent assistant product manager role in the scrum team to lead the roadmap to delivery of multiple digital solutions for other lines of business, including parcels, smb, e-change of address, delivery preferences, etc. so digital assets are a source of sustainable and competitive advantage to the corporation in the marketplace.  the right candidate will have strong attention to detail, be customer-focused, have strong written and verbal communication skills and will have experience with qualtrics or other voc platforms.
there is also another temporary term assistant product manager position that will be hired for a period of 6 months that is responsible for supporting the scrum teams and product manager in creation of and management of product management artifacts and documentation as well as creation of executive briefs.  this person will plan activities to enable business growth and profitability by making our digital assets a source of sustainable and competitive advantage in the market.  this position will focus on channel management - customer irritants, (far, fpc), native, mobile and 2018 projects.

employment equity
canada post is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.
 
conflict of interest
the conflict of interest policy prohibits employees from hiring, supervising or reporting to, directly or indirectly via the reporting hierarchy, their immediate family or close personal relations. should you feel that you may be in an actual or potential conflict of interest in regard to this job opportunity, you must communicate with the designated human resources representative.
 
accommodation
if you are contacted by canada post regarding a job opportunity or testing, please advise if you require accommodation.
 
important message
your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as canada post cannot make assumptions about your education and experience. we thank all those who apply. only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
 
our leadership behaviours 
decision making – a champion of the organization who takes calculated risks and makes prudent, common sense decisions about current issues, future opportunities and resource requirements in a timely, well thought out manner that aligns with the corporation's best interests.
accountability – an individual who strives for performance excellence and who holds him/herself and direct reports accountable for decisions and actions and for learning from mistakes when intended results are not achieved.
business orientation – a proactive individual who understands the competitive nature of the business, and is committed to sustaining the business through excellent customer service and new business opportunities.
execution – a focused and self-motivated individual who acts with a sense of urgency and delivers on time and within budget, by dealing effectively with challenges and ambiguous situations.
leading people – a compelling communicator and leader who engages, motivates and inspires others to achieve results and who encourages personal growth and finding better ways of doing things. 

 
our values
canada post’s corporate values reflect the principles, beliefs and aspirations that guide our behaviour and shape our culture.
transformation – we will innovate and transform to win in the marketplace.
customer – we serve canadians with pride and passion.
integrity – we act responsibly and with integrity.
respect – we treat each other with fairness and respect.
safety – we are committed to a safe and healthy environment for all our stakeholders.

title: Senior Manager, Digital Experience & Insights
text:
job description - senior manager, digital experience & insights (17015518)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior manager, digital experience & insights (17015518)job description senior manager, digital experience & insights requisition id: 17015518position type: regularposition status: full timejob: business analysiswork location: canada-ontario-toronto-40 dundas street west 3rd floorunposting date: oct 12, 2017, 10:59:00 pm description 
cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution
that’s been providing a full range of financial products and services to 11
million clients for 150 years. at cibc digital we provide personalized, simple,
yet flexible digital experiences for our clients, and accelerate revenue growth
for our bank. our client-centered approach builds relationships and improves
sales and service through our targeted offers, atm, web and mobile channels. working in an agile based startup environment, our team is
comprised of talent from across all verticals – banking, consulting,
technology, among others. we brainstorm and incubate ideas at our live labs at mars discovery district where we
challenge ourselves to see the world through the eyes of the client, then build
and test our way to success. and we have fun while we’re doing it! join our growing team of digital groundbreakers with the bank of
the future. you’ll fit right in if you… …think like an entrepreneur…can see through the client’s eyes…love to challenge the status quo…have a passion for all things digital…understand that collaboration is necessary for success to learn more about cibc’s lines of business check out our website. to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please
visit cibc.com.  
job overview 

cibc’s digital insights boasts a unique experience within the
bank. positioned within cibc’s digital team, and with a startup-like
environment, the insights team is helping to lead the way in digital banking,
not just within our walls but canadian banking as well. for examples of current
digital banking solutions, please visit our website. reporting into the director of digital insights, the senior
manager is a high-impact role on a growing team. the senior manager is
accountable for overseeing a variety of projects and working closely with our
development teams, and for fostering an environment of collaboration,
problem-solving, knowledge-sharing and insight generation.  this
individual is responsible for delivering actionable insights that support
business strategy and objectives and that drive continuous enhancements to
transform the client experience of cibc’s digital properties. the ideal candidate will have a strong background in digital
analytics with a passion for understanding the broader context and uncovering
the story - the ‘why’ - behind the data. 

what you’ll be doing  1.  strategycontribute to the digital
insights roadmap and strategysupport and deliver key
strategic activities and milestones2.  relationship management continuously advocate for business
insights and customer experience metrics in all aspects of reporting
measurement.  help build trust, rapport, and credibility for digital
analytics across the organizationcollaborate with multiple teams to
correlate and share reporting, data, and insights, including:digital sales - to drive optimization

title: Growth Hacker
text:
growth hacker - powered by search - job board view our website view all jobs want to be part of one of the smartest digital marketing teams in canada?thanks for visiting our job board. please review our open positions and apply to the positions that match your qualifications. at powered at search we are fanatics about working with a-team members only! if you love getting clients success and being proud of your work, then you will absolutely fall in love with the pbs culture.we've been ranked in profit hot 50 and branham300 among canada's fastest growing companies, and have been featured in the globe and mail, national post, and toronto star. with a team that’s constantly growing, we are looking for the a-team players to join us in our vision to make brands achieve success on the web. growth hacker toronto, ontario, canada full time sales & marketing experienced hi there! thanks for your interest in powered by search. we are currently looking for a first-class growth hacker, is that you? before you say yes, ask yourself: are you bored of being the smartest marketer in your current role? do you know who ryan deiss, frank kern and russell brunson are? are you strategic, analytical, and communicate your ideas with ease? can you interpret data critically and craft a story around it? are you passionate about marketing and storytelling? are you organized and task-driven, and can’t quite get through the day without checking off your tasks on your to-do list? but most of all, are you able to separate what needs to be done from what can be done, focusing on the 20% of activities that generate 80% of the results? you’ll know you are right for this amazing opportunity if you have: at least 3 years experience in a digital marketing role. demonstrated ability to drive maximum digital marketing performance through seo, paid media, and marketing automation. expertise with planning and hosting events (meetups, trade shows, conferences, webinars) to increase brand awareness and generate new leads. expertise with hubspot or similar marketing automation platforms such as salesforce or marketo. experience with wordpress or similar content management systems. strong understanding of conversion rate optimization methodologies and platforms (hotjar, optimizely) expertise with sales & ad copywriting and familiarity with landing page best practices. expertise with email copywriting and email automation. experience with google analytics. familiarity with seo and paid media strategies, tools, and techniques. some competencies you’ll need to have: digital marketing fundamentals: you are certified in google adwords, google analytics, facebook blueprint, and hubspot. critical thinking: you are able to synthesize and execute on 80/20 strategies in your role. you think holistically and understand how your actions impact other areas of the organization. project management: large and complex projects are kept organized, within scope, and on-time. you are able to proactively resolve project risks and expertly handle objections. reporting & analytics: you are able to analyze and manipulate large sets of data to create easy-to-understand reports. your have advanced excel skills and are able to simplify data with pivot tables, macros, vlookup, and apis. you have intermediate knowledge of adobe analytics and google tag manager. communication: you are able to communicate complex data in a simple manner and craft a story around it to lead to business insights. you have strong presentation skills and are comfortable speaking in front of small audiences. results you’ll be expected to drive: drive 500 lead magnet downloads at a conversion rate of >2% on a monthly basis to grow the company from $6 million to $28 million in 3 years. now that you know a little bit more about the role, here is why working with us is a competitive opportunity: people join powered by search because they want to belong to a team that is winning and growing. we are the fastest growing digital marketing agency in canada, and serve some of the biggest brands worldwide. we also plan to triple in growth over the next 3 years. we’re home to the brightest and smartest marketers in toronto. if you get hired at powered by search it’s because you are amazing at what you do. powered by search employees are digital marketing thought-leaders. we run regular meetups, conferences, webinars, and publish value-packed content.   people join powered by search because they want to work in our amazing space.  powered by search’s office is a stunning open concept brick and beam space that is conveniently located across from the eaton centre on yonge st. making it super easy to get to. when you walk into powered by search’s office, you’ll feel the buzz from our fun and energetic space. if you thrive in a “work hard, play hard” environment, then you’ll love working at powered by search. perks & benefits we’re not trying to brag, but there are few places that offer as many perks and benefits as powered by search does.   to highlight a few: we offer the most competitive salaries comprehensive health, dental, and eye care flexible hours (with work from home days and summer hours) 5 weeks paid vacation (for everyone!) spot bonuses every quarter casual dress code paid social outings & events paid training (school, events, conferences) if the above got you excited (and we mean, like, really really excited) then we definitely want to hear from you! read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* address phone* resume* attach resume or paste resume attach resume as .pdf, .doc, or .docx (limit 2mb) or paste resume paste your resume here or attach resume file cover letter linkedin profile url:* desired salary* earliest start date?* in 150 characters or fewer, tell us what makes you unique. try to be creative and say something that will catch our eye!* 150 why do you want to work at powered by search vs. somewhere else?* what gets you excited and motivated?* what do you think would be the most rewarding and challenging part of the growth hacker role?* if you were given a day off work, how would you spend it?* what does success look like to you?* submit application ×close forward this position recipient email address (one) your name your email address enter a message (optional) the message cannot contain links human check* privacy & terms

days) toronto wildlife centre region: toronto metro area type: full time location: toronto salary: (not entered) communications assistant status:  full-time location(s):  currently located at downsview park with plans to move to the rouge park area in 2019 reports to:  executive director compensation: tbd, commensurate with experience   about toronto wildlife centre   toronto wildlife centre (twc), a registered charity, is the only wildlife centre in the greater toronto area and the busiest in canada. approximately 5,000 wild animals are admitted to the centre each year representing over 270 different species of wildlife.  dedicated to the rehabilitation of sick, injured and orphaned wildlife, and to educating the public on wildlife-related issues, twc was the first wildlife centre in canada with a full veterinary hospital and the only one with a dedicated wildlife rescue program, and is open 365 days a year.  position summary in this unique and exciting role, you will combine your creative communication and social media skills with your passion for promoting peaceful co-existence for people and wildlife. you will join a fantastic team of staff and volunteers committed to educating the public on wildlife issues and providing medical and rehabilitative care to sick, injured and orphaned wildlife, with the goal of releasing healthy animals back into the wild. as a key member of the team, the communications assistant will assist with strategy for all communications, website, and public relations messages to consistently articulate toronto wildlife centre’s mission. your goal is to advance our position and profile with relevant constituents, as well as drive broader awareness and donor support. scope includes assisting with content creation for our varied and integrated communications channels and ensuring adherence to our style and branding guidelines. key responsibilities assist with developing and implementing an integrated strategic communications plan to broaden awareness of programs and mission, and increase the visibility of our programs across key stakeholder audiences identify fundraising challenges and emerging issues collaborate with staff to recognize communications opportunities and solutions, and execute appropriate strategies to support them compile marketing and user statistics to inform ongoing strategy assist with the development of print and web communications including social media postings, website and blog content, newsletters, brochures and donor correspondence, while maintaining brand standards and enforcing style guidelines assist with posting “to-the-moment” content on our website and social media channels and monitor our presence on social media channels assist with updating our website and review and approve content from other members of staff assist with managing volunteer photographers, videographers and graphic designers work collaboratively with communications staff and volunteers assist with developing messaging for annual fundraising assist with other communication and fundraising tasks as needed requirements excellent writing/editing and verbal communication skills strong attention to detail in both design and writing strong track record as an implementer who thrives on managing a variety of key initiatives sincere commitment to work collaboratively with all constituent groups, including staff, board members, volunteers, donors, program participants, and other supporters ability to work quickly and under tight timelines to communicate “to-the-moment” news and funding needs excellent and persuasive communicator self-starter, able to work independently, and entrepreneurial; enjoys creating and implementing new initiatives advanced computer skills — i.e.; ms word, excel, wordpress, adobe photoshop and indesign savvy with current popular social media channels ability to work efficiently and effectively within a fast paced and dynamic environment passion for toronto wildlife centre’s mission assets  education background in communications graphic design abilities experience in a communications role education and/or experience in fundraising basic photography skills basic understanding of seo and web analytics how to apply: please mention you saw this posting on workinnonprofits.ca. to apply: please e-mail cover letter, resume and references to hr@torontowildlifecentre.com[anti-spam measure - please enable javascript to view] with subject line “communications assistant.” attention shannon brown. due to high number of expected applicants, only those individuals who qualify for an interview will be contacted. no inquiries please. contact details: shannon browntoronto wildlife centre60 carl hall rd., unit 4toronto, on, m3k 2c1 tel: 416-631-0662e-mail: hr@torontowildlifecentre.com[anti-spam measure - please enable javascript to view] www:   www.torontowildlifecentre.com  thanks for looking on workinnonprofits.ca and good text:
job description - senior performance analyst - digital marketing & insights (mar04315-17)go to the main content section.skip to navigationpersonal business careers my accountsupportsearchsearch telus.comcareerswhy telus?search all jobswelcome. you are not signed in.|my profile optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagejob search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior performance analyst - digital marketing & insights (mar04315-17)job description senior performance analyst - digital marketing & insights - mar04315-17description position overview:   as the senior performance analyst on the digital marketing & insights team, you will play a key role in driving insights to maximize investment opportunities and strategy for telus digital marketing activities.   candidates for the role will be curious to understand the ‘why’ behind the data and are excited about the opportunity data provides in creating best in class digital marketing programs for telus. you will work with both internal and external partners to find insights in order to optimize our digital marketing spend.   candidates will lead the strategy to evolve telus’s digital marketing measurement and attribution to a best in class model.   our team is known within telus as a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment that is an agent of change and a great place to learn and grow. we have a culture of collaboration, recognition, and high-performance. simply put, if you're bright, ambitious and looking for a challenge, this is the place to be.   responsibilities:  lead analytics projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis work with agency and partner teams to define kpi’s and develop tracking/tagging strategies to allow for the kpi’s success to be measured manage regular reporting, scorecards, and dashboards (weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc requests) leverage data to tell the story of how digital marketing is achieving outcomes design, build and maintain financial models to connect initiatives/activity with kpi’s & outcomes for the channel or campaign champion, coach and mentor team members on best practices in program analytics proactively identify opportunities to constantly improve our digital campaign measurement evolve telus digital measurement from “last click” to a weighted multi-touch attribution model qualifications required knowledge:  passionate about how data can be used to solve business problems strong presentation skills with the ability to tell stories with data, and ability to influence and persuade executive stakeholders and working team members a flexible approach and the ability to accept and champion change highly organized with a demonstrated ability to monitor and manage high volume workloads creative and innovative thinker a bias for action  required skills & abilities:  advanced microsoft office package (especially ms excel) adobe analytics (report builder, segments, adhocs) google analytics facebook report builder doubleclick campaign manager sql experience with adobe audience manager is a plus  required professional designation/certification:  post-secondary degree in marketing or business mba (or equivalent experience) would be an asset  required experience:  5+ years digital analytics experience preferable to have digital experience in a telco along with analytics tools: domo, tableau, qualtrics, sql, adobe, google analytics, adwords  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

partner growth hacker ottawa we're looking for someone to optimize and improve the entire marketing funnel, from awareness to retention, for shopify’s partner program. you'll work with the growth, data and ux teams to prioritize opportunities and have an impact. whether it's experimental landing pages that drastically increase conversion, or innovative ways to leverage existing user data to promote activation— we're looking for someone to take ownership over the optimization efforts that help scale our partner ecosystem.you'll brainstorm, implement and track experiments impacting our primary kpis. you should be familiar with designing experiments, used to unpacking insights from data, and comfortable with simple front-end development (html and javascript). we'll look to you to unearth crazy ideas that just might work, and we'll trust you to test them and find out. you’ll be part of the shopify partner growth team, which is the marketing engine that encourages designers, developers, and marketers to sign up for our partner program, and motivates them to bring thousands of merchants on to shopify. you’ll be working on: ongoing marketing experiments and conversion rate optimizationforward thinking initiatives to increase user awareness, acquisition and activationlanding page/microsites aimed at acquiring specific target audiencesoptimization of marketing programs google adwords is essential. goal is to create content on my site and also on other sources of online marketing sites that will lead to phone calls/ potential sales.social media content & community engagement working closely with the me to manage social media content calendars to support key strategies and initiatives; execute against these calendars, including developing content concepts from idea to completion. i will give you specifics as to what to put onto my website and you will need to be able to translate it into chinese. accurately upload/schedule/post assets, including photos and videos, with corresponding copy on all social platforms (instagram/facebook/wechat/weibo/baidu/googleadwords) design and retouch social posts, plus make modifications to existing creative, as needed. conceptualize, produce and execute multiple creative outputs per day across all social platforms (including, but not limited to, standard posts, re-cuts of how-to videos, motion-graphics videos, animated gifs, cinemagraphs, etc.). shoot any required imagery, including styling and art directing. creating new content/ videos to add on to website - engage followers managing and creating a crm system to track new leads & monitor what helps drive consumer's traffic fully respond to questions, comments and related opportunities with speed and judgement. escalate questions/issues to consumer communications and/or legal as needed. generate metrics reports using standardized tools and craft analyses based on the data; assist in developing related early adopter of these technologies. demonstrate 24/7 approach to responsibilities.qualifications high school degree is an asset. some university course would be preferred 3-4 years related experience, e.g., managing community outreach, creating content, and customer service roles net savvy (high engaged in social networking sites & all things web 2.0). active daily life in online and social media. understanding of how create “brand appropriate (non-corporate) voice” in social media to build authentic, relevant, interactive consumer relationships. strong ability to interpret and translate brand strategies and equity into voice/programs appropriate for social media into chinese ability to collaborate and navigate among multiple teams, platforms and communities to ensure strategies/goals are understood and met. excellent communication, writing and quantitative skills. excellent judgment to drive optimal brand engagement in online beauty/brand communities and identify/escalate potential issues/crises. experience working with content management tools and/or social media analytics tools required. strong problem-solving and project management skills title: Market Research Analyst
text:
job description - market research analyst (1707656)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inneed help? email us: staffing@fmr.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - market research analyst (1707656)job description market research analyst - 1707656description fidelity investments canada's corporate affairs group plays a key role in communicating fidelity's brand, value proposition and position on key issues affecting the company, our clients and stakeholders to the canadian marketplace.  
   
the opportunity 
reporting to the director, research, you will be responsible for the interpretation, analysis, and communication of insight market and/or competitor research in support of thought leadership, new business development and strategic business planning for fidelity investments canada and fidelity canada institutional.
 
what you will do   

assist with fic’s primary research program including: questionnaire design, sampling, data collection, and analysis. involved in synthesizing quantitative and qualitative data and preparing research reports and/or dashboards to be distributed to key internal stakeholders.
support retail and institutional on demand analysis and competitive positioning to identify key financial industry trends and uncover new business opportunities for fidelity investments canada and fidelity canada institutional.
oversee and monitor various projects for the corporate affairs group including scheduling, managing internal and external stakeholders, identifying risks, and reporting.qualifications  what we’re looking for


4 year post-secondary degree

1-3 years of relevant database analytics or market research experience, preferably in financial industry
the expertise you bring

strong interpersonal, numerate, analytical, writing, creative and organizational skills
ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects is essential
must be proficient with microsoft office (word, excel and powerpoint)
understanding of financial industry knowledge is advantageous
csc designation is preferred. mria designation is an asset
knowledge of spss/sas is an asset 
 
why work at fidelity?

about the position
we are on the hunt for a junior media buyer with one year of experience and proven skills running digital marketing campaigns in platforms including google adwords, bing/yahoo, facebook, as well as programmatic suppliers such as adroll and doubleclick. we are also looking for people who have experience tracking these campaigns in google analytics, or other analytics tools. over the past 17 years, we've realized the importance of creating a fun, challenging, and focused work environment, and have worked with some impressive clients locally and internationally.  we're growing fast, so this is a great time to join us if you're looking to grow your career.
what it's like to work with us
6s marketing is a roi-driven digital marketing agency specializing in paid media optimization, media buying, shopping campaigns, paid social, and more. over the past 17 years, we've realized that happy employees = exceptional work and customer satisfaction. that’s why we’ve created an environment that is welcoming and inspiring for all 6sers. our culture club organizes everything from scavenger hunts to friday socials, and we support our communities through fun charity events. 6s is all about four-legged culture, too — cozy up to one of our office dogs. 6s values your aspirations, and we’ll regularly help you set goals to achieve those milestones. 6sers attend google summits, youtube guru workshops, and host lunch n’ learns to ensure that our skills are always sharpened. and we’re great at helping you celebrate your accomplishments with some bubbly :)
more about what we're looking for


one year of previous working experience in a digital marketing capacity


skilled with creating/maintaining spreadsheets and data in excel and google sheets is a must


previous experience with reaching out to suppliers and negotiating rates


experience working with ad servers such as eyereturn




knowledge and experience in digital media planning and buying


knowledge of programmatic media in general as well as direct buys and ad serving. experience with adroll, doubleclick, quantcast considered an asset.


in-depth knowledge of the google adwords platform


experience working with google analytics


experience running facebook ppc campaigns


knowledge of search engine optimization


degree or diploma or equivalent work experience


what you'll get to do


communicate regularly with clients ensuring their goals are being met and that they are happy with 6s services


meet with 6s agency partners and work with these partners to plan and execute client campaigns


assist 6s sales staff with initial meetings with potential clients


create, plan and execute on digital media buys including programmatic display, video, direct buys, and social platforms


set up and manage google adwords campaigns


create weekly, bi-weekly, and or monthly reports for clients that offer insights into initiatives and progress undertaken by 6s marketing


develop strategies for clients that will help them reach their goals within the budgetary constraints


monitor client marketing initiatives on a weekly basis to ensure that the activities undertaken match the budget of the project and will help the client achieve their goals


review project initiatives and measure progress against goals


proactively make strategic campaign recommendations to clients


manage client budgets to ensure proper allocation in accordance with campaign contract terms and project goals


quality assurance on various digital platforms


thanks for taking the time to check out this opportunity! unfortunately, due to the number of applications we receive we are not able to contact everyone who applies. however, all applications are all stored in our talent database and will be considered for future opportunities.

date posted: 
sep 21, 2017
                                

 reference code: 28626-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: kitchener; montreal; ottawa; toronto; vancouver 
external posting descriptionwe are looking for a technical lead for digital marketing, in our oracle marketing cloud team.
the senior consultant at deloitte works within an engagement team and is responsible for driving to a plan and with a team. the role requires liaising with the senior leadership (client and deloitte), and implementing core martech technologies for clients. in this role you will be responsible for working on consultative engagements to develops, implement, and optimize multiple digital channels campaigns and initiatives including web, mobile, email, social media, consumer relationship marketing, search engine optimization, search engine marketing and digital advertising. being the senior technical resource responsible you will be responsible for architecture and configuration of the marketing technology solution and will act as liaison between the business and technical requirements.
you’ll help organizations improve marketing and customer processes, optimize their data and approach to communications and analytics, and create personalized experiences… the cool stuff in digital marketing. ideal candidates will have experience with marketing cloud and complementary products, leveraging crm systems experience and integration best practices (salesforce, oracle cx, microsoft dynamics), experience with custom and 3rd party integrations, launching audience segmentation and lead scoring programs, and hold expertise in marketing orchestration, automation, data modeling and apis.

roles & responsibilities include: 

technical lead in implementation projects of oracle marketing cloud solutions
run and lead discovery workshops, create user stories, work with product back-log, and ensure clients get high-value implementations
liaise between technical and business domains, ensuring all parties are on the same page, on-board and that all potential pitfalls are covered
work closely with clients to design and execute automated customer journeys, campaigns and nurture programs
develop and execute social media campaigns (facebook, twitter, pinterest, etc.)
be at the fore-front of technology and stay up-to-date with the latest tech and news
work with clients to design and implement actionable measurement tools and kpis - conversion, retention, acquisition costs, etc.
perform demand generation/outsourced marketing tasks on behalf of clients including creation of email/landing pages/templates and web form templates
apply analytics to continually improve demand generation
position yourself as trusted advisor with our clients by showing great ethics, experience and the use of best practice

external posting qualificationsrequired:

strong expertise in marketing automation with several successful projects, performing actual implementations
experience defining marketing strategy and developing and implementing customer journeys and multi-step campaigns
experience designing and implementing lead score models and lead generation program
functional knowledge of digital demand generation, content marketing, social media marketing and email marketing
advanced knowledge of cloud connectors and third party application use and capabilities
reporting and analysis - experienced defining, measuring and reporting on customer engagement metrics and marketing return on investment (roi)
ability to travel to client sites 75-100% of the time.

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Jr. Data Analyst
text:
jr. data analyst - careers - g adventures

          call us, we're open 24/7

            resume booking
        



home
careers
open positions
jr. data analyst












jr. data analyst


department: marketing
location: toronto, canada 

apply for this position


we’re a tight-knit group of analytical minded, self declared ‘nerds’, who provide marketing intelligence for the world’s greatest small-group adventure travel company. we work fast. we work hard. we serve a global brand that stubbornly refuses to stop growing. we do it all in-house, and we have a blast making it all happen.
the g adventures marketing intelligence team is on the hunt for a passionate, intelligent, experienced, hard-working and authentic data analyst. if you fit the bill, give us a call. we can’t wait to meet you.
at g adventures, we’re obsessed with the customer, our traveller; it’s about engaging and connecting emotionally with each and every one of them, along each and every step of their journey - so they keep coming back for more. 
as data analyst, you will help to deliver proactive marketing and sales insights to support our business. you will be responsible for ensuring marketing data is set up effectively to allow insights to be uncovered for the marketing intelligence team. you’ll work though database queries, set up marketing campaigns for tracking, prepare direct mailing list files, and assist with report templates and analyses.the right candidate has a passion for analytics, is curious to learn, and is quick to pick up new skills. someone who has a strong grasp of different data types and sources and how they connect to each other. someone with opinions, and the ability to express them. someone who aspires to use their strategic and analytical skills to help change people’s lives through travel. sound like a lofty goal? we live and breathe our brand promise every day so, if this sounds like you, we want you on our team.
responsibilities

actively contribute to the dynamic in-house global marketing team in a collaborative and meaningful way that helps support, inspire and motivate fellow colleagues and managers alike
understand and become an expert in our industry, our business, our culture and our customer, and use that knowledge to create effective, impactful, strategic and shareworthy work
execute sql queries for ad hoc and ongoing deliverables
ensure marketing campaign data is set up effectively for reporting and analyses
ensure campaign tagging standards are effectively executed to ensure accurate reporting and analyses
manage the bulk loading of data to crm system to ensure customer data available for marketing teams
assist with the set up of integrations and automated processes for reoccurring marketing processes (stored procedures, etl, reporting etc.)
work closely with the data analyst and analytics manager to assist with set up and on-going maintenance of: kpi tracking, marketing attribution model, and standardized marketing reporting
support the global and regional marketing teams and other departments for anything marketing analytics related, on a day-to-day basis 
lead with service - we’re an in-house agency! - and contribute to an engaged and dynamic corporate culture

requirements

bachelor's degree in marketing, math, statistics, economics or a related field
some professional experience as an analyst, preferably in roles supporting marketing
must have an understanding of relational databases 
an interest or experience in data science an asset
must be detail oriented, with strong documentation an asset
must have strong analytical and diagnostic skills
demonstrates the potential to translate complex data into precise and simple insights for business partners
demonstrates the potential to critique and discuss his/her own work and the work of others in a constructive manner
possesses excellent communication skills, combined with solid and growing presentation skills
is collaborative and demonstrates a proficiency at building positive working relationships with multi-disciplinary stakeholders across the business 
possesses strong computer/technology skills and is highly proficient in microsoft office, excel, with capabilities in powerpoint and keynote
must have beginner to intermediate sql knowledge
experience with salesforce an asset
experience with business intelligence tools an asset
experience with digital analytics, social listening tools an asset

we thank all interested candidates however only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.
***qualified applicants must hold appropriate citizenship or documents permitting them to reside and work in canada***
g adventures is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. we consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

date: 
sep 19, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca, m4y 2y5


at rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, rogers is the place where ideas become reality. we embrace change, and find ways to do better. and we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.
 
the email coordinator will work cross-functionally to execute all marketing email campaigns and help drive the acquisition of email subscribers. the primary responsibility of this position is managing the scheduling, coding, and deployment of email campaigns, reporting on email performance and supporting the automation and optimization of customer lifecycle programs.
 
this position will report directly into the brand manager, tsc and will be located in mississauga, 59 ambassador dr.
 
what you’ll be doing
 

work cross-functionally with the brand management, creative, web and it teams to deploy daily marketing emails and digital campaigns
manage the email subscriber base and email preference centre ensuring casl compliance
schedule, code and test email campaigns ensuring all emails conform to standards and are viewable across multiple email systems and mobile platforms
execute and manage automated, trigger based customer lifecycle campaigns
identify opportunities to grow and optimize the performance of our email subscriber base
analyze and report on email and program performance and provide recommendations based on results
follow and analyze trends in email marketing and identify opportunities

 
what you bring
 

college or university degree
3 - 5 years experience in marketing with a focus on digital marketing, campaign management and analytics
strong level of digital fluency with ability to establish and adapt plans based on a robust understanding of digital metrics.
well-developed knowledge and experience with salesforce and/or exact target
highly proficient in microsoft office, especially excel
proven communication skills and passion for learning about the online/digital marketing industry
strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking
proven leadership ability, teamwork and collaboration; experience working with a diverse set of people
strong organizational, problem solving and project management skills
exceptional written communication skills
detail oriented and attention to follow-up
thrives in a fast past, matrix style organization and can adapt quickly and seamlessly to change

 
schedule: full time
shift: day
length of contract: not applicable (regular position)
work location: 1 mount pleasant (083), toronto, on 
travel requirements: up to 10%
posting category/function: marketing & marketing communication
requisition id: 107906
 
why rogers?
 
as a proud canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. we’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.
 
we recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. we work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:
 

simplify and innovate
take ownership of the what and the how
equip people to succeed
execute with discipline and pride
talk straight, build trust, and over deliver

 
why rogers?  because your tomorrow inspires our today.
 
what makes us different makes us stronger. rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. everyone who applies for a job will be considered.
 
we recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. at rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. we work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. you can also reach out to our team at rogersrecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

title: Actuarial Data Analyst
text:
career opportunities











actuarial data analyst


location:
markham - head office


employment type:
full-time regular


department:
crd&a: risk management


# of positions:
1



description
you, the successful candidate, will dig in and become an expert in our claims and policyholder information datasets. you will use primary and secondary data sources to construct and maintain databases. you will transform data into information, and information into insights that will ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions as part of our core deliverables. you will work with cross-functional team members in identifying and prioritizing actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. this will allow you to gain exposure to all aspects of insurance operations with respect to claims, underwriting and pricing, as well as general areas of business operations such as human resource and marketing. this role will work hand in hand with predictive modellers in developing models and identifying strategies that improve the company’s bottom line.
qualifications:

bachelor’s degree in statistics, actuarial science, operations research, optimization, economics, computer science or a related quantitative discipline
a strong understanding of clustering, classification techniques and predictive modeling concepts
minimum 3-5 year of data manipulation and statistical analysis experience, preferably working with large datasets
technical expertise regarding different data models, database design, data mining and segmentation techniques
analytical, efficient problem solver and attention to detail with an ability to work independently and creatively
knowledge of microsoft office, experience of sql, sas, r, python, tableau or visual basic
excellent written and oral communication skills

allstate insurance canada group is looking for exceptional data analyst to synthesize our extensive policyholder and claims datasets into business enhancing information that will ultimately impact the company’s bottom line. this is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals who work on high-impact projects to bring efficiencies to all functional areas of our business. the team works in a fast-paced environment, using techniques and algorithms best suited for solving challenging problems of the insurance industry
in order to be considered for this position, candidates are invited to submit their applications by october 10, 2017
allstate canada group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. if you require accommodation please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
allstate insurance company of canada is one of the country’s leading producers and distributors of home and auto insurance products, serving canadians since 1953. allstate is committed to making a positive difference in the communities in which it operates and has partnered with organizations such as mothers against drunk driving, united way, and the canadian museum of nature. to learn more about allstate canada, visit www.allstate.ca .
 
we’re proud to have made aon hewitt’s 2017 list of the
best employers in canada!

text: flipp - sr. growth data analyst, consumer insights and analyticssr. growth data analyst, consumer insights and analyticstorontodata and insightsfull-timeapply for this jobthe mission of the sr. consumer growth analyst is to drive our analytics capabilities forward, empowering yourself and the rest of the team to make more informed, data driven decisions; while driving action and results. flipp is looking for a sr analyst who is passionate about applied data analytics and excels at finding creative solutions to tough problems. the consumer sr. growth analyst will play a crucial role in helping the flipp growth and acquisition teams build flipp as the number one place consumers come to plan their shopping. the growth and acquisition team is looking to build the most effective marketing engine in the world, and to do so requires first rate analysts that can help drive the organization’s adoption of data and measurement techniques to drive this group forward.impactaid the growth and acquisition team in understanding what tactics are working, exploring new channels and effectively optimizing existing marketing tacticsdevelop strategies to test, measure and scale marketing channelsprototype new metrics and kpis to help our growth and acquisition team better understand consumer retention, engagement and qualitydevelop new, or significantly improve existing insight methods to solve new problemslead ad hoc investigations and data deep dives to drive decision clarity for business stakeholdersproactively identify efficiency improvements and affect change with useful resultsadd to flipp's knowledge base by uncovering or improving flipp's understanding of the consumer behaviour to inform different aspects of the businesseffectively communicate complex insights results and answers in a confident and easy to understand fashion to stakeholders; in both written and oral formatuse appropriate visualization techniques to present the analysis in a manner that is clear, precise, contextual, and easy to digestleverage tools like tableau and periscope to increase the data capabilities of other teams, and provide regular insights training, and self serve analysis toolsautomate any repetitive stakeholder requests that drive value to the end users what you bring to the team4-6 years experience in insights and analytics supporting marketing, growth and advertising teamsuniversity degree in math or statistics preferredstrong business acumenproficient in sql and extensive experience with data visualization; familiarity with r or python would be a plusknowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasetstechnical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniquesstrong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyhave excellent communication and writing skills, can facilitate meetings, gather requirements/business rules and show the ability to work with both the business stakeholders and development teamstrong problem solving skills - we like to hire people who can think through problems and develop solutions quicklystrong ability to prioritize and take on several critical projects at onceflipp corporation is an award winning technology company (2014, 2015, 2016, and 2017 best workplaces in canada award and also being awarded the 2015 deloitte's best managed companies) that is reinventing the weekly shopping experience. our digital flyer platform is used by the leading retailers across north america, including walmart and target. our mobile app, flipp, has already captured the hearts of canadians and americans alike, with millions of downloads and the honour of being named the #1 retail flyer app in canada. flipp’s culture is an integral part of what has driven the company’s success. we abide by key principles that promote the growth of others and create a high-trust environment. learn more about our team culture here: https://corp.flipp.com/cultureflipp welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.apply for this jobflipp home pagejobs powered by

pcm is expanding and looking to add an enthusiastic, professional, and goal-oriented lenovo data center group (dcg) specialist to our team. the lenovo dcg specialist will be responsible for identifying and targeting pcm clients and prospects to promote the value and benefits of lenovo hardware, software and services.  you will be responsible for growing pcm’s national territory within our existing account base as well as driving new accounts by leading with lenovo.  this position will be supported by sales, marketing and technical support resources.  in a high level consultative role, your objective will be to build a strong lenovo pipeline and an annual run rate focusing on the mid-market to enterprise corporate customers.
responsibilities: 

developing, maintaining, and leveraging strong relationships with distributors.
meeting and exceeding sales goals while being responsible for overall account strategy development.
developing knowledge of pcm’s practices, products, and services to facilitate successful sales efforts.
developing market and competitor knowledge.
assist pcm's internal sales teams with pre- and post-sales activities for lenovo products.
educate pcm's and lenovo account managers on the technologies and resources available to them from the other's organization.
increase pcm's sales team productivity, deal size, and awareness of all lenovo lines of business.
promote all of the available lenovo program resources and tools to the pcm   sales teams.
coordinate quarterly business reviews and monthly conference calls.
provide   weekly   reporting   on   pcm's   sales (in   excel spreadsheet format). 
train pcm's sales teams to sell lenovo products using a combination of programs, including, but not limited to, lunch and learns, new hire training, and new product training.
increase lenovo deal registration awareness by providing support and training to pcm's sales teams.
review pcm's pipeline information to optimize sales opportunities.
provide feedback and guidance to pcm's sales teams around execution of lenovo sales programs and incentives.
act as first point of escalation for pcm's customers and sales teams;
participate in conference calls with pcm's sales representative and their customers to answer questions, recommend solutions, and assist with closing sales or lenovo products and services.

 
physical requirements

some travel might be required, including driving
extended working hours may be required occasionally
handling maximum of 20 lbs 
office environment that includes lengthy periods of sitting at desk, lengthy periods of standing in front of the audience, computer work and phone work
hand use (frequent)
present to the audience and speak publicly
read and write

 
qualifications (education/experience/skills & abilities)

minimum 3 years’ experience in lenovo products sales, including data center
bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
self-starter, multi-task abilities and the ability to lead in a team environment
web reseller, b2b, distribution channel, it commodity buying experience
sales or marketing experience specifically with vendor solutions
understanding of web analytics and metrics
strong negotiation skills
have the ability to develop merchandising strategies
inventory management experience
advanced pc skills of microsoft office are required (excel, word, outlook, and powerpoint)
strong communication skills
strong analytical and organizational skills, ability to multi-task, work independently and on tight deadlines and perform well under pressure
must be able to work well in teams
management experience a plus
must be able to work extended hours as needed
