job number:j00046506toronto , ontario  cadata scientist equifax is a global information solutions company that uses trusted unique data, innovative analytics, technology and industry expertise to power organizations and individuals around the world by transforming knowledge into insights that help make more informed business and personal decisions. the company organizes, assimilates and analyzes data on more than 820 million consumers and more than 91 million businesses worldwide, and its database includes employee data contributed from more than 7,100 employers. headquartered in atlanta, ga., equifax operates or has investments in 24 countries in north america, central and south america, europe and the asia pacific region. it is a member of standard & poor's (s&p) 500 index, and its common stock is traded on the new york stock exchange (nyse) under the symbol efx. equifax employs approximately 9,900 employees worldwide.  some noteworthy achievements for the company include: named to the top 100 american banker fintech forward list (2015-2016); named a top technology provider on the fintech 100 list (2004-2016); named an informationweek elite 100 winner (2014-2015); named a top workplace by atlanta journal constitution (2013-2017); named one of fortune's world's most admired companies (2011-2015); named one of forbes' world's 100 most innovative companies (2015-2017). for more information, visit www.equifax.com . position summary:as a data scientist, you will be leveraging our big data environment to create and apply advanced machine learning and statistical techniques. the data scientist is essential to ensuring our continued commitment to provide quality insight to our clients and stakeholders. the data scientist position is responsible for paving the way of the future when it comes to analytics and data management.as part of the data and analytics team you will be a key player in the development of new models and solutions on a wide assortment of domain, not limited to credit risk, fraud and marketing. the data and analytics are accountable for using multiple data sources towards building actionable insight for equifax's customers.additional responsibilities of the data scientist include:- develop and continuously enhance data expertise for current and new equifax data, and provide documentation and internal and external consulting regarding optimal data utilization.- work closely with internal and external clients to understand the objectives of their projects and serve as an analytics subject matter expert leading the design of best data and analytics approaches, highlighting solutions, alternative approaches, as well as potential limitations.- assess analysis results and provide direction for proper interpretation and usage of the analytics solutions.      - develop custom analytics solutions, including statistical models, decision trees, segmentation solutions, attributes and analytical reports for various industries and business objectives.- provide detailed technical documentation of standard reporting/extraction criteria used for the analysis, as well as the actual solution.- utilize, develop and automate the most appropriate processes to increase turnaround time for analytics projects and to increase efficiencies in the statistical model-building process. - individually, and as part of the team, provide thought leadership in analytics and model building by staying on top of new developments in the field.- propose and implement improvements to actual models using machine learning techniques (neural networks of various kinds, gradient boosting, random forest, ensemble models, etc.)- manage innovation projects and meet deadlines, work with other team members.- act as a spokesperson for equifax's analytical expert team at conferences and client presentationsrequired skills of the data scientist:- proven experience designing and building analytical solutions to solve real world problems, with strong preference of this experience in financial risk area.- minimum of 5 years of data manipulation experience.- minimum of 5 years of experience, specifically in statistical/data analysis and data mining, experimental design, cluster analysis, building decision trees, and predictive modeling- proficiency in sql and at least one of the following languages: python, r- experience with hadoop technologies- proven experience delivering data analysis, machine learning and statistical modelspreferred skills of the data scientist:- proficiency in oracle sql- knowledge of database design and data modeling- experience managing innovation/r&d projects- working knowledge of at least one business intelligence tool (e.g. business objects, cognos, spotfire)- working knowledge of java and / or scala- working knowledge of sas (base sas, sas macros, sas stat, em, eg) or ability to learn quickly.- knowledge of the financial services industry and credit informationeducation:- advanced degree (ph.d. preferred) in statistics, math, operations research, computer science, actuarial science, econometrics or other related quantitative discipline.- statistics, mathematics, computer science or engineering including experience with machine learning through education or practice.                                                       primary location:can-toronto-5700 yongefunction:function - data and analyticsschedule:full timeequifax is an equal employment opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

overview:   the performance analysis consultant is an expert/advisory level position. as performance analysis consultant – customer 360 insights within the journey design & delivery team, this candidate will be reporting to manager, c360 insights. the candidate will be responsible for providing actionable customer insights to resolve strategic and tactical marketing issues by building advanced statistical models using sas, sql and other data mining tools. the role would be expected to provide thought-leadership in researching new modeling techniques/solutions to solve complex marketing issues. along with the manager, c360 insights, the candidate will co-lead the integration of customer insights into telus’ omni channel marketing strategy to enable better decisions that drive revenue/ebitda growth, manage churn and reduce customer effort across various lines of business.   responsibilities:  strategies and planning:  assist the manager, c360 insights to cultivate a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture inside and outside the marketing department and implement the best-in-class end-to-end modeling process to gain operational efficiency assist the manager, c360 insight to identify business issues through analytics; provide actionable insights and influence business partners to take action based on analytical/modeling insights   thought leadership and teamwork:  contribute to the ongoing development of the team by sharing information, success, lessons learned of own project work collaboratively with marketing primes to develop modelling requirements and prioritization; present model results and actionable recommendations to internal business clients and senior leadership mentors junior team members from a technical as well as business acumen perspective assist the manager, c360 insights to drive for the cultivation of a hybrid culture (analytics and business) to share insights/learnings to demonstrate value of big data analytics and investments to business partner teams (data - insights - strategy - results)   day-to-day portfolio/deliverable management:  contribute to the development of the omni channel strategy by developing near real-time predictive models and trigger based strategies leveraging sas/sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, python, r, etc work collaboratively with business partners teams to understand, compartmentalize complex and ambiguous business issues into crisp and manageable pieces develop analytical blueprint to solve compartmentalized business issues and assembly to the big picture solution present customer insights to cross functional business partners including marketing, channel, products & services, customer experience and digital own the end-to-end development of campaign targeting through analytics and building propensity models/response models using various multivariate modelling/data mining techniques   expert knowledge:  be recognized as the top expert in predictive modeling, data mining, r&d within telus educate, advocate and advise cross-functional business partners at team member level in advanced analytics and predictive modeling maintain a solid and updated knowledge in the predictive modeling, data mining field including applications of big data, text analytics, social network analytics, cross channel modelling   qualifications required knowledge:  business orientation:  advanced business acumen, relationship management and influencing without authority skills; ability to provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis strong ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholders and meet deadlines with quality deliverables advanced written, oral, communications, presentation skills and knowledge of microsoft office suite   technical expertise:  advanced knowledge in various advanced predictive modeling/data mining techniques to ensure effective solutions to marketing issues extensive hands-on experience in sas (or sas enterprise guide), sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, r, python, sql and other data query language on unix/pc and comfortable working with very large data sets and databases strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills    required skills & abilities:  change management: self-driven individual with ability to adapt to varying business environments and effectively drive business results by leveraging analytics mentorship: strong leadership, coaching, mentoring skills  required professional designation/certification:  phd in statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative field is preferred master’s degree with extensive relevant experience and knowledge will be strongly considered  required experience:  10+ years of related predictive modeling experience, preferably in marketing telecom/industry experience would be beneficial credit risk modeling experience will be considered  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants testimonials view fitness class schedule club hours & location free day passget membership information ◄ back digital marketing strategist salaried toronto/etobicoke posted 3 weeks ago who are we? movati athletic is driven by a vision to empower people’s lives through fitness and health, making the communities we serve healthier and happier.   we’re not your typical gym.  from the moment you step inside one of our clubs, you’ll experience the difference.  this is why our mission is to passionately deliver an experience that makes our members feel welcome, feel comfortable and feel healthy. established in 1997, movati athletic is a pioneer in the fitness industry offering an experience that goes beyond just working out.  we continuously work hard to ensure our services, amenities and employees provide the ultimate well-being experience at an affordable price.  what began as one club has now grown to 13, with more on the way. employing 1,500 full and part time employees (and growing), our caring and exceptional people help ensure our members improve their quality of life.  we continue to hire exceptional, caring individuals, adding to our family of movati athletic employees. we’re always on the lookout for the best and brightest to join our expanding company.  currently, we are searching for a digital marketing strategist, at our toronto office.  reporting to the director of marketing, in this newly created role the incumbent oversees the digital marketing communications, acquisition and retention strategies to generate movati brand awareness, drive sales and leads, and cultivate member loyalty. what can you expect in this role? key responsibilities: responsible for strategy and execution of sem, crm, mobile applications, social media and display advertising campaigns, working in conjunction with direct reports, internal and agency partners build and manage new crm infrastructure including email communication, push notifications and making recommendation around other forms of communication. work in partnership with business leaders, particularly sales, to develop the strategy & readiness campaigns for seamless execution. oversee content strategy on digital display management track, measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns and assess against goals such as site engagement metrics, sources of traffic, campaign performance measurement (i.e. lead generation – cpm, cpc, ctr, cpa), landing page conversion rates, social engagement rates and organic searches. analyze campaigns, recommend solutions and translate into plans as well as actions for ongoing campaign improvement. plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests (a/b testing). utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points. design, build, plan and maintain a high quality and relevant social media calendar/content across key platforms including facebook, instagram, twitter, and linkedin with agreed objectives and kpis. concept and content development across digital platforms – e.g. new formats (gif’s / meme’s), video content, articles, blog content. ensure high brand awareness and brand compliance for all online assets created/developed.   interpersonal suitability thought leadership: identify trends and insights, to optimize spend and performance based on the insights. brainstorm new and creative growth strategies in line with business objectives. evaluate emerging technologies and capability to market. provide thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate.   team development & collaboration: lead direct report(s) in planning and execution collaborate, support and work closely with marketing team-mates, human resources, operational and sales management teams (sales, group fitness,) to ensure meeting of business objectives and kpis. collaborate with creative, digital and media agencies and work with external vendors and effectively manage roi to ensure cost effectiveness for the business.   movati culture integration: proven leadership to ensure alignment with operational and strategic objectives. work calmly and systematically under stressful situations. liaise effectively with all levels of staff, partners and vendors.  self-directed individual, able to work autonomously. self-motivated, detail-oriented and organized. excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, organizational, and presentation skills. tactful and helpful with other staff. able to interact with other organizations’ technical staff effectively. well organized and reliable. able to handle multiple tasks, and work independently with minimum supervision. trustworthy with privilege accounts & information.    key qualifications: minimum 5-7 years’ experience as a digital marketing manager or strategist degree and or diploma in a related inter-disciplinary program experience managing direct reports (minimum 1-2 team members) experience in managing agencies and suppliers breadth of ‘hands on’ digital skills – able to coordinate digital activity as well as execute demonstrate past ecrm strategies/success experience with salesforce cloud computing/crm an asset able to confidently use google analytics to assess and evaluate all digital activities experience managing ppc campaigns and understanding of on and off page search engine optimization strategies keen understanding of mobile applications and how to market them effectively. knowledge of email best practices including subject lines, messaging, segmentation, list management, deliverability and can-spam/anti-spam laws intermediate knowledge and application of social media state / country / province  ontario   job description  position:                           digital marketing coordinatorreports to:                      digital marketing managerdivision:                            gtslocation:                          mississauga, ontariostanley black & decker (sbd) is one of the world's largest, fastest-growing, and most dynamic companies. we are unique in that we have a rich and storied history dating back to 1843, but that hasn't stopped us from evolving into a vibrant, diverse, global growth company. we have been globally recognized as one of the most innovative, sustainable, and rewarding companies in the world. stanley black and decker’s 2015 revenue was 11.2b and our global tools & storage division is responsible for $7.1b of sbd annual revenue.summary:the digital marketing coordinator is responsible for helping the digital marketing manager with the execution of the digital marketing and merchandising strategy for branded power tools businesses and working cross functionally to support power tools initiatives with the digital property owners on digital initiatives. in this role, you will apply your understanding of the online marketplace to create digital marketing solutions -- from strategy to development, launch, measurement and optimization -- that drives brand and product awareness, increase purchase intent through lead generation and drive loyalty. key responsibilities:• implement overall digital marketing strategies for the porter-cable, bostitch, stanley fatmax and mac and iar branded power tools businesses - serving as the day-to-day digital account manager.• partner closely with the digital marketing team leads, brand marketing and product teams to develop and execute leading digital strategies.•  operate as project management liaison between product and  shared digital marketing teams.• serve as digital marketing lead for porter-cable, bostitch, stanley fatmax, mac and iar branded power tools initiatives including day-to-day operation, management, and optimization across sbu and cross-functional support teams. • manage the social media channels for our brands in canada – this includes creating daily content, engaging with users online and putting together a full social media strategy.  • identify and develop new traffic-driving opportunities to increase reach, customer acquisition and sales.• establish and maintain a consistent brand image throughout all digital marketing initiatives across web, mobile and social owned properties.• gather internal customer requirements and use them to create in-depth marketing and functional requirements documents for scoping, prioritization and implementation with internal web design and it teams or external agencies.• manage large scale web projects including drafting project initiation documents, gaining internal customer approvals, and ensuring on-time, on-budget project delivery, including dot.com redesigns and pim/dam roll outs as necessary• work cross-functionally to develop a consistent online customer experience and identify opportunities to increase conversion and cultivate improved relationships with our audiences.• work closely with a cross-functional team to plan, develop and deliver dynamic, world-class content.• collaborate with internal digital marketing team members and external agencies to develop and manage digital marketing campaigns including email, cpc/cpa programs, paid search, seo, display, mobile and social.• track performance of digital marketing campaigns and kpis. evaluate market research, test results, and competitive intelligence to adjust digital marketing strategies to meet changing market and competitive conditions. relay actionable insights to business. • analyze and measure business impact for brand awareness, conversion and loyalty using web analytics and research.• actively partner with cross-functional teams including brand marketing, product marketing, channel marketing, it support, corporate communications, and customer service to expand education and penetration of digital activity.• report out digital brand marketing successes and growth opportunities to key stake holders and business leaders based on metrics from cross-functional team.• proactively develop external partnerships and support contract negotiations with external partners and/or vendors to maximize efficiency and effectiveness of the digital marketing investments. selection standards required:• ba or bs required.•3+ years’ experience in digital marketing. previous account management within a digital agency is a plus.• proficient communication skill, this role is a valued educator in our business. it’s important to be able to inform business leaders about the digital marketing experience and how we measure value in this form of marketing.• strong project management/organizational skills required. formal pmi training is a plus.• demonstrated proficiency in managing more complex web development and marketing projects, including working closely with it on integrations.• strong familiarity with executing best practices in all digital functions including: web development, acquisition marketing (email, banner ads, online video, paid search and seo, etc), and web analytics.• working knowledge of sitecore content management system a plus• familiarity with mobile marketing and commercialization -- mobile app development, connected tools and responsive sites and landing pages.• exceptional communication skills—verbal, written, and interpersonal.  excellent interpersonal interactions with staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams, and third parties.• independent, creative self-starter with ability to multi-task in a highly energetic, fast-paced environment.• experience with web analytics and reporting tools (google analytics).• hands on understanding of web front-end languages (html 5, css), standards, and best practices.• agency experience a plus• engaging presentation skills"stanley black & decker canada corporation is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to equity in employment."     submit to job   send to friend title: Open Data Program Specialist
text:
open data program specialist 21313 | york region menu job opportunitiescareer alertmy profilehelp close menu skip to main content job opportunitiescareer alertmy profilehelp open data program specialist 21313

to display this page you need a browser with javascript support.

department: corporate services department branch: data, analytics and visualization services branch status: full-time location: newmarket / ontario date posted: october 03, 2017 date closing: october 16, 2017 number of positions: 1 progressive. collaborative. accountable. draw on your passion. shape our community. progressive and collaborative, with a clear, long-term vision. we value employees’ contributions and inspire excellence. we are driven by a desire to help shape and serve the growing community in which we live and work. position purpose reporting to the manager, partnerships and special projects, this position is responsible for supporting and leading the vision of the open data program; working with internal departments to gain access to potential datasets, catalogue metadata in the york online data access (yoda) catalogue and publish data through the open data portal for use by the broader community; engaging with the community and other municipalities across canada working on open data and visual analytics and deploying a leading edge program; reviewing, evaluating and publishing datasets to meet the corporate strategic plan key performance indicators; working with external partners to understand evolving technologies and trends in the open data movement and engage in the recommendation and procurement of new technologies to support york region’s open data vision; leading and acting as subject matter expert in the open data field to expand the footprint of users within the region by selling the ‘open’ vision to senior policy staff. qualifications • successful completion of a bachelor degree in information management, marketing/sales, or a related discipline, or approved equivalent combination of education and experience.• minimum three (3) years’ experience in information management, including experience in leading projects, concepts, practices, tools, techniques and methods to lead projects and teams.• strong project management skills are essential, particularly experience in the delivery and management of similar projects. • ability to assess existing systems and processes and provide advice and support on the most effective way to adopt new practices that meet goals and aid in transparency.• experience in managing and working with data and databases. • understanding of good metadata; understanding of spatial technologies and etl.• knowledge and demonstrated ability in corporate core competencies including communication, innovation, teamwork and collaboration, and personal ownership.• an effective social networker, with ability to develop and facilitate communities and communicate effectively using social media tools. • a self-starter who can work independently with minimal support but can also work in a team environment. • can recognize, create and seize opportunities to put ideas into practice. • good people management skills with the ability to develop others and to impart knowledge and experience in an accessible and clear manner. • excellent communication skills including the ability to explain data solutions and applications to business audiences.• understanding of municipal, regional and provincial operations.• computer literacy utilizing ms office software applications. • demonstrated ability to communicate insight gained through use of stories with compelling visual elements.• ability to travel to off-site locations in a timely and efficient manner, as required. • ability to work under pressure yet delivers on time with attention to detail and accuracy.• ability to work outside regular business hours, as required. scheduled hours 35 scheduled shifts 0830 - 1630 how to apply please apply on-line by october 16, 2017, quoting competition #21313. we thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. salary $45.51 - $49.45 per hour. this is a union position.                   copyright © 2017. the regional municipality of york, ontario, canada.

about the position
we are on the hunt for a junior media buyer with one year of experience and proven skills running digital marketing campaigns in platforms including google adwords, bing/yahoo, facebook, as well as programmatic suppliers such as adroll and doubleclick. we are also looking for people who have experience tracking these campaigns in google analytics, or other analytics tools. over the past 17 years, we've realized the importance of creating a fun, challenging, and focused work environment, and have worked with some impressive clients locally and internationally.  we're growing fast, so this is a great time to join us if you're looking to grow your career.
what it's like to work with us
6s marketing is a roi-driven digital marketing agency specializing in paid media optimization, media buying, shopping campaigns, paid social, and more. over the past 17 years, we've realized that happy employees = exceptional work and customer satisfaction. that’s why we’ve created an environment that is welcoming and inspiring for all 6sers. our culture club organizes everything from scavenger hunts to friday socials, and we support our communities through fun charity events. 6s is all about four-legged culture, too — cozy up to one of our office dogs. 6s values your aspirations, and we’ll regularly help you set goals to achieve those milestones. 6sers attend google summits, youtube guru workshops, and host lunch n’ learns to ensure that our skills are always sharpened. and we’re great at helping you celebrate your accomplishments with some bubbly :)
more about what we're looking for


one year of previous working experience in a digital marketing capacity


skilled with creating/maintaining spreadsheets and data in excel and google sheets is a must


previous experience with reaching out to suppliers and negotiating rates


experience working with ad servers such as eyereturn




knowledge and experience in digital media planning and buying


knowledge of programmatic media in general as well as direct buys and ad serving. experience with adroll, doubleclick, quantcast considered an asset.


in-depth knowledge of the google adwords platform


experience working with google analytics


experience running facebook ppc campaigns


knowledge of search engine optimization


degree or diploma or equivalent work experience


what you'll get to do


communicate regularly with clients ensuring their goals are being met and that they are happy with 6s services


meet with 6s agency partners and work with these partners to plan and execute client campaigns


assist 6s sales staff with initial meetings with potential clients


create, plan and execute on digital media buys including programmatic display, video, direct buys, and social platforms


set up and manage google adwords campaigns


create weekly, bi-weekly, and or monthly reports for clients that offer insights into initiatives and progress undertaken by 6s marketing


develop strategies for clients that will help them reach their goals within the budgetary constraints


monitor client marketing initiatives on a weekly basis to ensure that the activities undertaken match the budget of the project and will help the client achieve their goals


review project initiatives and measure progress against goals


proactively make strategic campaign recommendations to clients


manage client budgets to ensure proper allocation in accordance with campaign contract terms and project goals


quality assurance on various digital platforms


thanks for taking the time to check out this opportunity! unfortunately, due to the number of applications we receive we are not able to contact everyone who applies. however, all applications are all stored in our talent database and will be considered for future opportunities.

date posted: 
sep 21, 2017
                                

 reference code: 28626-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: kitchener; montreal; ottawa; toronto; vancouver 
external posting descriptionwe are looking for a technical lead for digital marketing, in our oracle marketing cloud team.
the senior consultant at deloitte works within an engagement team and is responsible for driving to a plan and with a team. the role requires liaising with the senior leadership (client and deloitte), and implementing core martech technologies for clients. in this role you will be responsible for working on consultative engagements to develops, implement, and optimize multiple digital channels campaigns and initiatives including web, mobile, email, social media, consumer relationship marketing, search engine optimization, search engine marketing and digital advertising. being the senior technical resource responsible you will be responsible for architecture and configuration of the marketing technology solution and will act as liaison between the business and technical requirements.
you’ll help organizations improve marketing and customer processes, optimize their data and approach to communications and analytics, and create personalized experiences… the cool stuff in digital marketing. ideal candidates will have experience with marketing cloud and complementary products, leveraging crm systems experience and integration best practices (salesforce, oracle cx, microsoft dynamics), experience with custom and 3rd party integrations, launching audience segmentation and lead scoring programs, and hold expertise in marketing orchestration, automation, data modeling and apis.

roles & responsibilities include: 

technical lead in implementation projects of oracle marketing cloud solutions
run and lead discovery workshops, create user stories, work with product back-log, and ensure clients get high-value implementations
liaise between technical and business domains, ensuring all parties are on the same page, on-board and that all potential pitfalls are covered
work closely with clients to design and execute automated customer journeys, campaigns and nurture programs
develop and execute social media campaigns (facebook, twitter, pinterest, etc.)
be at the fore-front of technology and stay up-to-date with the latest tech and news
work with clients to design and implement actionable measurement tools and kpis - conversion, retention, acquisition costs, etc.
perform demand generation/outsourced marketing tasks on behalf of clients including creation of email/landing pages/templates and web form templates
apply analytics to continually improve demand generation
position yourself as trusted advisor with our clients by showing great ethics, experience and the use of best practice

external posting qualificationsrequired:

strong expertise in marketing automation with several successful projects, performing actual implementations
experience defining marketing strategy and developing and implementing customer journeys and multi-step campaigns
experience designing and implementing lead score models and lead generation program
functional knowledge of digital demand generation, content marketing, social media marketing and email marketing
advanced knowledge of cloud connectors and third party application use and capabilities
reporting and analysis - experienced defining, measuring and reporting on customer engagement metrics and marketing return on investment (roi)
ability to travel to client sites 75-100% of the time.

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Jr. Data Analyst
text:
jr. data analyst - careers - g adventures

          call us, we're open 24/7

            resume booking
        



home
careers
open positions
jr. data analyst












jr. data analyst


department: marketing
location: toronto, canada 

apply for this position


we’re a tight-knit group of analytical minded, self declared ‘nerds’, who provide marketing intelligence for the world’s greatest small-group adventure travel company. we work fast. we work hard. we serve a global brand that stubbornly refuses to stop growing. we do it all in-house, and we have a blast making it all happen.
the g adventures marketing intelligence team is on the hunt for a passionate, intelligent, experienced, hard-working and authentic data analyst. if you fit the bill, give us a call. we can’t wait to meet you.
at g adventures, we’re obsessed with the customer, our traveller; it’s about engaging and connecting emotionally with each and every one of them, along each and every step of their journey - so they keep coming back for more. 
as data analyst, you will help to deliver proactive marketing and sales insights to support our business. you will be responsible for ensuring marketing data is set up effectively to allow insights to be uncovered for the marketing intelligence team. you’ll work though database queries, set up marketing campaigns for tracking, prepare direct mailing list files, and assist with report templates and analyses.the right candidate has a passion for analytics, is curious to learn, and is quick to pick up new skills. someone who has a strong grasp of different data types and sources and how they connect to each other. someone with opinions, and the ability to express them. someone who aspires to use their strategic and analytical skills to help change people’s lives through travel. sound like a lofty goal? we live and breathe our brand promise every day so, if this sounds like you, we want you on our team.
responsibilities

actively contribute to the dynamic in-house global marketing team in a collaborative and meaningful way that helps support, inspire and motivate fellow colleagues and managers alike
understand and become an expert in our industry, our business, our culture and our customer, and use that knowledge to create effective, impactful, strategic and shareworthy work
execute sql queries for ad hoc and ongoing deliverables
ensure marketing campaign data is set up effectively for reporting and analyses
ensure campaign tagging standards are effectively executed to ensure accurate reporting and analyses
manage the bulk loading of data to crm system to ensure customer data available for marketing teams
assist with the set up of integrations and automated processes for reoccurring marketing processes (stored procedures, etl, reporting etc.)
work closely with the data analyst and analytics manager to assist with set up and on-going maintenance of: kpi tracking, marketing attribution model, and standardized marketing reporting
support the global and regional marketing teams and other departments for anything marketing analytics related, on a day-to-day basis 
lead with service - we’re an in-house agency! - and contribute to an engaged and dynamic corporate culture

requirements

bachelor's degree in marketing, math, statistics, economics or a related field
some professional experience as an analyst, preferably in roles supporting marketing
must have an understanding of relational databases 
an interest or experience in data science an asset
must be detail oriented, with strong documentation an asset
must have strong analytical and diagnostic skills
demonstrates the potential to translate complex data into precise and simple insights for business partners
demonstrates the potential to critique and discuss his/her own work and the work of others in a constructive manner
possesses excellent communication skills, combined with solid and growing presentation skills
is collaborative and demonstrates a proficiency at building positive working relationships with multi-disciplinary stakeholders across the business 
possesses strong computer/technology skills and is highly proficient in microsoft office, excel, with capabilities in powerpoint and keynote
must have beginner to intermediate sql knowledge
experience with salesforce an asset
experience with business intelligence tools an asset
experience with digital analytics, social listening tools an asset

we thank all interested candidates however only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.
***qualified applicants must hold appropriate citizenship or documents permitting them to reside and work in canada***
g adventures is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. we consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

date: 
sep 19, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca, m4y 2y5


at rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, rogers is the place where ideas become reality. we embrace change, and find ways to do better. and we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.
 
the email coordinator will work cross-functionally to execute all marketing email campaigns and help drive the acquisition of email subscribers. the primary responsibility of this position is managing the scheduling, coding, and deployment of email campaigns, reporting on email performance and supporting the automation and optimization of customer lifecycle programs.
 
this position will report directly into the brand manager, tsc and will be located in mississauga, 59 ambassador dr.
 
what you’ll be doing
 

work cross-functionally with the brand management, creative, web and it teams to deploy daily marketing emails and digital campaigns
manage the email subscriber base and email preference centre ensuring casl compliance
schedule, code and test email campaigns ensuring all emails conform to standards and are viewable across multiple email systems and mobile platforms
execute and manage automated, trigger based customer lifecycle campaigns
identify opportunities to grow and optimize the performance of our email subscriber base
analyze and report on email and program performance and provide recommendations based on results
follow and analyze trends in email marketing and identify opportunities

 
what you bring
 

college or university degree
3 - 5 years experience in marketing with a focus on digital marketing, campaign management and analytics
strong level of digital fluency with ability to establish and adapt plans based on a robust understanding of digital metrics.
well-developed knowledge and experience with salesforce and/or exact target
highly proficient in microsoft office, especially excel
proven communication skills and passion for learning about the online/digital marketing industry
strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking
proven leadership ability, teamwork and collaboration; experience working with a diverse set of people
strong organizational, problem solving and project management skills
exceptional written communication skills
detail oriented and attention to follow-up
thrives in a fast past, matrix style organization and can adapt quickly and seamlessly to change

 
schedule: full time
shift: day
length of contract: not applicable (regular position)
work location: 1 mount pleasant (083), toronto, on 
travel requirements: up to 10%
posting category/function: marketing & marketing communication
requisition id: 107906
 
why rogers?
 
as a proud canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. we’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.
 
we recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. we work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:
 

simplify and innovate
take ownership of the what and the how
equip people to succeed
execute with discipline and pride
talk straight, build trust, and over deliver

 
why rogers?  because your tomorrow inspires our today.
 
what makes us different makes us stronger. rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. everyone who applies for a job will be considered.
 
we recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. at rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. we work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. you can also reach out to our team at rogersrecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

title: Actuarial Data Analyst
text:
career opportunities











actuarial data analyst


location:
markham - head office


employment type:
full-time regular


department:
crd&a: risk management


# of positions:
1



description
you, the successful candidate, will dig in and become an expert in our claims and policyholder information datasets. you will use primary and secondary data sources to construct and maintain databases. you will transform data into information, and information into insights that will ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions as part of our core deliverables. you will work with cross-functional team members in identifying and prioritizing actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. this will allow you to gain exposure to all aspects of insurance operations with respect to claims, underwriting and pricing, as well as general areas of business operations such as human resource and marketing. this role will work hand in hand with predictive modellers in developing models and identifying strategies that improve the company’s bottom line.
qualifications:

bachelor’s degree in statistics, actuarial science, operations research, optimization, economics, computer science or a related quantitative discipline
a strong understanding of clustering, classification techniques and predictive modeling concepts
minimum 3-5 year of data manipulation and statistical analysis experience, preferably working with large datasets
technical expertise regarding different data models, database design, data mining and segmentation techniques
analytical, efficient problem solver and attention to detail with an ability to work independently and creatively
knowledge of microsoft office, experience of sql, sas, r, python, tableau or visual basic
excellent written and oral communication skills

allstate insurance canada group is looking for exceptional data analyst to synthesize our extensive policyholder and claims datasets into business enhancing information that will ultimately impact the company’s bottom line. this is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals who work on high-impact projects to bring efficiencies to all functional areas of our business. the team works in a fast-paced environment, using techniques and algorithms best suited for solving challenging problems of the insurance industry
in order to be considered for this position, candidates are invited to submit their applications by october 10, 2017
allstate canada group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. if you require accommodation please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
allstate insurance company of canada is one of the country’s leading producers and distributors of home and auto insurance products, serving canadians since 1953. allstate is committed to making a positive difference in the communities in which it operates and has partnered with organizations such as mothers against drunk driving, united way, and the canadian museum of nature. to learn more about allstate canada, visit www.allstate.ca .
 
we’re proud to have made aon hewitt’s 2017 list of the
best employers in canada!

title: Sr. Growth Data Analyst, Consumer Insights and Analytics
text: flipp - sr. growth data analyst, consumer insights and analyticssr. growth data analyst, consumer insights and analyticstorontodata and insightsfull-timeapply for this jobthe mission of the sr. consumer growth analyst is to drive our analytics capabilities forward, empowering yourself and the rest of the team to make more informed, data driven decisions; while driving action and results. flipp is looking for a sr analyst who is passionate about applied data analytics and excels at finding creative solutions to tough problems. the consumer sr. growth analyst will play a crucial role in helping the flipp growth and acquisition teams build flipp as the number one place consumers come to plan their shopping. the growth and acquisition team is looking to build the most effective marketing engine in the world, and to do so requires first rate analysts that can help drive the organization’s adoption of data and measurement techniques to drive this group forward.impactaid the growth and acquisition team in understanding what tactics are working, exploring new channels and effectively optimizing existing marketing tacticsdevelop strategies to test, measure and scale marketing channelsprototype new metrics and kpis to help our growth and acquisition team better understand consumer retention, engagement and qualitydevelop new, or significantly improve existing insight methods to solve new problemslead ad hoc investigations and data deep dives to drive decision clarity for business stakeholdersproactively identify efficiency improvements and affect change with useful resultsadd to flipp's knowledge base by uncovering or improving flipp's understanding of the consumer behaviour to inform different aspects of the businesseffectively communicate complex insights results and answers in a confident and easy to understand fashion to stakeholders; in both written and oral formatuse appropriate visualization techniques to present the analysis in a manner that is clear, precise, contextual, and easy to digestleverage tools like tableau and periscope to increase the data capabilities of other teams, and provide regular insights training, and self serve analysis toolsautomate any repetitive stakeholder requests that drive value to the end users what you bring to the team4-6 years experience in insights and analytics supporting marketing, growth and advertising teamsuniversity degree in math or statistics preferredstrong business acumenproficient in sql and extensive experience with data visualization; familiarity with r or python would be a plusknowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasetstechnical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniquesstrong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyhave excellent communication and writing skills, can facilitate meetings, gather requirements/business rules and show the ability to work with both the business stakeholders and development teamstrong problem solving skills - we like to hire people who can think through problems and develop solutions quicklystrong ability to prioritize and take on several critical projects at onceflipp corporation is an award winning technology company (2014, 2015, 2016, and 2017 best workplaces in canada award and also being awarded the 2015 deloitte's best managed companies) that is reinventing the weekly shopping experience. our digital flyer platform is used by the leading retailers across north america, including walmart and target. our mobile app, flipp, has already captured the hearts of canadians and americans alike, with millions of downloads and the honour of being named the #1 retail flyer app in canada. flipp’s culture is an integral part of what has driven the company’s success. we abide by key principles that promote the growth of others and create a high-trust environment. learn more about our team culture here: https://corp.flipp.com/cultureflipp welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.apply for this jobflipp home pagejobs powered by

title: Lenovo Data Center Group Business Development Specialist
text:
lenovo data center group business development specialist - careers at pcm canada	



























career opportunities with pcm canada









careers at pcm canada









share with friends or subscribe!





 





we know our employees are a crucial part of our success. that’s why pcm canada offers competitive wages and comprehensive benefits. we also encourage professional growth and personal satisfaction among our staff members, and offer opportunities for internal advancement. join a world class team of professionals, where people work hard and celebrate success. explore the exciting opportunities that are waiting for you at pcm canada!
current job opportunities are posted here. subscribe to our rss feeds to receive instant updates as new positions become available.










		    back to openings		    






lenovo data center group business development specialist

 department:
vendor management tigerdirect  office:
toronto
 location:
markham

start your application
pcm is expanding and looking to add an enthusiastic, professional, and goal-oriented lenovo data center group (dcg) specialist to our team. the lenovo dcg specialist will be responsible for identifying and targeting pcm clients and prospects to promote the value and benefits of lenovo hardware, software and services.  you will be responsible for growing pcm’s national territory within our existing account base as well as driving new accounts by leading with lenovo.  this position will be supported by sales, marketing and technical support resources.  in a high level consultative role, your objective will be to build a strong lenovo pipeline and an annual run rate focusing on the mid-market to enterprise corporate customers.
responsibilities: 

developing, maintaining, and leveraging strong relationships with distributors.
meeting and exceeding sales goals while being responsible for overall account strategy development.
developing knowledge of pcm’s practices, products, and services to facilitate successful sales efforts.
developing market and competitor knowledge.
assist pcm's internal sales teams with pre- and post-sales activities for lenovo products.
educate pcm's and lenovo account managers on the technologies and resources available to them from the other's organization.
increase pcm's sales team productivity, deal size, and awareness of all lenovo lines of business.
promote all of the available lenovo program resources and tools to the pcm   sales teams.
coordinate quarterly business reviews and monthly conference calls.
provide   weekly   reporting   on   pcm's   sales (in   excel spreadsheet format). 
train pcm's sales teams to sell lenovo products using a combination of programs, including, but not limited to, lunch and learns, new hire training, and new product training.
increase lenovo deal registration awareness by providing support and training to pcm's sales teams.
review pcm's pipeline information to optimize sales opportunities.
provide feedback and guidance to pcm's sales teams around execution of lenovo sales programs and incentives.
act as first point of escalation for pcm's customers and sales teams;
participate in conference calls with pcm's sales representative and their customers to answer questions, recommend solutions, and assist with closing sales or lenovo products and services.

 
physical requirements

some travel might be required, including driving
extended working hours may be required occasionally
handling maximum of 20 lbs 
office environment that includes lengthy periods of sitting at desk, lengthy periods of standing in front of the audience, computer work and phone work
hand use (frequent)
present to the audience and speak publicly
read and write

 
qualifications (education/experience/skills & abilities)

minimum 3 years’ experience in lenovo products sales, including data center
bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
self-starter, multi-task abilities and the ability to lead in a team environment
web reseller, b2b, distribution channel, it commodity buying experience
sales or marketing experience specifically with vendor solutions
understanding of web analytics and metrics
strong negotiation skills
have the ability to develop merchandising strategies
inventory management experience
advanced pc skills of microsoft office are required (excel, word, outlook, and powerpoint)
strong communication skills
strong analytical and organizational skills, ability to multi-task, work independently and on tight deadlines and perform well under pressure
must be able to work well in teams
management experience a plus
must be able to work extended hours as needed

pcm canada is proud to offer reasonable accommodation to job applicants with disabilities. if you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please make your need for accommodation known in advance during the application process.

job number:j00046506toronto , ontario  cadata scientist equifax is a global information solutions company that uses trusted unique data, innovative analytics, technology and industry expertise to power organizations and individuals around the world by transforming knowledge into insights that help make more informed business and personal decisions. the company organizes, assimilates and analyzes data on more than 820 million consumers and more than 91 million businesses worldwide, and its database includes employee data contributed from more than 7,100 employers. headquartered in atlanta, ga., equifax operates or has investments in 24 countries in north america, central and south america, europe and the asia pacific region. it is a member of standard & poor's (s&p) 500 index, and its common stock is traded on the new york stock exchange (nyse) under the symbol efx. equifax employs approximately 9,900 employees worldwide.  some noteworthy achievements for the company include: named to the top 100 american banker fintech forward list (2015-2016); named a top technology provider on the fintech 100 list (2004-2016); named an informationweek elite 100 winner (2014-2015); named a top workplace by atlanta journal constitution (2013-2017); named one of fortune's world's most admired companies (2011-2015); named one of forbes' world's 100 most innovative companies (2015-2017). for more information, visit www.equifax.com . position summary:as a data scientist, you will be leveraging our big data environment to create and apply advanced machine learning and statistical techniques. the data scientist is essential to ensuring our continued commitment to provide quality insight to our clients and stakeholders. the data scientist position is responsible for paving the way of the future when it comes to analytics and data management.as part of the data and analytics team you will be a key player in the development of new models and solutions on a wide assortment of domain, not limited to credit risk, fraud and marketing. the data and analytics are accountable for using multiple data sources towards building actionable insight for equifax's customers.additional responsibilities of the data scientist include:- develop and continuously enhance data expertise for current and new equifax data, and provide documentation and internal and external consulting regarding optimal data utilization.- work closely with internal and external clients to understand the objectives of their projects and serve as an analytics subject matter expert leading the design of best data and analytics approaches, highlighting solutions, alternative approaches, as well as potential limitations.- assess analysis results and provide direction for proper interpretation and usage of the analytics solutions.      - develop custom analytics solutions, including statistical models, decision trees, segmentation solutions, attributes and analytical reports for various industries and business objectives.- provide detailed technical documentation of standard reporting/extraction criteria used for the analysis, as well as the actual solution.- utilize, develop and automate the most appropriate processes to increase turnaround time for analytics projects and to increase efficiencies in the statistical model-building process. - individually, and as part of the team, provide thought leadership in analytics and model building by staying on top of new developments in the field.- propose and implement improvements to actual models using machine learning techniques (neural networks of various kinds, gradient boosting, random forest, ensemble models, etc.)- manage innovation projects and meet deadlines, work with other team members.- act as a spokesperson for equifax's analytical expert team at conferences and client presentationsrequired skills of the data scientist:- proven experience designing and building analytical solutions to solve real world problems, with strong preference of this experience in financial risk area.- minimum of 5 years of data manipulation experience.- minimum of 5 years of experience, specifically in statistical/data analysis and data mining, experimental design, cluster analysis, building decision trees, and predictive modeling- proficiency in sql and at least one of the following languages: python, r- experience with hadoop technologies- proven experience delivering data analysis, machine learning and statistical modelspreferred skills of the data scientist:- proficiency in oracle sql- knowledge of database design and data modeling- experience managing innovation/r&d projects- working knowledge of at least one business intelligence tool (e.g. business objects, cognos, spotfire)- working knowledge of java and / or scala- working knowledge of sas (base sas, sas macros, sas stat, em, eg) or ability to learn quickly.- knowledge of the financial services industry and credit informationeducation:- advanced degree (ph.d. preferred) in statistics, math, operations research, computer science, actuarial science, econometrics or other related quantitative discipline.- statistics, mathematics, computer science or engineering including experience with machine learning through education or practice.                                                       primary location:can-toronto-5700 yongefunction:function - data and analyticsschedule:full timeequifax is an equal employment opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - data scientist – customer insights (pla03239-17)job description data scientist – customer insights - pla03239-17description position overview:   the performance analysis consultant is an expert/advisory level position. as performance analysis consultant – customer 360 insights within the journey design & delivery team, this candidate will be reporting to manager, c360 insights. the candidate will be responsible for providing actionable customer insights to resolve strategic and tactical marketing issues by building advanced statistical models using sas, sql and other data mining tools. the role would be expected to provide thought-leadership in researching new modeling techniques/solutions to solve complex marketing issues. along with the manager, c360 insights, the candidate will co-lead the integration of customer insights into telus’ omni channel marketing strategy to enable better decisions that drive revenue/ebitda growth, manage churn and reduce customer effort across various lines of business.   responsibilities:  strategies and planning:  assist the manager, c360 insights to cultivate a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture inside and outside the marketing department and implement the best-in-class end-to-end modeling process to gain operational efficiency assist the manager, c360 insight to identify business issues through analytics; provide actionable insights and influence business partners to take action based on analytical/modeling insights   thought leadership and teamwork:  contribute to the ongoing development of the team by sharing information, success, lessons learned of own project work collaboratively with marketing primes to develop modelling requirements and prioritization; present model results and actionable recommendations to internal business clients and senior leadership mentors junior team members from a technical as well as business acumen perspective assist the manager, c360 insights to drive for the cultivation of a hybrid culture (analytics and business) to share insights/learnings to demonstrate value of big data analytics and investments to business partner teams (data - insights - strategy - results)   day-to-day portfolio/deliverable management:  contribute to the development of the omni channel strategy by developing near real-time predictive models and trigger based strategies leveraging sas/sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, python, r, etc work collaboratively with business partners teams to understand, compartmentalize complex and ambiguous business issues into crisp and manageable pieces develop analytical blueprint to solve compartmentalized business issues and assembly to the big picture solution present customer insights to cross functional business partners including marketing, channel, products & services, customer experience and digital own the end-to-end development of campaign targeting through analytics and building propensity models/response models using various multivariate modelling/data mining techniques   expert knowledge:  be recognized as the top expert in predictive modeling, data mining, r&d within telus educate, advocate and advise cross-functional business partners at team member level in advanced analytics and predictive modeling maintain a solid and updated knowledge in the predictive modeling, data mining field including applications of big data, text analytics, social network analytics, cross channel modelling   qualifications required knowledge:  business orientation:  advanced business acumen, relationship management and influencing without authority skills; ability to provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis strong ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholders and meet deadlines with quality deliverables advanced written, oral, communications, presentation skills and knowledge of microsoft office suite   technical expertise:  advanced knowledge in various advanced predictive modeling/data mining techniques to ensure effective solutions to marketing issues extensive hands-on experience in sas (or sas enterprise guide), sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, r, python, sql and other data query language on unix/pc and comfortable working with very large data sets and databases strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills    required skills & abilities:  change management: self-driven individual with ability to adapt to varying business environments and effectively drive business results by leveraging analytics mentorship: strong leadership, coaching, mentoring skills  required professional designation/certification:  phd in statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative field is preferred master’s degree with extensive relevant experience and knowledge will be strongly considered  required experience:  10+ years of related predictive modeling experience, preferably in marketing telecom/industry experience would be beneficial credit risk modeling experience will be considered  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

movati athletic is driven by a vision to empower people’s lives through fitness and health, making the communities we serve healthier and happier.   we’re not your typical gym.  from the moment you step inside one of our clubs, you’ll experience the difference.  this is why our mission is to passionately deliver an experience that makes our members feel welcome, feel comfortable and feel healthy. established in 1997, movati athletic is a pioneer in the fitness industry offering an experience that goes beyond just working out.  we continuously work hard to ensure our services, amenities and employees provide the ultimate well-being experience at an affordable price.  what began as one club has now grown to 13, with more on the way. employing 1,500 full and part time employees (and growing), our caring and exceptional people help ensure our members improve their quality of life.  we continue to hire exceptional, caring individuals, adding to our family of movati athletic employees. we’re always on the lookout for the best and brightest to join our expanding company.  currently, we are searching for a digital marketing strategist, at our toronto office.  reporting to the director of marketing, in this newly created role the incumbent oversees the digital marketing communications, acquisition and retention strategies to generate movati brand awareness, drive sales and leads, and cultivate member loyalty. what can you expect in this role? key responsibilities: responsible for strategy and execution of sem, crm, mobile applications, social media and display advertising campaigns, working in conjunction with direct reports, internal and agency partners build and manage new crm infrastructure including email communication, push notifications and making recommendation around other forms of communication. work in partnership with business leaders, particularly sales, to develop the strategy & readiness campaigns for seamless execution. oversee content strategy on digital display management track, measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns and assess against goals such as site engagement metrics, sources of traffic, campaign performance measurement (i.e. lead generation – cpm, cpc, ctr, cpa), landing page conversion rates, social engagement rates and organic searches. analyze campaigns, recommend solutions and translate into plans as well as actions for ongoing campaign improvement. plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests (a/b testing). utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points. design, build, plan and maintain a high quality and relevant social media calendar/content across key platforms including facebook, instagram, twitter, and linkedin with agreed objectives and kpis. concept and content development across digital platforms – e.g. new formats (gif’s / meme’s), video content, articles, blog content. ensure high brand awareness and brand compliance for all online assets created/developed.   interpersonal suitability thought leadership: identify trends and insights, to optimize spend and performance based on the insights. brainstorm new and creative growth strategies in line with business objectives. evaluate emerging technologies and capability to market. provide thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate.   team development & collaboration: lead direct report(s) in planning and execution collaborate, support and work closely with marketing team-mates, human resources, operational and sales management teams (sales, group fitness,) to ensure meeting of business objectives and kpis. collaborate with creative, digital and media agencies and work with external vendors and effectively manage roi to ensure cost effectiveness for the business.   movati culture integration: proven leadership to ensure alignment with operational and strategic objectives. work calmly and systematically under stressful situations. liaise effectively with all levels of staff, partners and vendors.  self-directed individual, able to work autonomously. self-motivated, detail-oriented and organized. excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, organizational, and presentation skills. tactful and helpful with other staff. able to interact with other organizations’ technical staff effectively. well organized and reliable. able to handle multiple tasks, and work independently with minimum supervision. trustworthy with privilege accounts & information.    key qualifications: minimum 5-7 years’ experience as a digital marketing manager or strategist degree and or diploma in a related inter-disciplinary program experience managing direct reports (minimum 1-2 team members) experience in managing agencies and suppliers breadth of ‘hands on’ digital skills – able to coordinate digital activity as well as execute demonstrate past ecrm strategies/success experience with salesforce cloud computing/crm an asset able to confidently use google analytics to assess and evaluate all digital activities experience managing ppc campaigns and understanding of on and off page search engine optimization strategies keen understanding of mobile applications and how to market them effectively. knowledge of email best practices including subject lines, messaging, segmentation, list management, deliverability and can-spam/anti-spam laws intermediate knowledge and application of social media content strategy experience in a multi-unit, chain-based business considered an asset a passion for fitness/wellness an asset   application process interested candidates are invited to apply. we regret that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. movati athletic is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. we are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. we can’t wait to meet you! job summary location:  toronto work environment:  office
