state / country / province  ontario   job description  position:                           digital marketing coordinatorreports to:                      digital marketing managerdivision:                            gtslocation:                          mississauga, ontariostanley black & decker (sbd) is one of the world's largest, fastest-growing, and most dynamic companies. we are unique in that we have a rich and storied history dating back to 1843, but that hasn't stopped us from evolving into a vibrant, diverse, global growth company. we have been globally recognized as one of the most innovative, sustainable, and rewarding companies in the world. stanley black and decker’s 2015 revenue was 11.2b and our global tools & storage division is responsible for $7.1b of sbd annual revenue.summary:the digital marketing coordinator is responsible for helping the digital marketing manager with the execution of the digital marketing and merchandising strategy for branded power tools businesses and working cross functionally to support power tools initiatives with the digital property owners on digital initiatives. in this role, you will apply your understanding of the online marketplace to create digital marketing solutions -- from strategy to development, launch, measurement and optimization -- that drives brand and product awareness, increase purchase intent through lead generation and drive loyalty. key responsibilities:• implement overall digital marketing strategies for the porter-cable, bostitch, stanley fatmax and mac and iar branded power tools businesses - serving as the day-to-day digital account manager.• partner closely with the digital marketing team leads, brand marketing and product teams to develop and execute leading digital strategies.•  operate as project management liaison between product and  shared digital marketing teams.• serve as digital marketing lead for porter-cable, bostitch, stanley fatmax, mac and iar branded power tools initiatives including day-to-day operation, management, and optimization across sbu and cross-functional support teams. • manage the social media channels for our brands in canada – this includes creating daily content, engaging with users online and putting together a full social media strategy.  • identify and develop new traffic-driving opportunities to increase reach, customer acquisition and sales.• establish and maintain a consistent brand image throughout all digital marketing initiatives across web, mobile and social owned properties.• gather internal customer requirements and use them to create in-depth marketing and functional requirements documents for scoping, prioritization and implementation with internal web design and it teams or external agencies.• manage large scale web projects including drafting project initiation documents, gaining internal customer approvals, and ensuring on-time, on-budget project delivery, including dot.com redesigns and pim/dam roll outs as necessary• work cross-functionally to develop a consistent online customer experience and identify opportunities to increase conversion and cultivate improved relationships with our audiences.• work closely with a cross-functional team to plan, develop and deliver dynamic, world-class content.• collaborate with internal digital marketing team members and external agencies to develop and manage digital marketing campaigns including email, cpc/cpa programs, paid search, seo, display, mobile and social.• track performance of digital marketing campaigns and kpis. evaluate market research, test results, and competitive intelligence to adjust digital marketing strategies to meet changing market and competitive conditions. relay actionable insights to business. • analyze and measure business impact for brand awareness, conversion and loyalty using web analytics and research.• actively partner with cross-functional teams including brand marketing, product marketing, channel marketing, it support, corporate communications, and customer service to expand education and penetration of digital activity.• report out digital brand marketing successes and growth opportunities to key stake holders and business leaders based on metrics from cross-functional team.• proactively develop external partnerships and support contract negotiations with external partners and/or vendors to maximize efficiency and effectiveness of the digital marketing investments. selection standards required:• ba or bs required.•3+ years’ experience in digital marketing. previous account management within a digital agency is a plus.• proficient communication skill, this role is a valued educator in our business. it’s important to be able to inform business leaders about the digital marketing experience and how we measure value in this form of marketing.• strong project management/organizational skills required. formal pmi training is a plus.• demonstrated proficiency in managing more complex web development and marketing projects, including working closely with it on integrations.• strong familiarity with executing best practices in all digital functions including: web development, acquisition marketing (email, banner ads, online video, paid search and seo, etc), and web analytics.• working knowledge of sitecore content management system a plus• familiarity with mobile marketing and commercialization -- mobile app development, connected tools and responsive sites and landing pages.• exceptional communication skills—verbal, written, and interpersonal.  excellent interpersonal interactions with staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams, and third parties.• independent, creative self-starter with ability to multi-task in a highly energetic, fast-paced environment.• experience with web analytics and reporting tools (google analytics).• hands on understanding of web front-end languages (html 5, css), standards, and best practices.• agency experience a plus• engaging presentation skills"stanley black & decker canada corporation is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to equity in employment."     submit to job   send to friend title: Open Data Program Specialist
text:
open data program specialist 21313 | york region menu job opportunitiescareer alertmy profilehelp close menu skip to main content job opportunitiescareer alertmy profilehelp open data program specialist 21313

to display this page you need a browser with javascript support.

department: corporate services department branch: data, analytics and visualization services branch status: full-time location: newmarket / ontario date posted: october 03, 2017 date closing: october 16, 2017 number of positions: 1 progressive. collaborative. accountable. draw on your passion. shape our community. progressive and collaborative, with a clear, long-term vision. we value employees’ contributions and inspire excellence. we are driven by a desire to help shape and serve the growing community in which we live and work. position purpose reporting to the manager, partnerships and special projects, this position is responsible for supporting and leading the vision of the open data program; working with internal departments to gain access to potential datasets, catalogue metadata in the york online data access (yoda) catalogue and publish data through the open data portal for use by the broader community; engaging with the community and other municipalities across canada working on open data and visual analytics and deploying a leading edge program; reviewing, evaluating and publishing datasets to meet the corporate strategic plan key performance indicators; working with external partners to understand evolving technologies and trends in the open data movement and engage in the recommendation and procurement of new technologies to support york region’s open data vision; leading and acting as subject matter expert in the open data field to expand the footprint of users within the region by selling the ‘open’ vision to senior policy staff. qualifications • successful completion of a bachelor degree in information management, marketing/sales, or a related discipline, or approved equivalent combination of education and experience.• minimum three (3) years’ experience in information management, including experience in leading projects, concepts, practices, tools, techniques and methods to lead projects and teams.• strong project management skills are essential, particularly experience in the delivery and management of similar projects. • ability to assess existing systems and processes and provide advice and support on the most effective way to adopt new practices that meet goals and aid in transparency.• experience in managing and working with data and databases. • understanding of good metadata; understanding of spatial technologies and etl.• knowledge and demonstrated ability in corporate core competencies including communication, innovation, teamwork and collaboration, and personal ownership.• an effective social networker, with ability to develop and facilitate communities and communicate effectively using social media tools. • a self-starter who can work independently with minimal support but can also work in a team environment. • can recognize, create and seize opportunities to put ideas into practice. • good people management skills with the ability to develop others and to impart knowledge and experience in an accessible and clear manner. • excellent communication skills including the ability to explain data solutions and applications to business audiences.• understanding of municipal, regional and provincial operations.• computer literacy utilizing ms office software applications. • demonstrated ability to communicate insight gained through use of stories with compelling visual elements.• ability to travel to off-site locations in a timely and efficient manner, as required. • ability to work under pressure yet delivers on time with attention to detail and accuracy.• ability to work outside regular business hours, as required. scheduled hours 35 scheduled shifts 0830 - 1630 how to apply please apply on-line by october 16, 2017, quoting competition #21313. we thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. salary $45.51 - $49.45 per hour. this is a union position.                   copyright © 2017. the regional municipality of york, ontario, canada.

city/ville
ottawa/toronto


province
ontario [on]


title
director, client experience


range minimum
$98,290


summary
 as a member of the senior management team, the director will develop and lead innovative corporate-wide approaches to client management, ensuring that cihi is putting their experiences and needs at the core of its operations and approach, while aligned with cihis strategic plan. the director will develop, implement, and direct the overall strategy around stakeholder mapping, cihi’s education offerings (including its capacity-building strategy) and approach to client services. the director will also bring a client-centred perspective and contribute to the development of cihi’s digital strategy.


duties and responsibilities
  provide strategic and tactical advice/direction to the vp, strategic communications and stakeholder relations, senior management, and corporate committees, as required, on cihi’s overall approach to stakeholder management, stakeholder engagement strategies, and drive the evolution of cihi’s education, client services and stakeholder support functions. work with cihi’s vps of eastern and western canada, cihi’s client affairs managers, and directors/managers from across the organization, lead and oversee the development and evolution of cihi’s corporate stakeholder strategy, including the creation of detailed stakeholder maps, and specific ongoing stakeholder relations plans for cihi’s president and ceo and the executive committee. deliver leadership and strategic direction to cihi’s client central services department, by driving recommendations and enhancements to towards cihi’s overall client services approach and management/support tools (e.g. crm, access management system, etc.) with the goal of ensuring that cihi’s clients receive the best possible service and support. provide leadership and strategic direction to the education and conferences department to increase the impact of cihi’s education, sponsorships and conference participation. this will include overseeing an enhanced approach to cihi’s capacity building work by ensuring it is empowering stakeholders to increase their use of cihi data to guide decision-making. create and maintain a positive working environment by fostering collaboration, staff development, engagement and retention of staff. mentor staff, provide and solicit effective feedback, conduct performance management reviews, and ensure that there are appropriate opportunities for staff development. contribute to the development of cihi’s digital portfolio in collaboration with digital leads to ensure that the work reflects stakeholder needs. monitor central client services, education and web analytics and provide recommendations and propose improvements to the stakeholder experience. keep abreast of new technologies, industry trends, and their impact on the stakeholder management, client services and the delivery of education programs. identify opportunities to implement these enhancements and lead the development of any associated business planning.


knowledge & experience
  master’s degree in communications, marketing, public/health/business administration or a related field. an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered. 6-8 years progressive leadership experience with demonstrated success in managing the design, development and implementation of client engagement strategies. this includes facilitating and partnering with a variety of stakeholders to develop content and products. strong understanding of client support tools and stakeholder relations approaches.excellent knowledge and demonstrated experience of health sector issues/challenges. proven ability to use sound business judgment to assess business needs, weed out actions and activities that will have a material impact on the business from those that will not to define scope of multiple, simultaneous, cross-functional projects and distill many complicated inputs into simple solutions. deep awareness and interest in health policy and current affairs.excellent project management, change management and facilitation skills, including project portfolio management, with the ability to assess business needs, to define scope of multiple, simultaneous, cross-functional projects. strong leadership skills, but with a willingness to dive into day-to-day operations and processes. strong attention to detail essential. experience in building and leading innovative and high-performance teams.excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.candidate must be willing to travel. knowledge of french an asset.  to find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our “careers” section. we thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. at cihi we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. if you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

society is a full-service social media agency, comprised of talent from the worlds of digital, strategy, media, creative and analytics whose driving purpose is to find "brand purpose" in an increasingly fast-paced, always-on, mobile-obsessed digital landscape. our subject matter experts collaborate with fortune 100 clients to execute award-winning social campaigns across digital channels that deliver both meaningful, emotionally-charged consumer experiences and real business outcomes.    the role will be primarily focused on strategy development  leading social, influencer marketing, and community management strategy for brands with the support of strategy leadership development of audience first strategies and archetypes that capture key insights between consumer and brand a focus on social media plans, branded social performance and kpis in context with overall business goals develop integrated, cross-platform, strategic plans, and drive ideas/insights across new channels accelerate the success and mastery of the media and social media landscape through collaboration with the client, colleagues, and agency partners    agency culture and education  share insights from cultural activities, trends, and educational opportunities that inspire and inform new thinking/opportunities lead and participate in knowledge sharing sessions to strengthen agency’s overall capabilities and success within influencer and social media    key tasks:  archetype/target development / target insights / social listening social ecosystem analysis and brand channel planning collaboration with creative team to build breakthrough campaign work that accelerates media and social media performance develop creative and communications briefs (influencers) client-facing thought leadership insight development and future planning of tactics rooted in data and insight write and publish povs on topics of importance to your clients business    qualifications:  2-4 years of digital and social strategy experience experience mentoring and managing entry level colleagues experience leveraging social listening tools to drive insights and deep understanding of native social platform tools curious minded excellent presentation skills deadline and results driven strong written communication skills detailed oriented and able to multi-task effectively proactive thinker and doer, with the ability to learn and adapt to new technologies and trends independently manage client initiatives and campaigns integrates with horizontal teams (planning, account, creative, performance, media, tech) ability to make strategic recommendations, build presentation decks, assist in new business presentations passionate about nurturing a collaborative and enthusiastic agency culture    ipg mediabrands is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome and encourage applications from all interested parties. accommodations are available, upon request, for those with a disability or medical need during any stage of the recruitment process. we thank all candidates for their interest in ipg mediabrands, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

growth, insights & analytics associate
job number: 7368
location(s): mississauga, on 
apply


food. purpose. you. 
 
we serve the world by making food people love. as one of the world’s leading food companies, general mills believes that food should make us better. food brings us joy and nourishes our lives, connecting us to each other and the earth. general mills operates in more than 100 countries and markets more than 100 consumer brands, including cheerios, häagen-dazs, nature valley, betty crocker, pillsbury, annie’s, lara bar, yoplait and more. headquartered in minneapolis, general mills had global net sales of us$17.6 billion during fiscal 2015.
 
we seek out the best talent, and then give them development resources, support and the chance to lead something big. choosing a career with general mills means joining a company where you can make a difference in the lives of millions of people. there is tremendous opportunity here for individuals who want to advance food through innovation and serve the world.
 
general mills’ culture is second to none, offering a wide variety of perks and benefits to it’s employees. when you start your day, you will be greeted by our open concept building, which boasts an impressive number of bookable and non-bookable meeting rooms and open concept workspaces, providing employees with the flexibility they need to get the job done.   with its colorful furnishings, including walls made of reclaimed barn wood, the office atmosphere proves to be modern, fun, and unique.   if you’re hungry, why not stop by our on-site cafeteria for a snack or lunch?  we offer subsidized meals ranging from $5.00-$6.00, and even provide take-home dinners at your request!   want to eat your lunch outside? relax in an adirondack chair on our patio, or go for a stroll alongside the ravine, right in our own backyard!  spilt a little lunch on your shirt? no problem! drop your dry cleaning off, right in the office.   before you leave, don’t forget to stop by our company store to grab your weekly groceries, we carry a wide variety of products (including limited edition ones) at prices that are sure to amaze.  when walking to your car, you can admire how sparkly clean it is thanks to our auto-detailing servicer (who cleaned your car while you worked)!  smile as you look at your watch see “12:00pm” flashing back at you, as it’s a sunny friday afternoon, and you, my friend, are calling it a day.  what will you do with your half-day fridays during the summer?  grab a few discounted movie or attraction passes courtesy of general mills, kick back, and relax. ahhh, all in a day’s work.   
 
are you a big picture thinker with a passion for data driven consumer insights?  if so, the canadian consumer insights team wants to talk to you.  gia (growth insights and analytics) identifies opportunities and risks by connecting consumer behavioral insights and marketplace realities.  this specific role is responsible for supporting the canadian marketing organization, by leveraging syndicated consumer purchase behavior information to provide analytics and insights that drive growth.  additionally, this role owns monthly syndicated data reporting and recommends enhancements and changes to improve usability and ease of interpretation throughout the canadian organization.
 
 
responsibilities
• owns ‘reporting centre of excellence’ and reporting integrity including report structure and maintenance• diagnose and communicate performance narratives for gmcc categories to enable common understanding and drive action• proactively provide strategic guidance on risk and growth opportunities for our categories during critical apertures: monthly lt reviews, lrp, ye plans, innovation reviews, growth stories• inform key trends in the food occasion & gmi’s opportunities in this space• consult and educate marketing stakeholders on all metrics and data sources, including appropriate use case, application, and interpretation• you will gain deep knowledge and application of a variety of consumer purchase behavior and social listening data sources, including custom nielsen market track and panel, marketing mix models, crimson hexagon, and vision critical• you will develop your ability to uncover and synthesize actionable insights to tell a story and take a stand – critical thinking & storytelling• you will ace your collaboration and relationship building skills• you will further polish your already strong communication and presentation skills• knowledge of and experience with syndicated nielsen markettrack and panel information and analyses• natural curiosity, interest in learning, and comfort with quantitative problem solving• agility & comfort with ambiguity• ability to work independently and to take initiative• ability to lead, communicate and build relationships with global stakeholders where daily face to face communication may not be possible
• data analysis/syndicated knowledge and analysis experience working with nielsen data is required. given the leadership and organizational facing nature of this role, project management and clear communication and presentation skills are required.   preferred educational background includes a minimum of a bachelor’s degree; master’s degree in business, economics, marketing, marketing research, computer science/engineering, finance or statistics preferred.
 
 
general mills is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. accommodations are available upon request for candidates with disabilities taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process

data analyst

company:
        inliv
      

location:
      calgary, ab
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
as the data analyst at inliv inc., you will work closely with the chief data officer to build our business intelligence platform.  you will be responsible for managing all aspects of inliv's data including inputting, integrity, integration, manipulation, analytics and reporting.
you will perform impact assessments related to technology choices, design / architectural considerations and implementation strategy and provide recommendations
the data analytics team will support the leadership team to create innovative data and analytics driven solutions.
your day-to-day will include:

acquire, transform and analyze data from multiple sources ensuring data quality
responsible for defining, developing, and evolving data science related tasks using the latest development methods and infrastructure
participate in normal analytics development activities like design, implementation, reviews, defect management, document handling, etc.
support impact assessments and decisions related to technology choices, design /architectural considerations and implementation strategy
collaborate with system engineers and software developers to implement solutions that are aligned with our stakeholder’s and our own strategic directions
lead the design and creation of appropriate reporting and dashboarding for use by individual departments as well as company leadership
partner with the marketing, sales and operations teams to deliver data insights, identify trends and opportunities, make suggestions for improvement and answer business questions
influence business decision making through data-based recommendations
prepare ad-hoc analysis in the support of specific initiatives as required

qualifications:

4-6 years of experience in data analytics and business reporting
bachelor degree in computer science, math, physics, applied economics or statistics
demonstrated ability to communicate in a way that is easy to understand by all stakeholders both verbally and written
proficiency with python, r, sql and tableau for data visualization
demonstrated etl skills/experience (extract, transform, load)
ability to grasp the essence of large data sets and can use and create analytical and/or statistical methods to find solutions
an eagerness to roll up your sleeves, dig deep and get the work done
experience building dashboards in common visualization tools
prior experience of working with cross functional teams
competent programming attitude with good computation and data mining skills
technical expertise, domain knowledge, experience in statistical/modeling techniques, focused on the big data space
ability and willingness to learn new technologies and methods
business oriented mindset

in order to apply, we ask you that you take the time to add a customized cover letter that clearly demonstrates what skills you have and where you have obtained them - simply add it as page 1 to your resume so that it is sent in one clear document. in addition, please add a brief paragraph as to why you want to work at inliv.
any resumes that do not include a cover letter will not be considered as this is a key piece of our recruitment methodology. we want to ensure our candidates can follow instructions and communicate clearly in a written format.

specialist - c04liw the promo data specialist works with stakeholders from within promotional planning, marketing, it as well as other areas of the company to ensure successful data management. the specialist role supports the marketing promo team by ensuring that the data feeds into the development and operating tools and models that are used to improve flyer/offer performance are accurate and free of errors. they will perform this function through data monitoring, sampling, cross referencing, audit and other procedures that are to be defined by the promotions research & analytics team.  the promo data specialists will also participate in the creation of new data to be used in the execution of the development and execution tools that are being or have been developed. the data specialists will also participate in project work that will involve the sourcing of new data to ensure it is captured to the appropriate specifications.responsibilities:work with multiple and complex data sources. data sources may include:internal pos data: regular product pricing, historical promo pricing/offerings, specific in-store specialscompetitor’s product pricing (which may not be organized or use the same nomenclature as ct)external environmental data that may come from stats canada, google analytics (i.e. weather)establishing relationships between internal skus and between internal skus and competitors products. understand and establish ‘relationship hierarchies’ between/across products. this involves both quantitative and qualitative assessment of data sources and the req id: 177196 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with over 137 years of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
 
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.  
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
 
the bell residential services team is in the business of enabling customers to connect with people, information and entertainment by delivering integrated products and service experience for consumers while enhancing our competitiveness in the marketplace.  the team provides customers with bell home phone, local and long distance services, bell internet, bell satellite tv and amazing new technologies such as bell fibe tv.
 
the bell residential & small business team is enabling small businesses to connect with their customers, and helping them do more and make more. bell’s best network technology brings powerful internet performance & phone services with maximum reliability straight to the small business.   
 
the pricing and strategy team is responsible for driving core pricing and the full suite of competitive offers for the bell small business services portfolio (tv, internet and phone).  in addition, the team is responsible for monitoring and analyzing the competitive pricing landscape for the canadian telecom market and ensuring the brsb team is well informed on all competitive developments.
the team is currently seeking a highly motivated, analytical and self-driven individual to join the team.  in the role, the brsb pricing strategy specialist will be the subject matter expert on a diverse range of pricing initiatives.  this individual will utilize their strategic and financial acumen to help identify, define, and explore pricing opportunities for the brsb team.  the successful candidate will need to work across several different cross functional teams (i.e. marketing, finance, sales, operations and product), as such, strong communication skills, and the ability to influence will be essential.
 
job duties/accountabilities: 
reporting to the senior manager of brsb pricing, the successful candidate will be responsible for:

problem identification, opportunity assessment, proposal development, business case development, and presentation delivery
structure development of strategic, transformational, and business process improvement plans
apply database knowledge and perform data and business analysis to support various business priorities, including business cases, cost/benefit analysis, process optimization & pricing strategies
 influence decisions and provide key insights to internal partners and cross functional teams based on customer analytics and a thorough understanding of both services and customer profile
develop effective pricing strategies through the understanding of key drivers that affect profitability
proven analytical skills and ability to uncover information in big data
relationship building with external departments, working collaboratively in a team environment with colleagues and senior leadership
presentation of strategic plans at the senior leadership level

 
critical qualifications/competencies:

experience in a marketing / pricing strategy role                                
experience with financial models and analysis
organization, coordination and strong time management skills to handle multiple demands in a fast-paced environment
 highly motivated, energetic, and a has a winning mind-set
ability to manage tolerance to ambiguity, flexibility, and deal effectively with adversity
excellent communication and presentation skills (written and verbal)
proficiency in ms office applications (excel, powerpoint, word and outlook)
results-driven attitude with the ability to grasp and communicate complex ideas clearly

 
preferred qualifications/competencies:

graduate  degree – business/commerce or pricing analytics background
5 years experience in a core business analytics role

 
#li-kr1
 
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)

text:
job details - cihi/icis

please apply online.  resumes must be in ms-word '.doc' or plain text .'txt' format.


city/ville
ottawa/toronto


province
ontario [on]


title
director, client experience


range minimum
$98,290


summary
 as a member of the senior management team, the director will develop and lead innovative corporate-wide approaches to client management, ensuring that cihi is putting their experiences and needs at the core of its operations and approach, while aligned with cihis strategic plan. the director will develop, implement, and direct the overall strategy around stakeholder mapping, cihi’s education offerings (including its capacity-building strategy) and approach to client services. the director will also bring a client-centred perspective and contribute to the development of cihi’s digital strategy.


duties and responsibilities
  provide strategic and tactical advice/direction to the vp, strategic communications and stakeholder relations, senior management, and corporate committees, as required, on cihi’s overall approach to stakeholder management, stakeholder engagement strategies, and drive the evolution of cihi’s education, client services and stakeholder support functions. work with cihi’s vps of eastern and western canada, cihi’s client affairs managers, and directors/managers from across the organization, lead and oversee the development and evolution of cihi’s corporate stakeholder strategy, including the creation of detailed stakeholder maps, and specific ongoing stakeholder relations plans for cihi’s president and ceo and the executive committee. deliver leadership and strategic direction to cihi’s client central services department, by driving recommendations and enhancements to towards cihi’s overall client services approach and management/support tools (e.g. crm, access management system, etc.) with the goal of ensuring that cihi’s clients receive the best possible service and support. provide leadership and strategic direction to the education and conferences department to increase the impact of cihi’s education, sponsorships and conference participation. this will include overseeing an enhanced approach to cihi’s capacity building work by ensuring it is empowering stakeholders to increase their use of cihi data to guide decision-making. create and maintain a positive working environment by fostering collaboration, staff development, engagement and retention of staff. mentor staff, provide and solicit effective feedback, conduct performance management reviews, and ensure that there are appropriate opportunities for staff development. contribute to the development of cihi’s digital portfolio in collaboration with digital leads to ensure that the work reflects stakeholder needs. monitor central client services, education and web analytics and provide recommendations and propose improvements to the stakeholder experience. keep abreast of new technologies, industry trends, and their impact on the stakeholder management, client services and the delivery of education programs. identify opportunities to implement these enhancements and lead the development of any associated business planning.


knowledge & experience
  master’s degree in communications, marketing, public/health/business administration or a related field. an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered. 6-8 years progressive leadership experience with demonstrated success in managing the design, development and implementation of client engagement strategies. this includes facilitating and partnering with a variety of stakeholders to develop content and products. strong understanding of client support tools and stakeholder relations approaches.excellent knowledge and demonstrated experience of health sector issues/challenges. proven ability to use sound business judgment to assess business needs, weed out actions and activities that will have a material impact on the business from those that will not to define scope of multiple, simultaneous, cross-functional projects and distill many complicated inputs into simple solutions. deep awareness and interest in health policy and current affairs.excellent project management, change management and facilitation skills, including project portfolio management, with the ability to assess business needs, to define scope of multiple, simultaneous, cross-functional projects. strong leadership skills, but with a willingness to dive into day-to-day operations and processes. strong attention to detail essential. experience in building and leading innovative and high-performance teams.excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.candidate must be willing to travel. knowledge of french an asset.  to find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our “careers” section. we thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. at cihi we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. if you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

10/13/2017

an increasingly fast-paced, always-on, mobile-obsessed digital landscape. our subject matter experts collaborate with fortune 100 clients to execute award-winning social campaigns across digital channels that deliver both meaningful, emotionally-charged consumer experiences and real business outcomes.    the role will be primarily focused on strategy development  leading social, influencer marketing, and community management strategy for brands with the support of strategy leadership development of audience first strategies and archetypes that capture key insights between consumer and brand a focus on social media plans, branded social performance and kpis in context with overall business goals develop integrated, cross-platform, strategic plans, and drive ideas/insights across new planning collaboration with creative team to build breakthrough campaign work that accelerates media and social media performance develop creative and communications briefs (influencers) client-facing growth, insights & analytics associate
job number: 7368
location(s): mississauga, on 
apply


food. purpose. you. 
 
we serve the world by making food people love. as one of the world’s leading food companies, general mills believes that food should make us better. food brings us joy and nourishes our lives, connecting us to each other and the earth. general mills operates in more than 100 countries and markets more than 100 consumer brands, including cheerios, häagen-dazs, nature valley, betty crocker, pillsbury, annie’s, lara bar, yoplait and more. headquartered in minneapolis, general mills had global net sales of us$17.6 billion during fiscal 2015.
 
we seek out the best talent, and then give them development resources, support and the chance to lead something big. choosing a career with general mills means joining a company where you can make a difference in the lives of millions of people. there is tremendous opportunity here for individuals who want to advance food through innovation and serve the world.
 
general mills’ culture is second to none, offering a wide variety of perks and benefits to it’s employees. when you start your day, you will be greeted by our open concept building, which boasts an impressive number of bookable and non-bookable meeting rooms and open concept workspaces, providing employees with the flexibility they need to get the job done.   with its colorful furnishings, including walls made of reclaimed barn wood, the office atmosphere proves to be modern, fun, and unique.   if you’re hungry, why not stop by our on-site cafeteria for a snack or lunch?  we offer subsidized meals ranging from $5.00-$6.00, and even provide take-home dinners at your request!   want to eat your lunch outside? relax in an adirondack chair on our patio, or go for a stroll alongside the ravine, right in our own backyard!  spilt a little lunch on your shirt? no problem! drop your dry cleaning off, right in the office.   before you leave, don’t forget to stop by our company store to grab your weekly groceries, we carry a wide variety of products (including limited edition ones) at prices that are sure to amaze.  when walking to your car, you can admire how sparkly clean it is thanks to our auto-detailing servicer (who cleaned your car while you worked)!  smile as you look at your watch see “12:00pm” flashing back at you, as it’s a sunny friday afternoon, and you, my friend, are calling it a day.  what will you do with your half-day fridays during the summer?  grab a few discounted movie or attraction passes courtesy of general mills, kick back, and relax. ahhh, all in a day’s work.   
 
are you a big picture thinker with a passion for data driven consumer insights?  if so, the canadian consumer insights team wants to talk to you.  gia (growth insights and analytics) identifies opportunities and risks by connecting consumer behavioral insights and marketplace realities.  this specific role is responsible for supporting the canadian marketing organization, by leveraging syndicated consumer purchase behavior information to provide analytics and insights that drive growth.  additionally, this role owns monthly syndicated data reporting and recommends enhancements and changes to improve usability and ease of interpretation throughout the canadian organization.
 
 
responsibilities
• owns ‘reporting centre of excellence’ and reporting integrity including report structure and maintenance• diagnose and communicate performance narratives for gmcc categories to enable common understanding and drive action• proactively provide strategic guidance on risk and growth opportunities for our categories during critical apertures: monthly lt reviews, lrp, ye plans, innovation reviews, growth stories• inform key trends in the food occasion & gmi’s opportunities in this space• consult and educate marketing stakeholders on all metrics and data sources, including appropriate use case, application, and interpretation• you will gain deep knowledge and application of a variety of consumer purchase behavior and social listening data sources, including custom nielsen market track and panel, marketing mix models, crimson hexagon, and vision critical• you will develop your ability to uncover and synthesize actionable insights to tell a story and take a stand – critical thinking & storytelling• you will ace your collaboration and relationship building skills• you will further polish your already strong communication and presentation skills• knowledge of and experience with syndicated nielsen markettrack and panel information and analyses• natural curiosity, interest in learning, and comfort with quantitative problem solving• agility & comfort with ambiguity• ability to work independently and to take initiative• ability to lead, communicate and build relationships with global stakeholders where daily face to face communication may not be possible
• data analysis/syndicated knowledge and analysis experience working with nielsen data is required. given the leadership and organizational facing nature of this role, project management and clear communication and presentation skills are required.   preferred educational background includes a minimum of a bachelor’s degree; master’s degree in business, economics, marketing, marketing research, computer science/engineering, finance or statistics preferred.
 
 
general mills is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. accommodations are available upon request for candidates with disabilities taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process

data analyst

company:
        inliv
      

location:
      calgary, ab
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
as the data analyst at inliv inc., you will work closely with the chief data officer to build our business intelligence platform.  you will be responsible for managing all aspects of inliv's data including inputting, integrity, integration, manipulation, analytics and reporting.
you will perform impact assessments related to technology choices, design / architectural considerations and implementation strategy and provide recommendations
the data analytics team will support the leadership team to create innovative data and analytics driven solutions.
your day-to-day will include:

acquire, transform and analyze data from multiple sources ensuring data quality
responsible for defining, developing, and evolving data science related tasks using the latest development methods and infrastructure
participate in normal analytics development activities like design, implementation, reviews, defect management, document handling, etc.
support impact assessments and decisions related to technology choices, design /architectural considerations and implementation strategy
collaborate with system engineers and software developers to implement solutions that are aligned with our stakeholder’s and our own strategic directions
lead the design and creation of appropriate reporting and dashboarding for use by individual departments as well as company leadership
partner with the marketing, sales and operations teams to deliver data insights, identify trends and opportunities, make suggestions for improvement and answer business questions
influence business decision making through data-based recommendations
prepare ad-hoc analysis in the support of specific initiatives as required

qualifications:

4-6 years of experience in data analytics and business reporting
bachelor degree in computer science, math, physics, applied economics or statistics
demonstrated ability to communicate in a way that is easy to understand by all stakeholders both verbally and written
proficiency with python, r, sql and tableau for data visualization
demonstrated etl skills/experience (extract, transform, load)
ability to grasp the essence of large data sets and can use and create analytical and/or statistical methods to find solutions
an eagerness to roll up your sleeves, dig deep and get the work done
experience building dashboards in common visualization tools
prior experience of working with cross functional teams
competent programming attitude with good computation and data mining skills
technical expertise, domain knowledge, experience in statistical/modeling techniques, focused on the big data space
ability and willingness to learn new technologies and methods
business oriented mindset

in order to apply, we ask you that you take the time to add a customized cover letter that clearly demonstrates what skills you have and where you have obtained them - simply add it as page 1 to your resume so that it is sent in one clear document. in addition, please add a brief paragraph as to why you want to work at inliv.
any resumes that do not include a cover letter will not be considered as this is a key piece of our recruitment methodology. we want to ensure our candidates can follow instructions and communicate clearly in a written format.

date: 
sep 18, 2017
                


location: 
mississauga, on, ca


company: 
bell


req id: 177196 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with over 137 years of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
 
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.  
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
 
the bell residential services team is in the business of enabling customers to connect with people, information and entertainment by delivering integrated products and service experience for consumers while enhancing our competitiveness in the marketplace.  the team provides customers with bell home phone, local and long distance services, bell internet, bell satellite tv and amazing new technologies such as bell fibe tv.
 
the bell residential & small business team is enabling small businesses to connect with their customers, and helping them do more and make more. bell’s best network technology brings powerful internet performance & phone services with maximum reliability straight to the small business.   
 
the pricing and strategy team is responsible for driving core pricing and the full suite of competitive offers for the bell small business services portfolio (tv, internet and phone).  in addition, the team is responsible for monitoring and analyzing the competitive pricing landscape for the canadian telecom market and ensuring the brsb team is well informed on all competitive developments.
the team is currently seeking a highly motivated, analytical and self-driven individual to join the team.  in the role, the brsb pricing strategy specialist will be the subject matter expert on a diverse range of pricing initiatives.  this individual will utilize their strategic and financial acumen to help identify, define, and explore pricing opportunities for the brsb team.  the successful candidate will need to work across several different cross functional teams (i.e. marketing, finance, sales, operations and product), as such, strong communication skills, and the ability to influence will be essential.
 
job duties/accountabilities: 
reporting to the senior manager of brsb pricing, the successful candidate will be responsible for:

problem identification, opportunity assessment, proposal development, business case development, and presentation delivery
structure development of strategic, transformational, and business process improvement plans
apply database knowledge and perform data and business analysis to support various business priorities, including business cases, cost/benefit analysis, process optimization & pricing strategies
 influence decisions and provide key insights to internal partners and cross functional teams based on customer analytics and a thorough understanding of both services and customer profile
develop effective pricing strategies through the understanding of key drivers that affect profitability
proven analytical skills and ability to uncover information in big data
relationship building with external departments, working collaboratively in a team environment with colleagues and senior leadership
presentation of strategic plans at the senior leadership level

 
critical qualifications/competencies:

experience in a marketing / pricing strategy role                                
experience with financial models and analysis
organization, coordination and strong time management skills to handle multiple demands in a fast-paced environment
 highly motivated, energetic, and a has a winning mind-set
ability to manage tolerance to ambiguity, flexibility, and deal effectively with adversity
excellent communication and presentation skills (written and verbal)
proficiency in ms office applications (excel, powerpoint, word and outlook)
results-driven attitude with the ability to grasp and communicate complex ideas clearly

 
preferred qualifications/competencies:

graduate  degree – business/commerce or pricing analytics background
5 years experience in a core business analytics role

 
#li-kr1
 
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)
 
additional information:
position type: management
job location: canada : ontario : don mills || canada : ontario : mississauga
application deadline: 10/13/2017
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role. applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

digital project coordinator, global digital marketing

job description


about kpmg international and the global resource centrekpmg is a global network of professional services firms providing audit, tax and advisory services, operating in 152 countries with over 186,000 people and with global revenues in fy16 of more than $25.42 billion. kpmg international, a matrix organization, works at the global level and sets strategy, ensures global consistency and provides expertise to support member firms in the achievement of their business and employer of choice objectives. many resources to support global have been centralized at the global resource centre (grc) in toronto. the grc provides global marketing & communications, learning & development, procurement, risk, finance and it.position summarythe coordinator reports directly to the digital project manager to support the delivery of a broad spectrum of digital products, including websites, mobile sites and applications, analytics and standards monitoring tools, social media tools and events management systems, that all leverage our underlying content management system as a single content source. in addition to supporting the kpmg domain namespace via domain name portfolio management, dns administration, and processing requests against various marketing, risk, and brand policies.what you will do  based in toronto, the role of the project coordinator is to:create and update project documents, plans and schedules by leveraging the use of ms projectcoordinate meetings, create agendas and minutes.  this includes teleconferences and facilitation meetings, attendee availability and confirmation, room assignment, catering and documentationupdate project budget and tracking spreadsheetsdocument project team organization, stakeholder lists, responsibilities grids, and contact lists.project life cycle documentation using company methodologies and toolscreate, track and update process and data flows, alternatives assessments, and other project documentation regarding project phases, risks, issues, decisions, open questions, assumptions, etc. (including service models)maintain project documents and other information in the project repository ensuring easy access and usability by the project teamcoordinates project resource changes, including space, equipment, and update of project documentation (team lists, organization charts, etc.)create powerpoint and visio documentation for the project team to facilitate understanding of complex project issues as well as to document project or process flowsprovide administrative and tracking support to the team as necessarycomplete, update and distribute project deliverables, financials, expense reports, tracking spreadsheets and presentationsproperly illicit zone file information and configure/communicate as necessary to the dns providerprocess new domain requests from member firms and global office, domain transfers into the kpmg domain portfolio, domain renewals and domain acquisitions.  in addition, process sub-domain modifications from member firms and global office, maintains ssl certificates on kpmg domains namespace and handle domain name infringements and trademark claimsat times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. what you bring to the role diploma or degree preferably in marketing and/or business technology minimum of 2 years in business ideally in a project coordinator roledns and domain name management experience would be preferred but not requireda team player who is able to react positively to changing prioritiesstrong organizational, writing, interpersonal and communications skillsknowledge of project management processes and tasks, methodologies and toolsbe able to demonstrate initiative and act as a creative problem solversolid attention to detail is a mustsharepoint and ms office – word, powerpoint, excel, ms project, ms visio, sharepoint 2013/2016 (user level) and aem (basic level)ability to build relationships and collaborate with vendor partners, such as hospitality suppliersa proactive, highly service oriented and client-centric attitudeability to interact with senior management, exercising diplomacy and good judgementhave the ability to plan ahead and manage work to meet deadlinespro-active with a ‘can do’ attitudeflexible and able to operate in the context of different cultural and international approaches – adapt to time zone challengesany industry accredited certifications in project management such as certified associate in project management (capm) is preferred, but not required  why choose kpmg? making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at kpmg.

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

français

job searchour processcareer levelsexperiencedstarting your careerabout avivahome







digital marketing consultant


position overviewwe are looking for an exceptional digital marketing professional to join our team of passionate digital marketers.   are you excited about developing and implementing digital marketing strategies? in an effort to digitize their operations, we work closely with our insurance broker partners to support their digital ambitions. 
join our team in the new state-of-the-art digital garage in downtown toronto. you will be part of a team that works on some of the most interesting digital projects at aviva canada. we are looking for team players who embrace and thrive in a high energy and high performance culture.accountabilities
work directly with aviva canada brokerages to transform their marketing plans into revenue drivers, using best practices in marketing automation, lead management and revenue performance management
lead brokerage engagements in the execution and optimization of customer acquisition campaigns and programs to ensure campaigns are successfully implemented
drive the quantitative and qualitative evaluation of new digital and advertising opportunities, providing detailed analysis and performance updates
manage projects to deliver the desired results in a timely manner. collaborate with brokerages to gather requirements and feedback, analyze results and present findings
provide digital expertise to brokerages on topics including self-service, social media, digital marketing campaigns, web and mobile usability, brand, design, and content
required qualifications, knowledge, & skills
4+ years of experience in digital marketing
agency and/or client side experience managing complex digital advertising campaigns
understanding of digital marketing and metrics including seo and sem (paid search), social and analytics
expertise in marketing automation processes including lead management, campaign management and online marketing
excellent client management skills, strong written and verbal communications, strong presentation skills
experience with sales funnels and customer lifecycle management models
expertise with crm applications and web metrics systems
strong project management and organizational skills
insurance experience would be an asset, but not required
ability and willingness to travel up to 50%
additional informationaviva canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. if you require an accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. applicants need to make their needs known in advance. if you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the talent acquisition partner who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation.about avivaaviva canada is one of the leading property and casualty insurance groups in the country providing home, automobile, leisure/lifestyle and business insurance to more than three million customers. a wholly-owned subsidiary of uk-based aviva plc, the company has more than 4,000 employees focused on creating a bright and sustainable future for their customers and communities.
aviva canada invests in positive change through the aviva community fund, canada’s longest running online community funding competition. since its inception in 2009, the aviva community fund has awarded $7.5 million to over 250 charities and community groups nationwide. aviva canada, bringing over 300 years of good thinking and insurance solutions to canadians from coast-to-coast.
for more information visit avivacanada.com, the company’s blog or twitter, facebook and linkedin pages.

opentext - the information company as the information company, our mission at opentext is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. be part of a winning team that leads the way in enterprise information management.   the opportunity:  our fast-growth opentext analytics division is the leader in providing enterprise business intelligence platforms and embedded analytics including our latest release - opentext magellan. magellan provides a flexible, pre-wired ai (artificial intelligence) - powered analytics platform that combines open source machine learning with advanced analytics. as a marketing program manager for analytics, you will be able to embrace your account based marketing expertise to drive a healthy pipeline for the analytics business.  your campaigns/programs will embrace a full marketing mix including, account based marketing, digital, social and events.  you will leverage your relationship skills to build the trust and credibility with the field..  you are great at: • work closely with sales and account development to generate sale qualified leads,  pipeline and revenue• develop and execute account based marketing strategies for key account(s) in region• own the timely execution of the regional account-based marketing plan with emphasis on identifying net new business opportunities within enterprise level accounts• digital marketing experience in the development of campaign strategy• develop strategy, plan and execute marketing campaigns to support sales initiatives -this includes events, email, online/digital media, direct mail, sponsorships, and advertising• work closely with account development to drive pipeline results • evaluate, measure, and report on all marketing campaign effectiveness and roi on a monthly and quarterly basis


what it takes:   • a minimum of 5 years’ experience in digital marketing programs, campaign development or related experience in enterprise software or b2b company• salesforce and marketing automation (preferably eloqua) experience• strong communication skills as you will be required to work with and persuade many constituents within the organization• strong project management skills to work closely with team members, product marketing, industry experts, and field marketers to ensure timely execution on all campaigns• strong analytical skills to understand the campaign metrics and provide meaningful analysis of the campaign performance leveraging salesforce.com and eloqua reporting and dashboards• a proven track record of building and executing multi-channel campaigns that achieve target goals including leads, pipeline and revenue. • a self-motivated, performance-driven and professional demeanor• bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications or related field is required#li-post

                            at opentext we understand and value diversity in our employees and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. we hire the best talent regardless of sex, national origin, disability or race. if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email accommodationrequests@opentext.com

title: Digital Growth Marketer
text:
digital growth marketer - canvaspop - job board view our website view all jobs digital growth marketer ottawa, ontario, canada full time digital marketing mid level canvaspop is a venture-backed b2c e-commerce company focused on delivering personalized wall art and home decor products. winner of startup canada’s global entrepreneurship award. with over 300,000 happy customers around the globe, we’re now looking to grow and innovate the personalized art market using technology and mass customization. we’re looking for an experienced and passionate marketer to lead growth initiatives that can scale. as a growth marketer at canvaspop, you will be responsible for leveraging digital channels to drive traffic that converts. if you’re someone who sees opportunities when others don’t, can gather insights from data, and loves experimenting, then come join our effort to grow canvaspop into a household name! job functions create and carry out growth experiments that drive traffic to canvaspop.com using online channels (content marketing, adwords, facebook ads, email marketing, seo, etc.) strategize and lead the building of optimized landing pages to convert traffic from targeted ppc advertising and retargeting campaigns (facebook, google adwords) assist in the creation and amplification of content (blog posts, infographics, videos, etc.) through distribution on relevant publications use google analytics and other reporting tools to gather insights, track and optimize performance of growth initiatives plan, schedule, and send promotional email campaigns and drip email campaigns; test email content to optimize open and click-through rates    required experience 2+ years of digital marketing experience; driving traffic through paid, earned, and owned channels growth mindset; able to come up with experiments, test and iterate quickly; learn from previous challenges   knowledge of html and css, and basic proficiency with design tools (sketch, photoshop) analytical and able to gather insights and make decisions from data (on google analytics, for example) experience using tools such as mailchimp, semrush, wordpress is an asset what you’ll get from us work with a passionate team to deliver the world with remarkable, personalized art flexible vacation   health, dental, vision benefits the latest tech to help you succeed competitive compensation + ownership in the company read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* address phone* resume* attach resume or paste resume attach resume as .pdf, .doc, or .docx (limit 2mb) or paste resume paste your resume here or attach resume file cover letter* in 150 characters or fewer, tell us what makes you unique. try to be creative and say something that will catch our eye!* 150 submit application ×close forward this position recipient email address (one) your name your email address enter a message (optional) the message cannot contain links human check* privacy & terms

title: Data Scientist
text:
407 etr | career



skip to content






























search





































career opportunities







data scientist


location:
headquarters


job code:
504


# of openings:
2



description
position summary:
the successful candidate will assist in leveraging customer, digital and transportation datasets to create insights on pricing, marketing and customer behavior. the data scientist will assist the director of data analytics and other key stakeholders to bring actionable data driven solutions to 407etr. this job involves model design, data management, data queries, and providing input into programs and policies. this position is part of a highly collaborative and energetic team in a start-up minded environment.
position responsibility:

assemble and analyze data to understand customer behavior from existing 407 etr data, external data sources and emerging sources.


undertake analysis of target customer groups (segments) for specific marketing and pricing programs and assess opportunities and strategies for marketing.
ad hoc analysis and modeling of data.
ability to understand business stakeholder’s issues and create valuable insight.
raise awareness and action of data science within the company to help focus on fact based decisions.
support the department along with the information technology management department in planning the structure and storage of new customer related data fields.
represent the department in committees within the organization.

qualifications:

a university degree in engineering, statistics, mathematics, or computer science.


minimum 5 years working experience with data science techniques: clustering, regression models, classification, anomaly detection and other machine learning techniques.
minimum 5 years of experience with data analysis tools (eg. sas, r or python) and bi visualization for reporting.
well-developed business analysis, research and creative problem solving skills.
organizational skills and time management skills; planning and project management, and ability to meet multiple deadlines.
strong communication skills and work ethic.
highly collaborative team player with an entrepreneurial spirit.
familiarity with microstrategy is an asset.

note: this job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
accommodations for disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process.
