title: Senior Director, Digital Insights
text:
job description - senior director, digital insights (17014161)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior director, digital insights (17014161)job description senior director, digital insights requisition id: 17014161position type: regularposition status: full timejob: marketing/advertisingwork location: canada-ontario-toronto-40 dundas street west 4th floorunposting date: oct 10, 2017, 10:59:00 pm description cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution that’s been providing a full range of financial products and services to 11 million clients for 150 years. at cibc digital we provide personalized, simple, yet flexible digital experiences for our clients, and accelerate revenue growth for our bank. our client-centered approach builds relationships and improves sales and service through our targeted offers, atm, web and mobile channels.
 
working in an agile based startup environment, our team is comprised of talent from across all verticals – banking, consulting, and technology, among others. we brainstorm and incubate ideas at our live labs at mars discovery district where we challenge ourselves to see the world through the eyes of the client, then build and test our way to success. and we have fun while we’re doing it!
 
join our growing team of digital groundbreakers with the bank of the future. you’ll fit right in if you…
 
…think like an entrepreneur
…can see through the client’s eyes
…love to challenge the status quo
…have a passion for all things digital
…understand that collaboration is necessary for success
 
to learn more about cibc’s lines of business check out our website. 
 
to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please visit cibc.com.
 
job overview
 

reporting
to the senior vice president, digital, the senior digital insights is
responsible for setting the vision, strategy and enabling deeper insights to
drive digital sales and to provide support other future state digital
experience strategies on cibc’s online, mobile, social and abm channels.  this includes forming a digital insights
centre of excellence goals and objectives, proactively identifying and developing
tactics to accelerate revenue growth, building and leading a team of seasoned
analytics practitioners, supporting long term online/mobile channel
implementations, and developing strategic partnerships with multiple lines of
business.  this position also works closely with the chief data office, technology
and other internal and external partners to ensure data integrity, and the
efficient and effective management of information reported to and utilized by
the business.the senior director will also maintain a
strong understanding of evolving customer preferences, industry best practices,
performance benchmarks, competitor capabilities and strategies while continuing
to identify ways to enhance sales effectiveness / optimization of client
experiences across online, mobile, app, wearable, and atm technologies using
relevant measurement strategies.what you’ll be doinglead a team responsible for the development and
implementation of measuring online, mobile, app and wearable technology- touch-points
in a consistent and comprehensive manner, including understanding effectiveness
of sales, costs of servicing, campaign cost of sale insights, impact of digital
channels on customer retention and satisfaction, digital channels usage impacts
on customer lifetime value and digital enhancement impacts to overall net
promoter score.rollout of the digital experience and insights
centre of excellence operating model with a high priority placed on operating
efficiencies and processes that will enable the quick turnaround of
deliverables, real time / ad hoc insights, and synergies between other digital
channels teams.push the status quo to dive deeper into
understanding the digital client journey, connecting external traffic drivers,
benchmarks, and other relevant client experience insights to build a cohesive
story and actionable recommendation from data.provide post analysis support for digital sales,
strategy, cibc.com, online banking and mobile banking related initiatives. partner with channel strategy to support proof of
concept assessments involving cross selling from digital and identifying interrelationships
between digital and all major cibc distribution channels.create executive level insights as single point of
contact for use in business case development, revenue forecasting, modelling
and presenting findings at an overall committee level.develop and maintain relationships with key vendors
to investigate leading edge analytical tools, methodologies, and to keep
abreast of best practices across the banking and other sales industries.monitor the performance of digital
channel strategies, policies, programs, to ensure the fulfillment of strategic
objectives. recommend changes to
programs, products or services, or channel offerings as needed.provide authoritative analysis,
interpretation and opinion to support and guide executive management and teams,
ensuring an understanding and acceptance of issues and influence the direction
and nature of programs including digital user experience, digital strategy,
digital optimization, digital sales, and lines of business.at the executive level of the
organization, promote the strategic concepts, analytical tools and
deliverables, and other services provided by the digital experience and insights
team.  support sales, strategy and
partner peers with relevant insights related to adopting the new approaches to
doing business, new digital channel technologies, or new products or channel
enhancements.prepare and present reports on
significant trends impacting digital banking, including client, competitive,
regulatory, and technological or data developments.develop and support high-level
recommendations, approaches and solution for input into cibc overall digital
strategy.drive sales through strategic
project insights and new capabilities eg) implementation on how to complete
e-deposit  what we’re looking for
ability to conduct detailed
     analysis, incorporating comprehensive mathematical, statistical and
     analytical methods, models and guidelines. 
comprehensive knowledge of analysis
     sufficient to interpret and analyze complex concepts and apply these in
     innovative ways.
advanced communication skills
     sufficient to creatively and precisely articulate ideas and opinions that
     involve analysis, interpretation and assessment. 
knowledge and user capability
     of test & learn software.
comprehensive knowledge of
     financial services industry and a solid understanding of cibc distribution
     channels. 
ability to build and retain a
     highly skilled experience and insights team.
deep experience in digital strategy
     development, market/competitive and customer research and analytics;
     relevant strategy experience in product/distribution management
developed knowledge of cibc and
     retail banking industry including products, services and channels.
developed understanding of
     retail financial services distribution, including the challenges
     associated with a complex, multi-channel sales and service environment,
     from a customer and organizational perspective. 
ability to define and make
     recommendations on multi-year strategic business priorities by assessing
     implications of industry-level trends, competitive and internal business
     dynamics, and the evolution of customer needs, preferences and behaviours.
experience and understanding of
     process and technology issues and the impact on customer experience.
proven analytic and problem
     solving skills, including the ability to develop creative, logical and
     practical analytic frameworks; ability to define, assess and prioritize a
     broad portfolio of strategic initiatives. 
demonstrated business judgment
     and ability to prioritize actions or focus, particularly when faced with
     significant complexity or ambiguity. 
proficiency with adobe
     marketing cloud, google analytics, sql, ios, android and various other
     industry leading digital sdk’s and technologies is an asset. 
what cibc can offer you

flexible health benefits, stock purchase plan, competitive incentive pay and recognition programs

competitive salary and banking benefits 

career growth, development and continuous learning opportunities

opportunity to be involved in cibc events that help our communities

click to learn more about rewards & recognition, learning & development, and employee community involvement

rb is different: ‘good enough’ isn’t good enough here. 
 
rb is the world's leading consumer health and hygiene company, we work with the best people to challenge conventional thinking and keep giving people innovative solutions for healthier lives and happier homes, through our brands like nurofen, strepsils, mucinex, dettol, lysol, finish and vanish.
 


 
a fantastic opportunity is available for a sales analyst to join our sales team. 
  
 

about the role
 
the sales analyst is accountable for supporting the sales team in delivering compelling and fact based insights to drive business building initiatives and is responsible for measuring their impact. key areas of responsibility include supporting the team in identifying and finding solutions to close in-mkt 4ps gaps & improving financial forecasting for channel, and w/ analytical support from retailer and market data sources. 

 




 

responsibilities
 


utilize retailer pos data to compile & interpret in-depth customer analysis and provide recommendations on 4p’s to maximize opportunities (including, but not limited to; stores selling, dc & store level inventory, pre/post promo analysis, display mix, sell through, pricing, etc.).

leverage available market data (markettrack, cross outlet facts, answers online, etc.) to identify business building opportunities.

provide analytics required for rb internal and customer specific presentations.

assist in development and implementation of sales strategy to deliver against budget (ns,gm,ts) and 4p opportunities.

work with cross functional departments to drive customer service level and manage trade deductions within established targets. 

work with account sales team to drive retail effectiveness at store level.

continually monitor store execution and report back findings.

create and continually update reports for the customer sales team including: pos tracker, jbp tracker, flyer/promo trackers, optimum usage, distribution, stores selling, pc points usage, etc

lead the marketing initiatives at the retailer (optimum, bsl, storewide events and inserts) - coordinating with the retailer as well as internal rb teams to ensure timely completion of all components. 

manage the account responsibilities for rcwc and fortino’s.

lead the rep retail coverage for vision store



qualifications
 

university degree in a business related discipline
strong excel skills
ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities while consistently meeting deadlines
detail oriented and organized
strong interpersonal, communication, and team-based skills 
entrepreneurial and ability to take initiative
good knowledge of the consumer packaged goods industry

 
in return rb offer very competitive salaries with excellent benefits and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organisation.
  
apply now for a chance to really change the game!
 
 
we are an equal opportunity employer. in accordance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act, 2005 and the ontario human rights code, rb canada will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. if selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform the talent acquisition team of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

website
ruby 


ruby a global technology company that is home to the world’s most unique dating web sites. like relationships, ruby is complex and multifaceted. ashley madison , the flagship brand of ruby , is revolutionizing the way millions of people located around the world connect and meet. as a canadian technology company driven by analytics and user centric design, we care about our customer experience and are continuously looking for ways to make it better!
life is short, be agile and step out of the box. does the idea of working creatively every day with the ability to dig deeper and solve huge problems intrigue you? do you envision yourself working with smart people in a collaborative, fast-paced, environment using the latest technology tools? have you always dreamed about working for a company where you can apply your great talents and continue to learn and grow throughout your career? if you answered “yes” to all of these questions then ruby is the place for you!
we work hard, play hard and have fun. we foster a culture where you can be yourself and where diversity workforce, thought, and opinion is expected.
data developer
as a data developer, some of your duties will include designing a/b test experiments and analyzing their outcomes, data mining user behavioural data, analyzing marketing campaign effectiveness, and making recommendations to improve user site experience.
here’s the team you will be joining
be a data developer, be a rock star of the company!
you will join a dynamic analytics team of data loving, number crunching individuals who drive the business forward. your insights will support all levels of our business by making data driven decisions.
are you passionate about finding insights from numbers? with millions of members worldwide, you will never get bored or worry about sample size when you design a multivariate data experiment. as a team, we consistently do pretty awesome big data work.
we are a leading edge company, and so is our analytics team. we’ve built up a list of cool business intelligence tools and created fancy data visualization dashboards. we explore new technologies in order to keep ourselves at the forefront of the industry.
here’s what you’ll do

work independently from requirements gathering through to shipping code to start off our internal tools and analytics development projects
work with the data scientist team to build out additional tools to support their work, derive new models and analyses, and help take their analysis to the next level (with over 50 million members worldwide, the data base is significant)
continuously identify ways to measure our business and use technology to enhance everything we do
ensure assigned services & written code are maintained to ensure optimum performance (along with writing new tools)
empower the analyst team by augmenting their statistical abilities with software tools to allow for either faster or more complex analysis
build and maintain a suite of user facing data tools and bi applications
ability to “do everything” from system administration, to development, to qa in order to deliver any software product
understand statistical methods and tools to integrate into your software solutions
research the latest information on machine learning and statistics software development and communicate/inform other stakeholders of “what is possible”
other duties as assigned

here’s what you’ll need
experience requirements:

2+ years in full stack software development, demonstrated experience writing web applications
hands-on working knowledge with lamp. we run/host our internal tools on linux, python, apache, mysql, and php.
experience working with mvc frameworks (cakephp, symfony/silex experience is a plus)
expert knowledge with relational database, writing & creating highly optimized queries
strong analytical and quantitative skills—you will work with data scientists.
knowledge with machine learning and distributed big data tools (spark, kafka, hdfs, and cassandra) is a plus
ability to work independently and within a cross functional team environment.

academic requirements:

bsc computer science, engineering or math or, equivalent academic & related work experience.
new graduates welcome

here’s what we provide:

an aggressive compensation package
we are conveniently located just steps from the ttc subway
the opportunity to work with brilliant people in an entrepreneurial, forward thinking environment
friday mixer every week
company-provided lunch every 2 weeks and breakfast every friday
incredible social events

qualified candidates should send a resume and cover letter to human resources. in the e-mail subject line please reference “data developer.“
we thank all applicants for their interest ruby; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
ruby is an equal opportunity employer. we encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including members of designated groups. ruby will provide reasonable workplace accommodation to applicants with disabilities.

title: Inbound Marketing Yoda
text:
pb+j - jobs: inbound marketing yoda - apply online

























all jobs
→
inbound marketing yoda

inbound marketing yoda
toronto, ontario, canada

descriptiontoronto, on or lindsay, onapplication deadline: october 10, 9am, 2017____________________________________________________________________pb+j is looking for a prolific and kick-@$# inbound marketer to join our team full-time. you will be helping lead our exciting expansion into inbound marketing and will be an astronaut of pb+j, blazing new trails into digital space.do you consider yourself a stellar inbound marketer that thinks independently both inside and outside of “the box”? do you possess an unrelenting sense of strategy, creativity, and resourcefulness that would make macgyver jealous? do you live to inbound market, like, you get up in the morning with the desire to figure out "where in the funnel" the cereal box toy would sit (conceptually, of course) in one's cereal buying journey? if so, you just might be the next member of our weird but loveable work family. #jamfamit goes without saying that this role requires a high level of strategic thinking, problem-solving, attention to detail, and the ability to project manage like a boss, but we are looking for so much more (give us a chance to explain ourselves):requirementsbeyond living and breathing inbound marketing, you should have the following: 2+ years of inbound marketing experience a thorough understanding of hubspot, both strategically and technically inbound certification from hubspot academy bonus certs: hubspot marketing software certification or content marketing certification  proven success conceptualizing, executing and managing inbound campaigns an ability to demonstrate that you are an exceptional communicator and extremely process-driven a genuine love for people—you’re not a ‘hide-in-a-dark-room-and-work’ type ability to lead a client and a teama sincere love of learning and sharing—we don’t hoard information here; we are excited when things run smoothly because everyone is in the know; “sharing is caring”, as mr. rogers says. a love of fast-paced workflows and change—you thrive under pressure and love the unpredictable the independence to work with minimal supervision while staying on top of projects with many variables and moving parts you have an affinity for george michael, g.o.b., and the whole gang. the skills required to navigate around meaningful analytics and results tied to kpis, with an ability to use data to inform all decisions an unwavering commitment to the practice and implementation of inbound methodologies  bonus round! some gravy-train skills you should call out if you got 'em: google analytics and/or google adwords management social media management writing experience outside of inbound-related content pieces   as the inbound marketing yoda at pb+j you will be responsible for: managing multiple inbound client accounts and leading the production of a specified set of content pieces on a monthly and quarterly basis (including blogs, ebooks, etc.) goal setting and reporting with clients building and managing a rich content calendar that attracts a qualified audience and meets clients goals comprehensive set-up of new hubspot accounts, and ongoing optimization (strategically, but also ability to lead technically) helping lead the team with all things inbound methodology, including best practices and the ongoing evolution of our inbound marketing offerings and our process thinking outside of your limitations. we’re always challenging ourselves to do better and push our process further. benefits competitive full-time salary group benefits package plus health spending account (hsa) 4 weeks paid vacation unlimited flex time paid christmastime / holiday break downtown toronto (king west) or lindsay (kawartha lakes) office location work remotely: you are expected to be on-site 3 days a week, the others you can work wherever. (as a team, we work on shiny macbooks and are almost entirely cloud-based to make this possible and seamless.) work alongside a young and exciting, culture-driven team in a modern, casual, and creative work environment! if you live by inbound methodologies, get excited about content marketing, and think you’ve got the chops to do it all, point us in the direction of your best work (i.e. an online portfolio or links to sample content) and send us your resume and cover letter. we would love to hear from you!please, no drop-ins. we will certainly be in touch if we think you’re the jam to our peanut butter ;)____________________________________________________________________important: in addition to submitting your resume and work samples, you must also complete a mandatory plum survey at: http://bit.ly/2wgtauw to be considered for this position.____________________________________________________________________about pb+j:if you don’t know us, pb+j is a digital agency that crafts kick @$# brands for even kick @$#-ier entrepreneurs, smbs, and even a few larger brands, just for good measure. we believe great ideas need great strategy, and that great strategy needs great creative. over the past five years, we've worked with over 300 awesome-sauce clients from the usa, canada, and around the world to help them achieve success.we’re all about pushing the norms of design and communication, and we’re not threatened by newness. actually, we embrace it; we love it! we stand out...we do...and we are looking to bring on a new inbound marketing yoda that stands out, too. www.addpbj.com

mississauga, on freelance job summaryreporting to the director of marketing and communications, the marketing assistant will be responsible for supporting the execution of our 360 marketing strategy. you will be an integral part of the development and execution of marketing initiatives that grow brand awareness, support market positioning of our products/services and drives efforts to acquire new clients while enhancing the level of engagement in our existing client base. the marketing assistant should be a competent professional able to grasp consumer behavior trends and generate creative ideas. you will be passionate about your field and well-versed in specialized marketing concepts, principles and tactics.responsibilities and dutiesassist with all marketing, advertising, branding, communication and promotional activities .assist in design, build, maintain and execute all aspects of our content marketing strategy to align with key marketing and sales activities and ensure consistent brand positioning.assist with coordinating marketing campaigns with sales activities through development or assistance with sales presentations (ppt), sales packages and sales collateral.assist with events, functions, tickets, incentive programs and customer appreciation initiatives.brainstorm new and creative growth strategies, identify trends and insights, and optimize spend and performance based on the insightsqualifications and skillsa college diploma or working towards completion in a marketing related fieldwell-organized and detail orientedthorough understanding of marketing elements (including traditional and digital marketing such as seo/social media etc.) and market research methodsdemonstrable experience in marketing data analytics and toolssolid computer skills, including ms office, marketing software (adobe creative suite & crm) and applications (web analytics, google adwords etcjob type: freelance 5 days ago - digital project coordinator, global digital marketing






toronto, on 


job description


about kpmg international and the global resource centrekpmg is a global network of professional services firms providing audit, tax and advisory services, operating in 152 countries with over 186,000 people and with global revenues in fy16 of more than $25.42 billion. kpmg international, a matrix organization, works at the global level and sets strategy, ensures global consistency and provides expertise to support member firms in the achievement of their business and employer of choice objectives. many resources to support global have been centralized at the global resource centre (grc) in toronto. the grc provides global marketing & communications, learning & development, procurement, risk, finance and it.position summarythe coordinator reports directly to the digital project manager to support the delivery of a broad spectrum of digital products, including websites, mobile sites and applications, analytics and standards monitoring tools, social media tools and events management systems, that all leverage our underlying content management system as a single content source. in addition to supporting the kpmg domain namespace via domain name portfolio management, dns administration, and processing requests against various marketing, risk, and brand policies.what you will do  based in toronto, the role of the project coordinator is to:create and update project documents, plans and schedules by leveraging the use of ms projectcoordinate meetings, create agendas and minutes.  this includes teleconferences and facilitation meetings, attendee availability and confirmation, room assignment, catering and documentationupdate project budget and tracking spreadsheetsdocument project team organization, stakeholder lists, responsibilities grids, and contact lists.project life cycle documentation using company methodologies and toolscreate, track and update process and data flows, alternatives assessments, and other project documentation regarding project phases, risks, issues, decisions, open questions, assumptions, etc. (including service models)maintain project documents and other information in the project repository ensuring easy access and usability by the project teamcoordinates project resource changes, including space, equipment, and update of project documentation (team lists, organization charts, etc.)create powerpoint and visio documentation for the project team to facilitate understanding of complex project issues as well as to document project or process flowsprovide administrative and tracking support to the team as necessarycomplete, update and distribute project deliverables, financials, expense reports, tracking spreadsheets and presentationsproperly illicit zone file information and configure/communicate as necessary to the dns providerprocess new domain requests from member firms and global office, domain transfers into the kpmg domain portfolio, domain renewals and domain acquisitions.  in addition, process sub-domain modifications from member firms and global office, maintains ssl certificates on kpmg domains namespace and handle domain name infringements and trademark claimsat times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. what you bring to the role diploma or degree preferably in marketing and/or business technology minimum of 2 years in business ideally in a project coordinator roledns and domain name management experience would be preferred but not requireda team player who is able to react positively to changing prioritiesstrong organizational, writing, interpersonal and communications skillsknowledge of project management processes and tasks, methodologies and toolsbe able to demonstrate initiative and act as a creative problem solversolid attention to detail is a mustsharepoint and ms office – word, powerpoint, excel, ms project, ms visio, sharepoint 2013/2016 (user level) and aem (basic level)ability to build relationships and collaborate with vendor partners, such as hospitality suppliersa proactive, highly service oriented and client-centric attitudeability to interact with senior management, exercising diplomacy and good judgementhave the ability to plan ahead and manage work to meet deadlinespro-active with a ‘can do’ attitudeflexible and able to operate in the context of different cultural and international approaches – adapt to time zone challengesany industry accredited certifications in project management such as certified associate in project management (capm) is preferred, but not required  why choose kpmg? making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at kpmg.

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

digital marketing consultant


position overviewwe are looking for an exceptional digital marketing professional to join our team of passionate digital marketers.   are you excited about developing and implementing digital marketing strategies? in an effort to digitize their operations, we work closely with our insurance broker partners to support their digital ambitions. 
join our team in the new state-of-the-art digital garage in downtown toronto. you will be part of a team that works on some of the most interesting digital projects at aviva canada. we are looking for team players who embrace and thrive in a high energy and high performance culture.accountabilities
work directly with aviva canada brokerages to transform their marketing plans into revenue drivers, using best practices in marketing automation, lead management and revenue performance management
lead brokerage engagements in the execution and optimization of customer acquisition campaigns and programs to ensure campaigns are successfully implemented
drive the quantitative and qualitative evaluation of new digital and advertising opportunities, providing detailed analysis and performance updates
manage projects to deliver the desired results in a timely manner. collaborate with brokerages to gather requirements and feedback, analyze results and present findings
provide digital expertise to brokerages on topics including self-service, social media, digital marketing campaigns, web and mobile usability, brand, design, and content
required qualifications, knowledge, & skills
4+ years of experience in digital marketing
agency and/or client side experience managing complex digital advertising campaigns
understanding of digital marketing and metrics including seo and sem (paid search), social and analytics
expertise in marketing automation processes including lead management, campaign management and online marketing
excellent client management skills, strong written and verbal communications, strong presentation skills
experience with sales funnels and customer lifecycle management models
expertise with crm applications and web metrics systems
strong project management and organizational skills
insurance experience would be an asset, but not required
ability and willingness to travel up to 50%
additional informationaviva canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. if you require an accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. applicants need to make their needs known in advance. if you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the talent acquisition partner who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation.about avivaaviva canada is one of the leading property and casualty insurance groups in the country providing home, automobile, leisure/lifestyle and business insurance to more than three million customers. a wholly-owned subsidiary of uk-based aviva plc, the company has more than 4,000 employees focused on creating a bright and sustainable future for their customers and communities.
aviva canada invests in positive change through the aviva community fund, canada’s longest running online community funding competition. since its inception in 2009, the aviva community fund has awarded $7.5 million to over 250 charities and community groups nationwide. aviva canada, bringing over 300 years of good thinking and insurance solutions to canadians from coast-to-coast.
for more information visit avivacanada.com, the company’s blog or twitter, facebook and linkedin pages.

opentext - the information company as the information company, our mission at opentext is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. be part of a winning team that leads the way in enterprise information management.   the opportunity:  our fast-growth opentext analytics division is the leader in providing enterprise business intelligence platforms and embedded analytics including our latest release - opentext magellan. magellan provides a flexible, pre-wired ai (artificial intelligence) - powered analytics platform that combines open source machine learning with advanced analytics. as a marketing program manager for analytics, you will be able to embrace your account based marketing expertise to drive a healthy pipeline for the analytics business.  your campaigns/programs will embrace a full marketing mix including, account based marketing, digital, social and events.  you will leverage your relationship skills to build the trust and credibility with the field..  you are great at: • work closely with sales and account development to generate sale qualified leads,  pipeline and revenue• develop and execute account based marketing strategies for key account(s) in region• own the timely execution of the regional account-based marketing plan with emphasis on identifying net new business opportunities within enterprise level accounts• digital marketing experience in the development of campaign strategy• develop strategy, plan and execute marketing campaigns to support sales initiatives -this includes events, email, online/digital media, direct mail, sponsorships, and advertising• work closely with account development to drive pipeline results • evaluate, measure, and report on all marketing campaign effectiveness and roi on a monthly and quarterly basis


what it takes:   • a minimum of 5 years’ experience in digital marketing programs, campaign development or related experience in enterprise software or b2b company• salesforce and marketing automation (preferably eloqua) experience• strong communication skills as you will be required to work with and persuade many constituents within the organization• strong project management skills to work closely with team members, product marketing, industry experts, and field marketers to ensure timely execution on all campaigns• strong analytical skills to understand the campaign metrics and provide meaningful analysis of the campaign performance leveraging salesforce.com and eloqua reporting and dashboards• a proven track record of building and executing multi-channel campaigns that achieve target goals including leads, pipeline and revenue. • a self-motivated, performance-driven and professional demeanor• bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications or related field is required#li-post

                            at opentext we understand and value diversity in our employees and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. we hire the best talent regardless of sex, national origin, disability or race. if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email accommodationrequests@opentext.com

text:
digital growth marketer - canvaspop - job board view our website view all jobs digital growth marketer ottawa, ontario, canada full time digital marketing mid level canvaspop is a venture-backed b2c e-commerce company focused on delivering personalized wall art and home decor products. winner of startup canada’s global entrepreneurship award. with over 300,000 happy customers around the globe, we’re now looking to grow and innovate the personalized art market using technology and mass customization. we’re looking for an experienced and passionate marketer to lead growth initiatives that can scale. as a growth marketer at canvaspop, you will be responsible for leveraging digital channels to drive traffic that converts. if you’re someone who sees opportunities when others don’t, can gather insights from data, and loves experimenting, then come join our effort to grow canvaspop into a household name! job functions create and carry out growth experiments that drive traffic to canvaspop.com using online channels (content marketing, adwords, facebook ads, email marketing, seo, etc.) strategize and lead the building of optimized landing pages to convert traffic from targeted ppc advertising and retargeting campaigns (facebook, google adwords) assist in the creation and amplification of content (blog posts, infographics, videos, etc.) through distribution on relevant publications use google analytics and other reporting tools to gather insights, track and optimize performance of growth initiatives plan, schedule, and send promotional email campaigns and drip email campaigns; test email content to optimize open and click-through rates    required experience 2+ years of digital marketing experience; driving traffic through paid, earned, and owned channels growth mindset; able to come up with experiments, test and iterate quickly; title: Data Scientist
text:
407 etr | career



skip to content






























search





































career opportunities







data scientist


location:
headquarters


job code:
504


# of openings:
2



description
position summary:
the successful candidate will assist in leveraging customer, digital and transportation datasets to create insights on pricing, marketing and customer behavior. the data scientist will assist the director of data analytics and other key stakeholders to bring actionable data driven solutions to 407etr. this job involves model design, data management, data queries, and providing input into programs and policies. this position is part of a highly collaborative and energetic team in a start-up minded environment.
position responsibility:

assemble and analyze data to understand customer behavior from existing 407 etr data, external data sources and emerging sources.


undertake analysis of target customer groups (segments) for specific marketing and pricing programs and assess opportunities and strategies for marketing.
ad hoc analysis and modeling of data.
ability to understand business stakeholder’s issues and create valuable insight.
raise awareness and action of data science within the company to help focus on fact based decisions.
support the department along with the information technology management department in planning the structure and storage of new customer related data fields.
represent the department in committees within the organization.

qualifications:

a university degree in engineering, statistics, mathematics, or computer science.


minimum 5 years working experience with data science techniques: clustering, regression models, classification, anomaly detection and other machine learning techniques.
minimum 5 years of experience with data analysis tools (eg. sas, r or python) and bi visualization for reporting.
well-developed business analysis, research and creative problem solving skills.
organizational skills and time management skills; planning and project management, and ability to meet multiple deadlines.
strong communication skills and work ethic.
highly collaborative team player with an entrepreneurial spirit.
familiarity with microstrategy is an asset.

note: this job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
accommodations for disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process.

text:
job description - senior director, digital insights (17014161)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior director, digital insights (17014161)job description senior director, digital insights requisition id: 17014161position type: regularposition status: full timejob: marketing/advertisingwork location: canada-ontario-toronto-40 dundas street west 4th floorunposting date: oct 10, 2017, 10:59:00 pm description cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution that’s been providing a full range of financial products and services to 11 million clients for 150 years. at cibc digital we provide personalized, simple, yet flexible digital experiences for our clients, and accelerate revenue growth for our bank. our client-centered approach builds relationships and improves sales and service through our targeted offers, atm, web and mobile channels.
 
working in an agile based startup environment, our team is comprised of talent from across all verticals – banking, consulting, and technology, among others. we brainstorm and incubate ideas at our live labs at mars discovery district where we challenge ourselves to see the world through the eyes of the client, then build and test our way to success. and we have fun while we’re doing it!
 
join our growing team of digital groundbreakers with the bank of the future. you’ll fit right in if you…
 
…think like an entrepreneur
…can see through the client’s eyes
…love to challenge the status quo
…have a passion for all things digital
…understand that collaboration is necessary for success
 
to learn more about cibc’s lines of business check out our website. 
 
to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please visit cibc.com.
 
job overview
 

reporting
to the senior vice president, digital, the senior digital insights is
responsible for setting the vision, strategy and enabling deeper insights to
drive digital sales and to provide support other future state digital
experience strategies on cibc’s online, mobile, social and abm channels.  this includes forming a digital insights
centre of excellence goals and objectives, proactively identifying and developing
tactics to accelerate revenue growth, building and leading a team of seasoned
analytics practitioners, supporting long term online/mobile channel
implementations, and developing strategic partnerships with multiple lines of
business.  this position also works closely with the chief data office, technology
and other internal and external partners to ensure data integrity, and the
efficient and effective management of information reported to and utilized by
the business.the senior director will also maintain a
strong understanding of evolving customer preferences, industry best practices,
performance benchmarks, competitor capabilities and strategies while continuing
to identify ways to enhance sales effectiveness / optimization of client
experiences across online, mobile, app, wearable, and atm technologies using
relevant measurement strategies.what you’ll be doinglead a team responsible for the development and
implementation of measuring online, mobile, app and wearable technology- touch-points
in a consistent and comprehensive manner, including understanding effectiveness
of sales, costs of servicing, campaign cost of sale insights, impact of digital
channels on customer retention and satisfaction, digital channels usage impacts
on customer lifetime value and digital enhancement impacts to overall net
promoter score.rollout of the digital experience and insights
centre of excellence operating model with a high priority placed on operating
efficiencies and processes that will enable the quick turnaround of
deliverables, real time / ad hoc insights, and synergies between other digital
channels teams.push the status quo to dive deeper into
understanding the digital client journey, connecting external traffic drivers,
benchmarks, and other relevant client experience insights to build a cohesive
story and actionable recommendation from data.provide post analysis support for digital sales,
strategy, cibc.com, online banking and mobile banking related initiatives. partner with channel strategy to support proof of
concept assessments involving cross selling from digital and identifying interrelationships
between digital and all major cibc distribution channels.create executive level insights as single point of
contact for use in business case development, revenue forecasting, modelling
and presenting findings at an overall committee level.develop and maintain relationships with key vendors
to investigate leading edge analytical tools, methodologies, and to keep
abreast of best practices across the banking and other sales industries.monitor the performance of digital
channel strategies, policies, programs, to ensure the fulfillment of strategic
objectives. recommend changes to
programs, products or services, or channel offerings as needed.provide authoritative analysis,
interpretation and opinion to support and guide executive management and teams,
ensuring an understanding and acceptance of issues and influence the direction
and nature of programs including digital user experience, digital strategy,
digital optimization, digital sales, and lines of business.at the executive level of the
organization, promote the strategic concepts, analytical tools and
deliverables, and other services provided by the digital experience and insights
team.  support sales, strategy and
partner peers with relevant insights related to adopting the new approaches to
doing business, new digital channel technologies, or new products or channel
enhancements.prepare and present reports on
significant trends impacting digital banking, including client, competitive,
regulatory, and technological or data developments.develop and support high-level
recommendations, approaches and solution for input into cibc overall digital
strategy.drive sales through strategic
project insights and new capabilities eg) implementation on how to complete
e-deposit  what we’re looking for
ability to conduct detailed
     analysis, incorporating comprehensive mathematical, statistical and
     analytical methods, models and guidelines. 
comprehensive knowledge of analysis
     sufficient to interpret and analyze complex concepts and apply these in
     innovative ways.
advanced communication skills
     sufficient to creatively and precisely articulate ideas and opinions that
     involve analysis, interpretation and assessment. 
knowledge and user capability
     of test & learn software.
comprehensive knowledge of
     financial services industry and a solid understanding of cibc distribution
     channels. 
ability to build and retain a
     highly skilled experience and insights team.
deep experience in digital strategy
     development, market/competitive and customer research and analytics;
     relevant strategy experience in product/distribution management
developed knowledge of cibc and
     retail banking industry including products, services and channels.
developed understanding of
     retail financial services distribution, including the challenges
     associated with a complex, multi-channel sales and service environment,
     from a customer and organizational perspective. 
ability to define and make
     recommendations on multi-year strategic business priorities by assessing
     implications of industry-level trends, competitive and internal business
     dynamics, and the evolution of customer needs, preferences and behaviours.
experience and understanding of
     process and technology issues and the impact on customer experience.
proven analytic and problem
     solving skills, including the ability to develop creative, logical and
     practical analytic frameworks; ability to define, assess and prioritize a
     broad portfolio of strategic initiatives. 
demonstrated business judgment
     and ability to prioritize actions or focus, particularly when faced with
     significant complexity or ambiguity. 
proficiency with adobe
     marketing cloud, google analytics, sql, ios, android and various other
     industry leading digital sdk’s and technologies is an asset.

competitive salary and banking benefits

rb is different: ‘good enough’ isn’t good enough here. 
 
rb is the world's leading consumer health and hygiene company, we work with the best people to challenge conventional thinking and keep giving people innovative solutions for healthier lives and happier homes, through our brands like nurofen, strepsils, mucinex, dettol, lysol, finish and vanish.
 


 
a fantastic opportunity is available for a sales analyst to join our sales team. 
  
 

about the role
 
the sales analyst is accountable for supporting the sales team in delivering compelling and fact based insights to drive business building initiatives and is responsible for measuring their impact. key areas of responsibility include supporting the team in identifying and finding solutions to close in-mkt 4ps gaps & improving financial forecasting for channel, and w/ analytical support from retailer and market data sources. 

 




 

responsibilities
 


utilize retailer pos data to compile & interpret in-depth customer analysis and provide recommendations on 4p’s to maximize opportunities (including, but not limited to; stores selling, dc & store level inventory, pre/post promo analysis, display mix, sell through, pricing, etc.).

leverage available market data (markettrack, cross outlet facts, answers online, etc.) to identify business building opportunities.

provide analytics required for rb internal and customer specific presentations.

assist in development and implementation of sales strategy to deliver against budget (ns,gm,ts) and 4p opportunities.

work with cross functional departments to drive customer service level and manage trade deductions within established targets. 

work with account sales team to drive retail effectiveness at store level.

continually monitor store execution and report back findings.

create and continually update reports for the customer sales team including: pos tracker, jbp tracker, flyer/promo trackers, optimum usage, distribution, stores selling, pc points usage, etc

lead the marketing initiatives at the retailer (optimum, bsl, storewide events and inserts) - coordinating with the retailer as well as internal rb teams to ensure timely completion of all components. 

manage the account responsibilities for rcwc and fortino’s.

lead the rep retail coverage for vision store



qualifications
 

university degree in a business related discipline
strong excel skills
ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities while consistently meeting deadlines
detail oriented and organized
strong interpersonal, communication, and team-based skills 
entrepreneurial and ability to take initiative
good knowledge of the consumer packaged goods industry

 
in return rb offer very competitive salaries with excellent benefits and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organisation.
  
apply now for a chance to really change the game!
 
 
we are an equal opportunity employer. in accordance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act, 2005 and the ontario human rights code, rb canada will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. if selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform the talent acquisition team of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

data developer

katie
						  |    											



analytics

posted 2 months ago




website
ruby 


ruby a global technology company that is home to the world’s most unique dating web sites. like relationships, ruby is complex and multifaceted. ashley madison , the flagship brand of ruby , is revolutionizing the way millions of people located around the world connect and meet. as a canadian technology company driven by analytics and user centric design, we care about our customer experience and are continuously looking for ways to make it better!
life is short, be agile and step out of the box. does the idea of working creatively every day with the ability to dig deeper and solve huge problems intrigue you? do you envision yourself working with smart people in a collaborative, fast-paced, environment using the latest technology tools? have you always dreamed about working for a company where you can apply your great talents and continue to learn and grow throughout your career? if you answered “yes” to all of these questions then ruby is the place for you!
we work hard, play hard and have fun. we foster a culture where you can be yourself and where diversity workforce, thought, and opinion is expected.
data developer
as a data developer, some of your duties will include designing a/b test experiments and analyzing their outcomes, data mining user behavioural data, analyzing marketing campaign effectiveness, and making recommendations to improve user site experience.
here’s the team you will be joining
be a data developer, be a rock star of the company!
you will join a dynamic analytics team of data loving, number crunching individuals who drive the business forward. your insights will support all levels of our business by making data driven decisions.
are you passionate about finding insights from numbers? with millions of members worldwide, you will never get bored or worry about sample size when you design a multivariate data experiment. as a team, we consistently do pretty awesome big data work.
we are a leading edge company, and so is our analytics team. we’ve built up a list of cool business intelligence tools and created fancy data visualization dashboards. we explore new technologies in order to keep ourselves at the forefront of the industry.
here’s what you’ll do

work independently from requirements gathering through to shipping code to start off our internal tools and analytics development projects
work with the data scientist team to build out additional tools to support their work, derive new models and analyses, and help take their analysis to the next level (with over 50 million members worldwide, the data base is significant)
continuously identify ways to measure our business and use technology to enhance everything we do
ensure assigned services & written code are maintained to ensure optimum performance (along with writing new tools)
empower the analyst team by augmenting their statistical abilities with software tools to allow for either faster or more complex analysis
build and maintain a suite of user facing data tools and bi applications
ability to “do everything” from system administration, to development, to qa in order to deliver any software product
understand statistical methods and tools to integrate into your software solutions
research the latest information on machine learning and statistics software development and communicate/inform other stakeholders of “what is possible”
other duties as assigned

here’s what you’ll need
experience requirements:

2+ years in full stack software development, demonstrated experience writing web applications
hands-on working knowledge with lamp. we run/host our internal tools on linux, python, apache, mysql, and php.
experience working with mvc frameworks (cakephp, symfony/silex experience is a plus)
expert knowledge with relational database, writing & creating highly optimized queries
strong analytical and quantitative skills—you will work with data scientists.
knowledge with machine learning and distributed big data tools (spark, kafka, hdfs, and cassandra) is a plus
ability to work independently and within a cross functional team environment.

academic requirements:

bsc computer science, engineering or math or, equivalent academic & related work experience.
new graduates welcome

here’s what we provide:

an aggressive compensation package
we are conveniently located just steps from the ttc subway
the opportunity to work with brilliant people in an entrepreneurial, forward thinking environment
friday mixer every week
company-provided lunch every 2 weeks and breakfast every friday
incredible social events

qualified candidates should send a resume and cover letter to human resources. in the e-mail subject line please reference “data developer.“
we thank all applicants for their interest ruby; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
ruby is an equal opportunity employer. we encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including members of designated groups. ruby will provide reasonable workplace accommodation to applicants with disabilities.

title: Inbound Marketing Yoda
text:
pb+j - jobs: inbound marketing yoda - apply online

























all jobs
→
inbound marketing yoda

inbound marketing yoda
toronto, ontario, canada

descriptiontoronto, on or lindsay, onapplication deadline: october 10, 9am, 2017____________________________________________________________________pb+j is looking for a prolific and kick-@$# inbound marketer to join our team full-time. you will be helping lead our exciting expansion into inbound marketing and will be an astronaut of pb+j, blazing new trails into digital space.do you consider yourself a stellar inbound marketer that thinks independently both inside and outside of “the box”? do you possess an unrelenting sense of strategy, creativity, and resourcefulness that would make macgyver jealous? do you live to inbound market, like, you get up in the morning with the desire to figure out "where in the funnel" the cereal box toy would sit (conceptually, of course) in one's cereal buying journey? if so, you just might be the next member of our weird but loveable work family. #jamfamit goes without saying that this role requires a high level of strategic thinking, problem-solving, attention to detail, and the ability to project manage like a boss, but we are looking for so much more (give us a chance to explain ourselves):requirementsbeyond living and breathing inbound marketing, you should have the following: 2+ years of inbound marketing experience a thorough understanding of hubspot, both strategically and technically inbound certification from hubspot academy bonus certs: hubspot marketing software certification or content marketing certification  proven success conceptualizing, executing and managing inbound campaigns an ability to demonstrate that you are an exceptional communicator and extremely process-driven a genuine love for people—you’re not a ‘hide-in-a-dark-room-and-work’ type ability to lead a client and a teama sincere love of learning and sharing—we don’t hoard information here; we are excited when things run smoothly because everyone is in the know; “sharing is caring”, as mr. rogers says. a love of fast-paced workflows and change—you thrive under pressure and love the unpredictable the independence to work with minimal supervision while staying on top of projects with many variables and moving parts you have an affinity for george michael, g.o.b., and the whole gang. the skills required to navigate around meaningful analytics and results tied to kpis, with an ability to use data to inform all decisions an unwavering commitment to the practice and implementation of inbound methodologies  bonus round! some gravy-train skills you should call out if you got 'em: google analytics and/or google adwords management social media management writing experience outside of inbound-related content pieces   as the inbound marketing yoda at pb+j you will be responsible for: managing multiple inbound client accounts and leading the production of a specified set of content pieces on a monthly and quarterly basis (including blogs, ebooks, etc.) goal setting and reporting with clients building and managing a rich content calendar that attracts a qualified audience and meets clients goals comprehensive set-up of new hubspot accounts, and ongoing optimization (strategically, but also ability to lead technically) helping lead the team with all things inbound methodology, including best practices and the ongoing evolution of our inbound marketing offerings and our process thinking outside of your limitations. we’re always challenging ourselves to do better and push our process further. benefits competitive full-time salary group benefits package plus health spending account (hsa) 4 weeks paid vacation unlimited flex time paid christmastime / holiday break downtown toronto (king west) or lindsay (kawartha lakes) office location work remotely: you are expected to be on-site 3 days a week, the others you can work wherever. (as a team, we work on shiny macbooks and are almost entirely cloud-based to make this possible and seamless.) work alongside a young and exciting, culture-driven team in a modern, casual, and creative work environment! if you live by inbound methodologies, get excited about content marketing, and think you’ve got the chops to do it all, point us in the direction of your best work (i.e. an online portfolio or links to sample content) and send us your resume and cover letter. we would love to hear from you!please, no drop-ins. we will certainly be in touch if we think you’re the jam to our peanut butter ;)____________________________________________________________________important: in addition to submitting your resume and work samples, you must also complete a mandatory plum survey at: http://bit.ly/2wgtauw to be considered for this position.____________________________________________________________________about pb+j:if you don’t know us, pb+j is a digital agency that crafts kick @$# brands for even kick @$#-ier entrepreneurs, smbs, and even a few larger brands, just for good measure. we believe great ideas need great strategy, and that great strategy needs great creative. over the past five years, we've worked with over 300 awesome-sauce clients from the usa, canada, and around the world to help them achieve success.we’re all about pushing the norms of design and communication, and we’re not threatened by newness. actually, we embrace it; we love it! we stand out...we do...and we are looking to bring on a new inbound marketing yoda that stands out, too. www.addpbj.com
